column1: [SAK-3020] Student names not sorted alphabetically in Tests & Quizzes::Scores::Questions
column6:
I created an assessment, and had 4 students take it. When I logged back in as the instuctor, and viewed the scores for the test, and selected Questions to see how all students answered the question, I see that the list of names is not alphabetical.

See attached word document with screen shot.

column1: [SAK-3018] Document in Resources with a Link to another Resource file brings user to My Workspace instead of 2nd resource
column6:
One of our faculty posted an Excel spreadsheet in Resources on his course site.

In the worksheet, he put a link to a Word document that was also located in Resources.

When a user clicked on the Excel spreadsheet, opened Excel and then clicked on the link to the Word document, they were brought to their My Workspace instead of to the Word document that the link represented.

However, if the user downloaded and saved the Excel spreadsheet to their local machine and then clicked on the Word document link, their browser then took them to the correct location in Resources and launched Word.

Is there some sort of recursion error that is occurring here? Is this a Sakai behavior or a browser behavior?

Just curious...
column7: Oracle back end, version 2.0.1m2 running on server.  This occurs on both Mac and Windows clients, IE and Firefox
column10: Document in Resources with a Link to another Resource file brings user to My Workspace instead of 2nd resource
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: A comment in an email discussion list indicated that this may be an issue with Microsoft products rather than with Sakai. Apparently Excel adjusts some URLs when moving a file.
column45:
From Dave Ross [dave.ross@gmail.com] Tue 11/29/2005 3:40 PM

I know hyperlinks within Excel sheets can get messed up when Excel sheets are "opened" rather than "saved"... sounds like that's what's happening here. I think what happens is that Excel renames the files as it opens it (because the actual location of the file is in some temp directory) and this somehow corrupts hyperlinks within the spreadsheet. This issue might not affect every version of Excel, either.

-Dave
column49: This seems to work okay in 2.1.0, if you open the spreadsheet in Excel (and not the browser window); Office 2003 and Windows XP. Otherwise, if opened in the Window, then the issue occurs; however, the root cause appears to be outside of Sakai's control.
column75: The issue appears to be outside of Sakai's control. If someone figures out otherwise, please feel free to re-open the issue.

column1: [SAK-3017] Incorrect Question display when questions are of Multiple choice
column6:
When I created an assessment with question types multiple choice single correct answer and multiple choice multiple correct answers, I was unable to see all the choice but one when question has single correct answer. On the other hand, when the question was multiple correct answers, I didn't see any choice available in the Preview Assessment.

I verified this by publishing the assessment to the students. And then logged in as a student to take a test. Questions were written in the same way as it were in Preview Assessment. That is, no choices available for multiple correct answer type and only one for single correct answer type.
column10: Incorrect Question display when questions are of Multiple choice
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I'm not able to reproduce this error on the MIT 006 oracle instance. I created 2 questions in an assessment, a multiple choice single correct question with 4 choices and a muultple choice multiple correct question with 4 choices. I could see all the choices in the assessment, in the preview assessment, and after I published it and took the test as a student, I was able to see all of the choices too.

Which version are you testing with? By the way I'm also using xp and IE 6.0.
column45:
I am able to reproduce it. The point here is if I don't write any text in the text area for choices and pick that choice as correct answer. It does not display the choice because there is no text in it.

In Question 1 of figure 3.MChoiceQuestion01, choices B, C and D do not contain any text so it did not display it (figure2 MCSingleCorrectAnswer). While in Q2 if the same figure Choices A, B, C, D does not contain any text but are marked as a correct choice still the question did not display it.

We can fix it just by making sure that if a choice is correct answer then there should be some text in it or it should display some default text.
column49: We should add vavlidation for those choices. I dont think this bug should be marked as 'critical' though.
column51: C shown blank for students when C and D were left empty.jpg
column75:
I don't think critical either. The have not heard of a pedagogically-based scenario where no data in selections is desireable, but I'm open.

The reason we don't display selections when there is no data is so you don't have questions like the following. What's D in this scenario?
Which color is not in the German flag?
o A. blue
o B. yellow
o C. orange
o D.

This goes with our general design rule of "If there is no data to display, then corresponding labels should not be visible." Soooooo, actually the Questions page in authoring is the offender. When no data has been put in for a selection in the Edit Question page, it should not show on the Questions page.

One exception to this rule and a need for validation is if A, B and D have data, but C doesn't. In this case the instructor should be required to add data into the C selection, otherwise it will display A, B and D only.
column80:
OKay, I added validation for multiple choice and multiple selection as follows:
1/. Must select one correct for single choice correct and at least one correct for multiple choice correct
2/. Correct selection(s) must have a text
3/. Must have at least two answer choices
4/. Must fill choices without gap. ie: if enter text A,B,D and leave C empty. there will be error message to ask for entering choice C.
Or, if A,C,D text entry, there will be error message to enter text for choice B.
It is OK to do A,B,C and leave D empty etc...
column84:
Verified validation items 1, 2, &3 on three instances (HSQLB, MySQL & Oracle)

On item four, the validation worked as stated; however, when I left both answers C & D or just answer D blank, the "blank" answers would appear as blank on the question page. In the "preview assessment" mode, the "blank" answers would not be seen at all. Either the questions page needs to reflect the "preview assessment" mode or the user needs to get an error message when creating the question adivising them to remove the blank "ansers" using the remove link.

Also, I encountered the following while modifying questions (after the questions had been saved):
1. GOOD: When I had answers in ABCD & I would modify the question by deleting C, I would get an error saynig that C was blank. Woo-hoo!
2. NOT SO GOOD: For MCSA, when I had answers in ABCD & I would modify the question by deleting both C & D, upon saving both the question page and the "preview assessment" mode would show C & D as "blank" answers. There would also be a visible formatting space between the lines of C & D.
3. NOT SO GOOD: For MCMA, when I had answers in ABCD & I would modify the question by deleting both C & D, upon saving, not only would the "blanks" be displayed like #2, but as long as I had another answer selected in A or B, any additional answers I chose were also allowed to be keyed as correct answers.
column88:
further to Jodie's comments

a) on MySQL, created single answer multiple choice question, with answers in a and b and c and d blank.
b) published this to students
c) logged in as student; c and d were empty text
column92: C shown blank for students when C and D were left empty
column96: Sorry - as the comment above says, C was shown blank for the students when C and D were left blank in the admin interface.
column100:
Hmmm. I redid Jodie's and Harriet's tests and got slightly different results.

  • Created a MCSA question with ABCD, filled in all four, and then deleted C. When the screen refreshed, the answer that was D had moved up to C This seems like the right behavior. (The same thing happens if I save the question first before deleting C.) In delivery, I saw A, B, and C, with no blank choices.
  • Created a MCMC question with ABCD (c correct) and left D blank. I was able to save the question. In the questions list, D showed up as a blank answer choice. But in both preview and delivery, I saw only A, B and C. This is also as it should be.
  • Created a MCSA question with ABCD (c correct) and then deleted both C and D. In the questions page, in preview, and in delivery only A and b showed up - no unwanted blanks.

-Created a MCSA question with A and B filled in, and C and D left blank. In the questions page, C and D show up as blank choices. In preview and delivery, I see a blank C but no D. This one is not okay.

  • Created a MCSA question with A, B and C filled in, and D left blank. In the questions page, D shows up as a blank choice. In preview and delivery, I see A, B and C only.
column104:
Huong, can you reproduce the problem using these steps? This is how I reproduce it:

1. Create a mc single-answer question with A and B filled in, and C and D left blank. Mark either A or B correct. Save the question.

2. Look at the questions page. It still shows ABCD as the answer choices, and C and D are blank.

3. Preview the assessment. When I do this I see A, B and a blank C (but no D).

4. Publish the assessment and take it as a student. When I do this I see A, B and a blank C (but no D).

It's very weird that the blank answer choices show up in some situations but not others. But I think we should not show any blank choices either in the authoring view of the question or in the student view. Does that make sense?

Let me know if you can't reproduce it on your instance. Thanks, Margaret
column108:
OK here is what I understand the strange things:

1/. If you just enter 2 answers (A,B) and leave all the others (C,D) blank with never fill C and D. Then you will see in editAssisgment - question view is A,B,C,D with of course C,D are blank and in delivery you can see only A,B, not C, neither D
2/. If you enter 2 answer A,B and C, then remove answer in C, never answer D. The editAssignement- question wiew only show ABCD but in student view show A,B and C empty (that should not be. Why ? see * below), not D.

Right now as the program in question view in editAssignment always show all choices( A,B,C,D) even some are empty while the student view only show those are not empty.
Now, to explain * above: in WYSWYG, if you enter something it will create a <P> tag as some sort of paragrap defined. So, if you never enter anything, it does not read anything, but if you enter something and remove like in 2/. above, then it still has something in it. And as our program right now just check for empty string, which is not (as it contain <P>. so it show C with nothing in it in delivery view.

OK, I will try to check to just display non empty text answer for both views and also to make sure trim all the <P> tag to solve 2/.
column112: Checked in fix for the problem above. Margaret. Could you please check? Thanks!
column116:
Still not 100%
Create a MCSA with answers A,B,C,D. A marked as correct. Answers contains word in bold and italics. Modify question and delete C. But html tags remain and C is displayed as blank when student takes quiz.

Create a MCMA with answers A,B,C,D. B and C marked as correct. Modify and delete C and D. But C is still marked as correct. C and D is shown as blank when student takes quiz.

It does check for MCSA that a correct answer cannot be blank
It does check that you need at least 2 answers for MCSA
If you have a MCSA with answers A,B,C,D and afterwards delete B or C it gives error message saying you need to put in an answer for that option

Margaret -
Thanks, for trying ... Here is what I see:
I followed step like Greg tested and I found.

A,B,C,D with A is correct. After remove choice C(by clicking on remove button), the content of choice D is now shifted to choice C and there is no more D - This is correct.
In student View, I see it exactly as it showed in admin view: a,b,c which is correct.

MCMC:
A, B,C,D with C,D correct. Well, according to Greg, if he removed choice C and D. There were only A and B left. How could it show C correct?

column128:
Hi Greg,

Huong and I have a question about SAK-3017 Closed , a Tests&Quizzes bug about multiple choice questions in authoring and delivery. You reported you were still seeing problems back in April:

(quoted previous comment)

For "delete", do you mean using the Remove link to delete the answer choices altogether, or leaving the answer choices but erasing the text? Huong tried following the steps above both ways on her instance, and could not reproduce the problem. If the answer choice was deleted altogether, then any following answer choices moved up to close the gap. If an answer choice was left blank, she got an error when she tried to save the modified question. (Unfortunately I haven't been able to find another qa instance stable enough to test on - they all throw exceptions. Do you know of one?)

Can you let us know if you're still seeing this problem, and on which instance(s)? Are we understanding your description correctly?

Thanks!
Margaret
column132:
Greg sez:

Hi
Tested on qa1-za running 2.2.003 / mysql

Issue seems to be resolved. In both MCSA and MCMA -
i) correct answer cannot be blank
ii) need to select a correct answer. MCMA is happy if you only choose 1.
iii) If you have options A, B, C, D if you delete the text in C it asks you to put in some text.
iv) If you delete the text in D it simply removes the choice.

column1: [SAK-3016] Foreign Character Encoding Issue
column6:
Hi,

I just checked version 2.1.0_005 and the issue of incorrectly drawing characters is better, but still not completely fixed; at least it did not take down Sakai. As the attached screen image will show, the Title of an assignment is mangled; for comparison, the title should be the same as is shown in the assignment body.

A separate, but related additional note: in another test, I have foreign characters in the title of a MS Word document I uploaded as an assignment attachment. When the title was stored in the database, the foreign characters were replaced by regular characters. That is, "Fore[accent grave]ign Do[accent acute]cument.doc" is in the database as "Foregin Document.doc."

Hope this is clear and makes sense.

Jim
column7: Mac OS X 10.4.3; MySQL 4.1.12 standard (UTF-8 character set); MySQL-Connector-Java 3.1.10; Safari 2.0.2; Firefox 1.0.7
column10: Foreign Character Encoding Issue
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

I just tried on the MIT stable builds, both with MySQL(http://sakai-stable.mit.edu:8030/portal/) and with Oracle(http://sakai-stable.mit.edu:8120/portal/), but I cannot reproduce the problem there. Foreign characters work fine on both machines.

Could you please try it on stable builds, too? It might be the configuration differences between your deployment and that of MIT stables.

Thanks,

column45: Jim, we haven't been able to reproduce this error. If you have more information, please feel free to re-open the issue.
column49:
Hi Peter, et al,

Yesterday M. Nakamarar sent an email pointing out an error in the documentation which carried over to some implemetnations of the sakai.propoerties file:

It looks like the url@javax.sql.BaseDataSource directive in sample sakai.properties has problem.

The original line

url@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=jdbc:mysql://127.0.0.1:3306/sakai?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF-8

should be

url@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=jdbc:mysql://127.0.0.1:3306/sakai?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF-8

Note '&'.

I looked at my sakai.properties file and corrected this error. Unfortunately, after a restart and another attempt, I'm still having issues. I uploaded a MS Word doc called "Føréign Chàràctêr Tëst.doc" into resources. It uploads fine and does not kill Sakai (as in the past). However, upon downloading the file, the name has been changed to "ign Cha9ra9cte_r TeAst.doc".

A screenshot at http://collab.sakaiproject.org/access/content/attachment/d8afcfe8-354a-4736-00ef-5b31325c8018/Picture%202.png shows how the file upload appears correctly in the display, but the record in the XML field of my MySQL db content_resource table confirms this mangling:

column75: Zhen, could you take another look at this issue using a file like Jim's example? (Or maybe even Jim's exact file, if he posts it as an attachment, and Jira doesn't mangle the foreign characters itself.) There's also been traffic regarding this on sakai-dev, which you probably saw, but there might be some other pointers in there too. Thanks.
column80: As Peter's request, here is a test file.
column84:
Jim,

What you saw, FZre:ign Cha9ra9cte_r TeAst.txt, is a part of the resource id, not the file name. In Resources tool, we are using Sakai's escape mechanisms to form proper resource id depends on the uploaded file's file name. The resource id is internal to Sakai. If you go to "Revise properties", the file title should still remain as "Føre¿ign Cha¿ra¿cte¿r Te¿st.txt".

Do you still think this is a problem?

Thanks,

  • Zhen
column88:
Hi Zhen,

Yes, it is still a problem because the file that is downloaded from Resources by the browser is called "ign Cha9ra9cte_r TeAst.doc" instead of the original "Føréign Chàràctêr Tëst.doc". And I believe this is not a browser problem because we find "ign Cha9ra9cte_r TeAst.doc" in the database's XML field.

Does that make sense?

Thanks,

Jim
column92:
OK. I agree with you that this is a problem.

-Zhen
column96:
I found the escapeResourceName doesn't do a proper job to start with when creating resource id. The last part of final id is "FZre:ign Cha9ra9cte_r TeAst.doc", notice the ':' char inside, it should not be there if, according to escapeResourceName in Validator.java, 'e¿' or alike chars should be replaced by 'e' only, not by "e:".

When debugging through the code, I found the length of String "Føre¿ign Cha¿ra¿cte¿r Te¿st.doc" is 31, instead of 26, which means e¿ is considered as two characters, e and the accent sign. So the loop-and-replace mechanism in escapeResourceName will not work as expected.

The redundant ':' turns out to cause problem later on when the file is downloaded. Validator's getFileName() is called, which takes last characters in id till a \ or / or :. That's why we have the truncated "ign Cha9ra9cte_r TeAst.doc" when dowloaded. Of course, there are other escaping problems in the other characters...

It is out of my scope for now. I will assign the ticket to Jim. He is the expert on this.

  • Zhen
column100:
Hi,

My developer supplies this note: "In addition to this, Firefox and Safari seem to submit the characters differently. E.g. Firefox submits one Unicode character é (U233), whereas Safari & Opera send two chars: plain letter 'e' + U769 (just an apostrophe that combines with the previous character). Both are valid under Unicode spec, and source of grief for developers.

"When displaying a page, Firefox apparently doesn't know how to combine two chars (submitted by Safari) into a single accented char, and shows squares for accent chars."

Hope that helps,

Jim
column104:
I believe that it doesn't matter whether we have a 26-character or 31-character sequence when we are creating the resource-id. We could use any arbitrary sequence of characters for the resource id, as long as it is a valid id and it uniquely identifies the resource. So if we have a "correct" method of morphing those characters into a valid id, it doesn't matter which one we start with. We might get a 31-character id when the resource is uploaded with Safari, and if another copy of the same file is uploaded through Firefox, we'd get a different resource id. But that's OK, because they would need to wind up with different resource-id's anyway.

It sounds like the remaining problem may be our handling of the colon (':'). I just created a folder named "empty:folder". I then added an uploaded file to it named "jim2.zip". The access servlet for that file is:

http://localhost:8080/access/content/group/X1/empty%3Afolder/jim2.zip

Notice that the colon is escaped to "%3A". That's happening when the access url is placed in the document, not when the folder is created. But Zhen points out a problem with having ':' in a resource-id because some file systems may use ':' as a path delimiter (is that still true?). So maybe we need to eliminate ':' if it occurs in a candidate for a resource id. Would that solve the current problem?
column108: Maybe the problem is that the resource-id is used as the filename when the resource is downloaded. It doesn't really matter what id we use internally. Jim's comments indicate that the problem occurs on download because the filename is longer meaningful.
column112: Is this still an issue as of 2.2.0?
column116: Adding version 2.2.1 to affected versions
column124: Yes. I just tested it on QA3-US and the issue remains.

Mac OS X 10.4.9; FF 2.0.0.3; Safari 2.0.4

column1: [SAK-3013] Identify and Consider Other Options for "View" Types

Perhaps it could be changed to "View Time, No Date" to make it clear to new users?
column10: Identify and Consider Other Options for "View" Types
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: After some informal discussion this is being flagged as a feature request to identify and consider other options for "view" selections in Chat.
column45:
Currently the options in 2.1.0 are: Time Only [default], Date and Time, Date Only, and Neither Date or Time. What are other options for text here? (Perhaps "View Only Time", as cited in original issue report) is from an earlier version of Sakai?)

In Schedule, which similarly displays data in different "temporal" views, "by" is used as part of the text (e.g., Calendar by Week). Here that might translate into options for: Messages by Time, Messages by Date, Messages by Date and Time, and Messages. Or, another option, which I prefer more, would be to use "with": Messages with Time, Messages with Date, Messages with Date and Time, and Messages with no Date or Time.

Also, if one clicks on the drop down, then the alternatives to "View Time" are clearly displayed.

column1: [SAK-3011] Presentation tool case-sensitive in looking for "Presentations" folder.
column6:
The Presentation tool is not recognizing that the "presentations" folder exists in the Resources tool in both the hSQL and the Oracle instances. The MySQL instance is working fine.

Steps:
1. In the "Resource" tool of a worksite, create a directory called "presentations"
2. In the "presentations" folder, create a subdirectory
3. In the subdirectory, place a bunch of image files.
4. Go to the "Presentation" tool and click "Refresh" if necessary.

EXPECTED RESULT:
The name of the subdirectory should be listed under 'Title" and the "View | Show" options should be available.

ACTUAL RESULT:
Getting a "Presentations folder does not exist in Resources" message.
column10: Presentation tool case-sensitive in looking for "Presentations" folder.
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: This is probably a case-sensitivity issue. Presentations tool is expecting a Presentations folder (upper-case P).
column45:
Aah! You are correct. It is case sensitive.

In trying to test your hypothesis, I ran into other problems.

1. Going in and revising the properties of the folder (changed the name so that I can have the upper case), does change the title, but I guess the underlying information remained the same because the "Presentation" tool still did not recognize the folder. Because of this, I tried a little experiment. I went ahead and created a "Presentations" folder in Resources, and so now I have 2 "Presentations" folders. See resource.gif attachment.

2. Now that I have a "Presentations" folder in Resources, I go to the Presentation tool and, BEHOLD! I'm getting a response that indicates that there is no Presentations folder but which also gives me the current content of the folder. See presentation.gif attachment.
column49: Nadine, the two points above are related to issues with how Sakai treat's a Resource's Title, filename, and URL; see SAK-7863 Closed .
column75: Peter, I agree that it is the same problem so I'm closing this one as a duplicate issue.
column80:
Oops. The case-sensitivity part still needs to be addressed.

Reopening.
column84: Since case sensitivity is the only issue, changing it to minor
column88: This is really a limitation/quirk of ContentHosting - I would prefer to see this fixed someday in Content Hosting - rather than adding a bunch of special case code to the Presentations tool.

column1: [SAK-3003] When a timed assessment is created, subsequent assessments will have the same time set automatically
column6:
When a timed test is created, subsequent tests created will have the length of that timed test preset under the Timed Assessment settings. However, the checkbox to turn the test to a Timed Assessment is not checked.

1. Create assessment.
2. Go to settings and make it a timed assessment with an appropriate time.
3. Save settings.
4. Make a new assessment.
5. Go to settings; there will be a time already entered under Timed Assessment.

In itself, this is fairly harmless; the test will publish without any protest, and will not appear as a timed test to the test-takers. However, it interacts in an unfortunate way with SAK-2920 Closed , where an imported test will come in with Timed Assessment prechecked. Normally that part of the SAK-2920 Closed bug will result in a "Please specify a time limit under Timed Assessment" warning, since it has no time set. But this bug affects both created and imported tests, so an imported test may suddenly have both a checkmark and a time, allow it to silently publish as a timed test.
column10: When a timed assessment is created, subsequent assessments will have the same time set automatically
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: It turns out that the time does not just propagate to newly created assessment; it propagates to previously created assessments in the same worksite/author pool, including some that have timed test checked.
column45: This bug is not dependent on creation; instead, what happens is that when an assessment with a blank time is accessed, it picks up the time setting from whichever assessment was previously accessed, and this will propagate forward I.e., if you look at a blank one and it gets set to X time, the next blank one will also get set to X.
column49: Daisy, from what I see, the time doesn't get propagated to a previously created assessment but it does get propagated to a newly created assessment. You can verify with Laura again. The problem is that the pulldown list is not getting reset when the form is loaded.
column75:
svn# 4283 - reset timer if timeLimit is null
M ui/bean/author/AssessmentSettingsBean.java

please ck about the rebuild tomorrow.
column80:
No, it does get propagated to previously created assignments, but only when you access them. Steps to reproduce this:

1. Import a test with time set to 0:00 three times.
2. Go to the first test, confirm that time is still 0:00.
3. Go to test 2, and set time to 1:05.
4. Go to test 3. Time will show as 1:05. Change time to 2:05.
5. Return to test 1. Time will show as 2:05.

Points: It will not override a time set by hand, and the 'overriding' of a blank time is not permanent.

6. Go to test 2 (time manually set in step 3). The time will show as 1:05, not 2:05.
7. Go back to test 1. The time will show as 1:05, not 2:05 as it did in step 5.

But the overriding of a blank time is not just an illusion:

8. Publish test 1 (currenty showing 1:05).
9. Go to the published test. Time will show as 1:05 (and cannot be edited).

If you publish again with the Timed Assessment checkmark on, and then take the test as a student, you will have a timed test of 1:05.

Interestingly, publishing seems to lock down the time:

10. Visit test 3 (time manually set to 2:05). Visit test 1; time will still be set at 1:05.

Also, the 'timed test' checkmark is clearing on timed tests when you visit a non timed test and then go to to a timed test. I think this is new, and I'll file it as a separate bug once I confirm across the three instances.
column84: The above steps were tested on the MIT 006 from 11/29 (yesterday afternoon), not this morning's nightly build.
column88: In regards to the footnote above, about the 'timed test' checkmark clearing – this turned out just to be an issue of the 006 Oracle instance having trouble saving settings. It's not consistent enough to file as a bug yet, as it appears to be caused by the slowness, not anything inherent in the code.
column92: Fix tested as working on all three instances.

column1: [SAK-2999] randomize option for mc questions is reset on import/export
column6:
Multiple choice questions have a "randomize answers" option. If you set it to "yes" for a question and then export and re-import the assessment, the option will be reset to "no".

This would be a trivial issue except that instructors who import/export assessments are very likely to do so with large batches of multiple choice. And you really want your multiple choice answers to be randomized as a rule. Resetting them all one at a time after import would be very time-consuming.

Seems straightforward to reproduce, but let me know if you want steps.

column1: [SAK-2997] Clarify sakai.properties file
column6:
Hi,

I struggled this past weekend to install Sakai and the reason ended up that I was using an incorrect version of the distributed sakai.properties file. It turns out there are three different versions of the sakai.properties file distributed in the source code:

1) in /docs/
2) in /demo/
3) in /kernel/componnent/src/conf/org/sakaiproject/config

The one in kernel... was actually outdated because it included the java.beep property (which is "no longer used" according to the "Sakai Properties.doc" document on November 7, 2005).

While I recognize this may be a pre-release issue, there are two different versions in the released version of 2.0.1 (in /demo and /docs).

Might I suggest a couple things: a) have a header comment on which version of Sakai a sakai.properties file refers to because properties change; b) keep only one document or make it clear in a header comment where the authoritative version exists; c) have a header comment refer to the excellent "Sakai Propoerties.doc" file.

Cheers,

Jim
column10: Clarify sakai.properties file
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

column1: [SAK-2994] Deletion of single instances of events that occur with frequency results in incorrect "number of occurences" info
column6:
I've discovered that if I create an event that occurs monthly 5 times & then I delete the first 2 instances of the event, the remaining 3 events still say "Frequency Every 1 month(s) , Number of occurrences: 5 Times " in the event detail.

To replicate:
-create an event that occurs on the 1st of the month. Make the frequency 1 month & the occurence 5 times
-For example, you'll have an event on Dec 1, Jan 1, Feb 1, Mar 1, Apr 1

Now delete the first 2 occurences (Dec 1, Jan 1)
-select Dec 1, click Delete, choose "Delete only this occurence". Repeat for Jan 1.
-The Dec 1 and Jan 1 occurences will be deleted correctly, however, if you click on the Feb1 event to view the detail, the frequency information is incorrect. It will say "Frequency Every 1 month(s) , Number of occurrences: 5 Times " even though the event really only now occurs 3 times since the first 2 were cancelled.
column10: Deletion of single instances of events that occur with frequency results in incorrect "number of occurences" info

column6: When importing events from a Meeting Maker text export file, the dates in the file read 11/09/2005, but the imported dates all read 11/08/2005. I am using Pacific Standard Time. The imported file is using Eastern Standard Time. Times seem correct, but the dates are not.

column75: Dawn, if you could provide the file you used and if you could clarify what was using which timezone that might help in tracking this down. (Was the Meeting Maker export using Pacific and the computer you tried to import it on running with Eastern as the OS timezone?). Also, just in case it makes a difference, at what time of day did you do the export and the import? Thanks.
column80:
I will attaching a copy of the file that I used for the Meeting Maker import.
My Mac OS is set for Eastern Standard Time
I updated the Preferences for the Time Zone tool to be Pacific Standard Time.
The Meeting Makder file I used was created in Eastern Standard Time.

I did not do the export someone else in the office created it, but the file was probably imported sometime in the afternoon (1 - 4 EST).
column84: Here is the Meeting Maker file I used.
column88: Joanne, I'm able to reproduce this on the QA servers with the attached file and by setting the timezone to Pacific in my Sakai preferences. (The computer I tried form is Windows XP and the OS timezone was set to Eastern.) The times are all adjusted correctly from their Eastern to Pacific values, however, the day is adjusted from Nov 9 to Nov 8, which is not correct. (Attached is a screen shot of the import confirmation screen showing the incorrect values.)
column92:
The problem is the MeeingMakerReader class is ignoring the time zone, and assuming the date/times are in the user's local time zone. Unfortunately, there is no easy answer (that I can find). The format that Meeting Maker uses to describe a time zone (e.g. "USA Eastern") is different than the format used by the java.util.TimeZone class (e.g. "America/Detroit"or "EST"). Since both Sakai and Meeting Maker support international timezones, the problem is larger than mapping just a handful of US time zones.

One solution would be to echo the Meeting Maker time zone string when asking the user to confirm the import (perhaps with some help text advising users to export in the same time zone they wish to use when importing into Sakai).
column96: Upon closer examination, there is another problem in addition to the MeetingMakerReader class ignoring timezone. The skew in the date/time noted in this bug report is a result of importing events into a Sakai instance where the user's default time zone is different the the server's time zone. The MeetingMakerReader class (along with the OutlookReader and CSVReader classes) incorrectly subtract the difference in timezones repeatedly until the imported events are off by a day.
column100:
Fixes: Localize error messages and fix bug which skews the date/time of imported events
when the user's timezone differs from the server's default time zone.
Additionally, imported date formats are now sensitive to a user's locale.

Committed revision 11630.
column104: verified this is working. All events import into the correct times and days. Sakai (r12860)

column1: [SAK-2985] When none of the permissions are given to student/TA, warning message problems
column6:
When none of the permissions are given to a student, a warning message appears saying "you are not allowed to view the assignment." This message is replicated several times, according to the number of assignments the instructor has posted. Only one message should be given, and it might be rephrased to "you are not allowed to view the assignment(s)"
The student's window still lists those assignments that are open and have no submissions. When you click on one of these assignments, a VelocityServer error appears. If the student is not given 'read' permissions, should he still be able to see the assignment titles?

If the TA is given not given any permissions, it acts a little different. The TA will see the list of all open assignments (even those with submissions) and no warning shows on top (the "you are not allowed to view the assignment" message). When an assignment is clicked, then the VelocityServer error shows up.

column1: [SAK-2983] When instructor gives only 'revise' permission to TA, nothing is given to TA
column6:
When an instructor gives only 'revise' permissions to a TA, the TA sees no changes. For the TA to be able to revise an assignment, he has to be given both 'revise' and 'new' permission, OR 'revise' and 'grade' premissions.

In these cases, the TA is also given the remove column (but not the checkboxes) and the 'update' botton. These should not be shown without the 'delete' permissions.
column10: When instructor gives only 'revise' permission to TA, nothing is given to TA
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Checked on MySQL and HSQL instances, 2.1.1.002. Closing

column1: [SAK-2982] When TA is  only given 'new' permissions, other options also shown to TA
column6:
When an instructor gives the TA only 'new' permissions, the TA also sees the 'grade' link, the 'duplicate' link, and the 'remove' column with the update button.

The TA can't actually grade the assignments, the 'grade' link takes him to the 'student view' window.

It would seem to the TA that the 'duplicate' link does nothing, but when pressed, the instructor does see a copy of the assignment. If the TA is supposed to be able to duplicate assignments with the 'new' permission, then he should be given a notification that he has done a duplication.

The remove column does not have the checkboxes for the assignments, so the TA can't remove assignments. But the 'update' button appears, and when pressed, it gives a warning message that an assignment box should be checked first. Since the TA has no 'delete' premissions, than he should not see the remove column or the 'update' button.
column10: When TA is  only given 'new' permissions, other options also shown to TA
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

Fixed in r4395.

TA should at least get one more permission "asn.read" to make the application sensible.

  • Zhen
column45: Checked three Sakai instances, solved.

column1: [SAK-2981] When TA is given permission to Delete an assignment, no option for deleting is displayed to TA
column6:
The instructor gives 'delete' permissions to the TA, but the TA is unable to delete any assignments. The remove column with the checkboxes is not showing up to the TA.

If the TA is given permissions to 'delete' and also the 'new' permissions, the TA is shown the remove column with the checkboxes, but an error messages appears when trying to remove an assignment - "you are not allowed to remove .."

For the TA to be able to delete an assignment, he needs to be given the 'new', 'delete' and 'revise' permissions.

The TA (or student) should be able to delete an assignment if the 'delete' permissions is given, or not given the option if he cannot really remove an assignment.
column10: When TA is given permission to Delete an assignment, no option for deleting is displayed to TA
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Assignment deletion is "soft", which simplely marked the deleted property "CHEF:assignment_deleted" (sorry about the CHEF-sound name) to be true instead of deleting the whole assignment record. Hence "asn.revise" is needed for modifying the property.

Right now, delete checkbox is shown based on "asn.delete" permission. However, "asn.revise" is needed in order to make the selected assignment disappear from list. Otherwise, an alert will be shown as "Alert: You are not allowed to edit the assignment."

As a Post-2.1 work, we need to think about the general approach for deleting objects in Sakai. This ticket can wait until an decision is made.

  • Zhen
column45:
Fixed in r11200.

Now that with grouping functionality, TAs by default doesn't have assignment delete permission in the site level, but rather inside the group level. Need to check the above permission based on each assignment's reference.

  • Zhen

column1: [SAK-2974] Standardize on Schedule or Calendar
column6: The "Schdule" tool is labeled as Schedule in the left-hand column, however, all the views are labled as Calendar, e.g., Calendar by Week, Calendar by Month. column1: [SAK-2970] Rich client for testing
column6: Students tend to be more demanding about testing speed and functionality than just about any other part of a CMS. It's no surprise this is the case because its easier to be more forgiving of technology when you aren't doing something that is potentially timed or high stakes. This is a challenge for testing because the fallibility of the internet often creates situations where testing delivery is rendered sluggish....a student has to wait a couple of seconds while one answer is submitted and the next question is loaded. To create a snappier interface, it would be good to use remote scripting (maybe Ajax?) which will allow question answers to be submitted asynchronously. The next question can display to the student even if the network is bottlenecking and taking a little while for the answer to be submitted to the server. There are complications and challenges here. One wants to move to a richer client to create a little more independence from the current state of the network. On the other hand, this independence has to be managed carefully so that if a lot of questions are answered that haven't yet been submitted successfully to the server there's a way of caching these so that they are submitted eventually and not lost. Students will be well served if they can take a test for an hour without glitches even if the network is up and down. But they won't be served well if at the end of that hour there work isn't eventually saved to the server.
column7: For broadest access, rich client should be built using current browser technology.

column1: [SAK-2965] Importing a test using a text format that is simpler than IMS compliant format.
column6:
Of course its important to be able to import tests in IMS compliant format but this format is too difficult for instructors to create on their own. Instructors should be able to import tests using a syntax they can understand. Here is an example of a possible syntax for four of the main question types (multiple choice, multiple response, short answer and essay). A more advanced grammar can also include options for specifying feedback and media but it shouldn't get too complicated. The emphasis should be on simplicity. Surprisingly, we've found this feature to actually be more important than being able to create questions in a GUI

1. What color do you get when you mix blue and yellow?
a. orange
b. purple
c. green
d. brown
ans: c

2. Which of the following are primary colors?
a. red
b. orange
c. purple
d. blue
e. yellow
f. green
ans: a, d, e

3. What do you get when you mix blue and red?
ans: purple; violet

4. What is your favorite color and why?
ans: essay
column10: Importing a test using a text format that is simpler than IMS compliant format.
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I think we may be more successful by adding specific quiz/question pool import types such as Respondus or other popular quiz creation systems.

I'm currently translating old webCT files that export as text, and the content model for questions, answers and feedback is specific to that system/version. This is my 3rd translation project and I can tell you that there are no easy assumptions for how questions can be modeled in text or even qti-compliant xml.

What would be great is to question or faculty base and get feedback from them about what quiz development systems they use, and then prioritize this list for developing import choices for Tests & Quizzes.

My 2 cents.
column45: This could potentially be implemented using wiki software, where the different answer types would be labelled with macro tags. Nice thing about that is you could implement a "preview" that would immediately translate the assessment text into the student view.
column49:
Hi Luke,

I was pointed to this jira item by Lisa. Here in CMC, we created a tool to import questions from WebCT or Word Doc as long as the questions are formatted in the required way. Feel free to use it here:

http://webapps.cmc.edu/sakai_quiz_tool

The questions are required to formatted in the following way:

Question 1 (10 points)
When will WebCT license expire in CMC?

*a. 6/30/07
b. 6/30/08
c. 6/30/09
d. 6/30/10

Save answer

Question 2 (10 points)
The U.S.'s greatest trading partner is Canada.

*a.True
b. False

Save answer

Question 3 (10 points)
What color is a violet? ____

*Blue

Save Answer

Right now, it's been tested to work with multiple choice, true and false, and fill in blank questions in English and Spanish. It works in Firefox, IE, and Safari. However, if there are images, you will have to upload those images later in the Sakai quizzes one by one.

Thanks again for your interest.

column1: [SAK-2964] Feedback settings -- including time span option
column6:
There are some additional feedback parameters that would be helpful for faculty to have. Here are some of them:

-Only provide feedback after test run is complete. (the test run is complete after the test is no longer available to take)
-Only provide feedback at testing centers.
-Password protect feedback (this one isn't used that much but the instructors who want it really want it)
-Provide feedback for ______ days after test run is complete.
-Provide feedback for ______ days after student completes test.
(Both of these latter options simplify reconfiguration of settings when an instructor uses a test semester after semester. Instead of having to reset the availability and review dates they only have to set the availability dates)

I've included a snapshot of how we configure some of these options in our homegrown testing app. These features were added organically over many years so they might not be the best way to design things when starting from scratch. But they do give a sense of what mature testing cultures need in terms of review features.

column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
UC Davis is also looking for these additional feedback settings, especially feedback after the test is run.

Providing feedback during the test is not a good option as this allows students to change their answers - I'm not sure why this is even allowed. Requiring a specific date robs the student of timely feedback.

Are we still considering these requests?

column1: [SAK-2963] Page Deletion
column6:
Page deletion isn't normally a problem for wikis, as a page is as alive as the links into it, and pages simply fade away.

Now we've the index view, though, old pages clutter up the index. For example, a page I've split up and put into a subspace, moving foo to foo/Home, means that foo now appears in the index, and clutters it up. Approaches other than deletion would include ignoring empty pages in the index, and having a hide facility in the index, or just telling me to live with it!

I know this may be a difficult problem, so it's not a request to do something, just that we keep on thinking about the issue. If I have any bright ideas, I'll let you know.
column10: Page Deletion
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: We have also had user requests for this (specifically related to old pages showing up in the index)
column45: There's also the soft/hard delete approach. Any user with appropriate permissions in some wikis can delete a page, which moves it to the trashcan. The deleted page can then be moved from the trashcan back into service or purged and permanently deleted.
column49:
Thinking more about this, here's how I think of these two cases:

1. Soft delete: The user no longer wants the page, and doesn't want it to appear in the index. But wiki-like, the page history should still be around, but the current revision could say "(This page has been deleted)" (or something). The revision history could still allow users with appropriate rights to revert to a previous version (or someone could create a new page with the same name).

2. Hard delete: Some content has been placed on a page that the wiki owner does not want, not even the revision history / older versions (e.g. something which is a copyright violation, libellous, offensive, etc.). The user can then choose a hard delete which also deletes history.

So the 'Delete page' option could have two choices: delete this page, including history, or delete this page (retaining history).
column75: Surely a fix to no longer wanted pages appearing in the index is to use the 'pages linking to this page' to filter out null entries.
column80:
Our instructors are looking for a "delete of last resort" feature. At the moment, they can permanently delete a student's chat posting, her discussion posting, basically anywhere except Assignments and the wiki. As for Assignments, well, that's presumed private between the instructor and student anyway. But the wiki is public to the class. If Bad Student1 creates a page called Slam_Student2, and posts inappropriate content there, the content stays on the wiki even after Bad Student1 has been arrested.

Soft deletes are conveniences, but in some cases a hard delete is where the rubber meets the road. Much as I would counsel against it in all but the most dire situations, it seems like a campus/class wiki might require an option to hard delete content.
column84: SAK-5496 Closed inorporates this Feature Request. I am transfering the votes there to collect all thoughts in one place

column1: [SAK-2952] Error page does not set a Content-Type header and renders as text/plain when proxied through HTTP
column6: When the error page is rendered it is rendered without setting the Content-Type HTTP Header. This means that if the tomcat instance is proxied, by mod_proxy or mod_ajp, into Apache HTTP it get's the default content-type set (text/plain). This causes the page to render as the source code.

column45:
I didn't find the inital description of the problem very clear, so I may not have reproduced it correctly, but I don't see the list of anonymous students yet to take the assignment that I was expecting.

on 2.1.2.008, QA3

I have a course with two students, student and studentX

I create a Samigo assessment with anonymous grading

Student takes the assessment. StudentX does not take the assessment.

Scores shows the details for the student who has submitted, but no 'anonymous' for studentX who has not submitted.
column49:
This is by design. We only show students who have not submitted when the assessment is published as non-anonymous grading. The rationale behind this is that if it's anonymous grading, it doesn't provide any information if we show studenX's entry. You can, however, get the list of all students in the 'Submission status' page. There is a 'Date' column indicating if a student has submitted or not.

If you have any questions, please feel free to reopen the bug. I can get it back to our interaction designer.

column1: [SAK-2947] student scores link depends on user name  fields
column6:
found on all local and MIT stable instances

Steps to reproduce:

1. Publish an assessment with the "graders can see student's identities" setting on.

2. Create an account with a username, but no first name or last name field.

3. Take the assessment as that user and submit it for grading

4. View the Total Scores for the assessment. The user will be listed as "Anonymous", and you can click on that to get to the student scores page.

5. View the Question Scores page for the assessment. The user will not have any submission ID or name link at all - you can't get to student scores for that user.

Fix: Entries for users with no fullname fields in the question scores page should at least say "Anonymous". It'd be even better if we could use the userid instead, as there might be several "Anonymous"es taking a test.

column1: [SAK-2946] link to model SA shows up even when there isn't one
column6:
This isn't a loss of functionality or a critical problem, but it is very visible.

The short answer question type includes a "model short answer" feedback field. If you publish an assessment with a short answer question but don't put anything in that field, then students taking the assessment will still see the "Model short answer - click here" link in delivery. If they click on the link, it'll just refresh the page.

When you grade the assessment, you'll also see the "Model short answer-click here" link. If you click on it, it'll either refresh the page (MIT stable instances) or bring up a blank pop-up window (local instances).

column41:
This problem occurs on the MySQL and Oracle instances, but not the HSQL. To reproduce:

1. Create an assessment.
2. Add a question.
3. Go to settings.
4. Hit Publish. You will get the "Are you sure that you want to publish this assessment? Once an assessment is published it cannot be removed, it can only be retracted from student access." warning.
5. Hit Publish again. You will get the " Warning: A gradebook entry could not be created for this assessment. Please contact your local help desk for assistance." warning.

The assessment cannot be published due to this error.

column1: [SAK-2940] The "View" option not working as expected.
column6:
On the Announcement page, the default "View" option is "All"

If you change the "View" option to "Public," all the "public" sites are shown.
If you change the "View" option to "By group," ALL the announcements are shown.

ASSUMPTION:
"By group" covers Groups, Sections, and this site.

ISSUE:
Should the "public" announcements show up when viewing "By group?" Why have the "By group" option then?
column10: The "View" option not working as expected.
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: When creating an announcement you can select how it is displayted: Display to public, Display to site, or Display to selected groups. When you select view "Public" you will only see announcements displayed which were created with the "Display to public" setting. When you select view "By group" you will any "Display to Public" Announcement plus any which were created with the "Display to selected groups" setting, if you are member of the appropriate group. (A default registered user has acess to all groups, so you probably want to make use of the default Roles to really test this with Instructores, Students, and TAs.)
column45:
My issue with this is that if you are in a particular group, when you log in, you are able to view only those announcements to which you are a group member + any public announcements. This comes up, by default, as the "All" view option. So, selecting "By group" doesn't seem to have any use. You're seeing the same announcement list you'd see if you selected "All."

One observation, when you select "By group," if the announcement is a part of more than one 'group' there is no space or comma separating the list of groups to which the announcement is associated. It all becomes one word.
column49: See SAK-3141 Closed to track the fix for Nadine's last comment above, "One observation, when you select "By group," if the announcement is a part of more than one 'group' there is no space or comma separating the list of groups to which the announcement is associated. It all becomes one word."
column75:
"By Group" covers Groups, Sections, and site range announcements. If the announcement is made to multiple groups/sections, it will be listed multiple times in "By Group" view, one for each Group/section.

The problem has been fixed with the fix to "SAK-2979: Announcement By Group view doesn't list announcement to multiple groups as separate entries" in r4175.

Thanks,

  • Zhen

column1: [SAK-2928] Sites with more than 10 Announcements do not display properly (sort order is wrong, sorts wrong group of announcements)
column6:
When a site has more than 10 announcements (the default number of items viewed when looking at announcements), the most recent announcements do not show up on the list. Sorting the group of ten that show up sort properly, however, there may be newer announcements that are on the second page. Expanding the Announcements screen to show all announcements at once corrects the problem, but is not a solution.

Screen shots are attached.

Showing10.jpg shows the default view. Notice that the newest message is from September 30, 2005

Showingall.jpg shows the full view (all 23 items). The most recent message is from November and should show up on the original screen, regardless of how many messages are displayed. This seems like a simple query change. (missing an ORDER BY DATE?)

column41: In 2.1.0.005 this issue manifests itself only right after you add a new announcement or revise an existing one. After adding or revising an announcement the sorting is changed on the user and announcements are listed from oldest to youngest. Reseting the tool returns it to the proper sort order. Viewing an announcement and returning to the list does not mess up the sort order.
column45:
Previously the sorting was done in the following order-
1. all the messages were arranged in ascending order.
2. the first 10 messages were selected from the list.
3. this was further reordered in descending order and was displayed, hence the most recent announcement will not be visible on the front page.

This problem has been resolved by changing the ordering in step 1.
column49: Works fine with sakai/trunk on Oracle. announcement unchanged since 2-6-x branch cut.
column80:
Tested on sakai/trunk on HSQLDB - Built: 10/22/08 08:00 - Sakai Revision: 53711 - Server sakai-sand.uits.iupui.edu (Win Vista Ultimate SP1, IE 7.x)

PROCEDURES / RESULTS

Procedure 1: Added 11 announcements to course site
Result: Ordering worked well. The most recent announcement was at the top of the first list of 10, with the oldest announcement on the second "list"

Procedure 2: Changed the title of the oldest announcement
Result: The edited announcement moved to the top of the first list of 10 (position1)

Procedure 3: Changed the title of the most recent announcement AND specified a beginning date that was a few days in the past
Result: The edited announcement moved to last place (position11)

CONCLUSION
For a newly added announcement, the default date sort captures the time of creation, and sorts accordingly.

If an announcement is edited in any way without specifying a beginning date, the default date sort captures the time of the edit (overriding the time of creation) and moves that announcement to the top of the list.

If a beginning date is specified, the date sort captures that beginning date (overriding the time of creation and time of edit) and sorts accordingly

Procedure and results were the same as in the last comment by Angela Joyce Henry:

For a newly added announcement, the default date sort captures the time of creation, and sorts accordingly.

If an announcement is edited in any way without specifying a beginning date, the default date sort captures the time of the edit (overriding the time of creation) and moves that announcement to the top of the list.

If a beginning date is specified, the date sort captures that beginning date (overriding the time of creation and time of edit) and sorts accordingly

column1: [SAK-2927] Allow configuration control over what fields are exported to csv for final grade
column6: The fields exported in the excel/csv file now are Student Name, Student ID, Course Grade. It would be nice to be able to specify in sakai.properties what fields Iinstitution wide) should be exported and whether or not to include the row of column headers. For example, the input format to a final grade submission system might need student id and final grade only, witout column headers in the file.
column10: Allow configuration control over what fields are exported to csv for final grade
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41:
As we are now allowing submission of end of term grades only via an upload of a csv file, at UM we'd like to be able to control the field contained in the output from Gradebook, so they match what our import accepts.

We propose controlling the output via an optional button that can output a customized list.
gradebook.output.button.label=
If this property had a value, then an added button appears on the Gradebook page which has the Export for Excel and Export CSV buttons on it. The added button has the specified text for it's label.

gradebook.output.fields=
Specifies the fields and order in which they are output in a CSV file. For example, for UM it would be
gradebook.output.fields=student_id,finalgrade
or whatever values cooresponded to those fields.

gradebook.output.column.headers=
controls whether column headers are output in the file (a true or false value).

The alternative of providing a control on the gradebook options page, via a list widget similar to that used for tab preferences, that lets a user specify which fields (move them to the list on the right side), and in what order (move them up or down in the right side list) might be nice, but we don't want to have to rely on each instructor setting the proper fields in order to create the file needed for import into the enterprise system.

The situation the bug report refers to is anomalous. The original bug

description suggested this.

column1: [SAK-2924] Institutionally configurable student ID is needed
column6:
Any application which displays enrollments to instructors needs to include some way for instructors to unambiguously distinguish students with the same names.

However, we've found that the preferred disambiguator differs from institution to institution. At some schools, it's an institutionally-defined email address; at others, it's a student ID number; at others, it's the Sakai username. It very often differs from the UID used by authentication systems.

For this reason, early in the Sakai 2.0 development cycle, we determined a need for the Sakai framework to provide LMS applications with a "display ID", obtained via the new Agent or EduPerson interface. What actually got plugged into that abstract field would have to be easily configurable system-wide by an institution, either in enterprise integration or by selecting an existing field. That field would then be shown as the student "ID" column by all tools in a standard way.

However, the move away from the legacy User services didn't happen for 2.0, 2.01, or 2.1, and the legacy User object doesn't support such a field.

As a result, tools such as the Gradebook and Section Info have to pick one of the existing statically defined properties of the legacy User, and no single pick will be acceptable to all institutions. To our knowledge, this lack of flexibility has already caused problems at U. Michigan, MIT, and Stockholm University, and it's a blocker for UC Berkeley production deployment.

Even if Sakai doesn't move away from the legacy User interface in 2.2, support for a configurable student ID needs to be added somehow.
column10: Institutionally configurable student ID is needed
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I can see a need in certain situations to display all of display name (first- and last name), user ID (institution-wide UID = Sakai user id), and an auxiliary identifying id, such as civic registration number or ssn or the equivalent. For Stockholm University, the distinction is very important, since for a teacher the only plausable way of distinguishing people with identical first and last names is to look at the civic registration number. I am not quite sure if the proposed solution in this Jira issue would satisfy such a need.

i.e:

  • display name (first and last name)
  • (Sakai + institution) UID, aka "user name"
  • institutionally configurable and optional auxiliary identifyer (such as ssn or civic registration number), fed by e g an ldap provider.
column45:
Per, I think you're talking about two things here.

1) The framework needs to support an institution-dependent disambiguating person ID. For Stockholm University, that might be the civic registration number. That need is addressed by this feature request.

2) You'd like to have an extra column in the displays of some applications with (presumably) some flexibility about what gets shown in it. That would turn into feature requests for those particular applications. I should warn you, though, that you may get pushback from the UI designers about the display width – horizontal scrolling is much harder for users to deal with than vertical scrolling.

fixed according to this email and discussion in staff meeting

Hi Huong - Lydia and I talked about this one and I forgot to share the results of that conversation. (Sorry Daisy!) But I think I have a pretty simple solution. A little background: when we had talked at the staff meeting a couple weeks ago we'd talked about removing the "Assessment Released to:" section, but it looks like Daisy has just disabled it.

In my conversation with Lydia, we talked about the very real possibility of an "Anonymous Survey" question type where you would want to set the default Released To: to anonymous and not allow editing to (hide) that section in Settings. This means we should allow setting the default to anon the way it was in the mockup.

Now that I'm thinking more about this, there is a problem in hiding that whole section if it's anonymous because you still need the Published Assessment URL. This would mean we should probably not have the Can edit? question.

So can we do this in Assessment Types > Released To:

Released To:
(checkbox) Can edit default value (below)?
(radio) Anonymous
(radio) Site Members

Published Assessment URL: http://sakai.stateu.edu/032940329/

-mARC

column1: [SAK-2922] Daily view shows links for yesterday and tomorrow
column6:
When navigating in the daily view in Schedule using the "Before 8AM" link, the link at the top of the page now reads "Yesterday". Likewise, when viewing information for the "After 5PM" link, the link at the bottom of the page now reads "Tomorrow". This may be confusing for users as they may be viewing a date in the future or in the past. For example, if today's date is November 22, and I view information for November 26th, I would still see the links for "Yesterday" and "Tomorrow" even though I am actually viewing Nov. 26 (4 days in the future). "Tomorrow's" date would actually be November 27.

Perhaps it would be better to show the date instead of "Tomorrow" and "Yesterday". I have attached two screenshots. Note: the screenshots were taken as of November 22nd.

column1: [SAK-2920] exporting assessment alters (timer) settings
column6:
This is a new regression bug, observed in the oracle nightly qa instance (coursework-s1:28080). Will test all other instances and report back.

I created a new assessment (11.22 export ) with one question of each type and exported it from the oracle instance. It appeared to import successfully, but threw a null pointer exception in the logs. (see attached).

I then imported the xml file into the mysql qa instance. It imported successfully. When I viewed the imported assessment in authoring I noticed the following changes to the settings:

  • The High Security - IP address box was checked, with "null" in the address field.
  • The timed assessment box was checked, with the timer set to 0. (Auto-submit was not checked.)
column10: exporting assessment alters (timer) settings
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Exported an assessment from the mysql instance andimported it into oracle. Most of the results were the same, but the settings were different:

  • The High Security - IP box was not checked, yay.
  • Both the timed assessment and auto-submit buttons were checked (timer set to 0).
column45:
OK, found a couple of bugs, but I can't reproduce the behavior you describe.

1. I tried setting the following: timed assessment, auto-submit, ip addresses (two), user name and password.
Everything worked except an easy to fix bug in time (H instead of M) so 19 minutes-> 19 hours.

2. I tried setting nothing and nothing got set except the timed assessment switch--it was checked and shouldn't be.

#1 is an export bug. #2 is an import bug.

so
1. should be putting ISO minutes in instead of ISO hours, this can only be fixed in newly exported assessments.
2. should see the zero or no time available and not setting the timed checkbox.
column49:
OK. On version 4198 I can no longer observe the error #1. I do not see a change in Iso8601TimeInterval.java or AssessmentAccessControl.java that fixes the problem. If I export at 15 minutes I import at 15 minutes.

Gee I could swear that I was seeing "H" instead of "M" in the XML before....
column75:
OK #2 still appears to be a real problem. If it cannot read a time from the XML it interprets it as not having a time, however, if it takes it as having a correctly formatted time of 0 it thinks it is a tiemd assessment.

The fix is to test if it is zero and to set it to not timed in that case.

PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING CAREFULLY
THIS AFFECTS HOW YOU INTERPRET TESTS OF THIS FIX
There are some issues in settings that can affect the correct function of this fix. These should be treated as authoring settings page issues.
==================================
1. The backing bean retains last set duration from the previous assessment. If you go to that section and save, it will set the duration to the duration of the previous assessment. That is definitely a bug!
2. Unchecking the timed assessment does not zero out the assessment duration as it should. This is sort of half a feature request and half a bug, but it causes problems. I'll probably end up getting it assigned to me.
3. Notes in my source code indicate that (at least at one time) the setting that the assessment was timed was not reliable, therefore, the code relies on the time entered. I will check that in the future, but I don't want to risk regression now.
4. If you accidentally leave the time in and turn off timed, you'll get that spurious time in teh new assessment, and it wil interpret that as a timed assessment (see 1,2,3, above)
5. If you have a time in settings and it is not a timed assessment, you need to manually set the time to zero. This is stupid of course, and we should document it, but it would be better to fix the bugs in 1 and 2, above.
===================================
column80:
Fix revision 4206.

column84: The IP address issue appears to have been resolved. The remaining timer issue is not a blocker; downgraded to major.

column1: [SAK-2917] A different way to organize logs
column6:
James is creating logs in TOMCAT_HOME/sakai/logs/ whereas all other logs (e.g. catalina.out) are created in TOMCAT_HOME/logs/

James should be configured to create its logs in the same place as other logs (e.g. /logs/).

See comments below regarding desire to have logs organized differently then they currently are in Sakai 2.1.0.
column10: A different way to organize logs
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41:
This is actually the right place, by design, for the Sakai logs. The James logs might be the only logs you are seeing coming from Sakai (but I thought we were writing other Sakai logs there too...). The other logs you speak of are not Sakai logs, but Tomcat logs.

Sakai does not write logs to Tomcat's logs directory, but to it's own sakai/logs one.
column45:
Most people are accustomized to looking in catalina.out for Sakai warnings and errors, so the distinction between Tomcat logs and Sakai logs is probably a bit too subtle. My suggestion would be to put them both in the same place by default, and people who want to can move the Sakai logs elsewhere.

TOMCAT_HOME/sakai/ is where people know that sakai.properties goes, so looking for additional logs there is a bit unexpected. By analogy, this is like looking for logs in /etc/ rather than /var/log/.
column49: There has been no interest expressed in fixing this issue and it is not been reported as an issue for more recent versions of Sakai, so closing it as Incomplete for now. If you are interested in working on this issue or feel it is still applicable to the latest Sakai release, please feel free to reopen.

{sakai.home}

/logs. Otherwise, it will take an absolute path, or given a relative path it will build off of catalina.base or failing that catalina.home.

I've successfully tested it against rSmart's CLE 2.5.0 tag, and it builds successfully against the sakai_2-5-0 tag as well.

column49:
Since there is no role attached to the permission flag that marks "Teaching Assistant"s, this is bound to happen. If you want to use the Section Info tool in a project site, you must create a third role (not access, not maintain) that has the "section.role.ta" permission. With only two roles in a site, the behavior of this tool is undefined.

Should there be a warning message displayed when this kind of mis-configuration occurs? The tool currently just bails when it doesn't find an appropriate TA role. Daphne?
column75:
I really question the need for Section Info in project sites. During an internal conversation this morning, folks said it would be an edge case that people put section info in the project sites. I think it's our job to design a system that protects users from making mistakes.

I can't think of a use case that having sections in a project site solves (keeping in mind, groups can be created in project sites). None of the nomenclature or workflows were designed for "project-group-like" needs.

Can we just pull it from the template? Josh, maybe you, I and Oliver can talk about this.
column80:
This appears to be resolved: tested by adding Section Info to a project site, creating 2 sections, and clicking 'Assign TAs'. The Assign Teaching Assistants page is shown as expected. section.role.ta is not set for either access or maintain roles.

On the other hand, I don't see a "generic error message informing the user of the problem" except this note which shows up regardless:

Note: Don't see a Teaching Assistant here? Go to the Site Info tool and add them as a site participant with the "TA" role.

column1: [SAK-2909] Performance problems with background SQL queries in Oracle
column6:
Certain SQL commands and settings were found to be major performance problems with CTools' Oracle. These were:

  • validating the db connection with a simple SQL statement
  • setting the default transaction isolation level

(Note: doing a rollback after each connection use, and setting the auto-commit each time to the default value were also a problem and have been fixed already in the TRUNK)

Changes were put in CTools to address this, but the kernel db configuration was not structured to allow these changes to be applied to the TRUNK, so that the OOTB Sakai supports HSQLDB with these settings, and for Oracle, we can disable them as needed in the sakai.properties files.

Change the kernel db configuration to allow this, and recommend the Oracle settings (here, and in the various distributed properties files and examples).
column10: Performance problems with background SQL queries in Oracle
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
The way to set the default transaction isolation level is different. It is an override property now, rather than a placeholder property. Set it in sakai.properties like this:

defaultTransactionIsolationString@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED

  • * *

For Oracle, we (CTools at University of Michigan) found it best for performance to leave the validation query and isolation level default unset. To get these values unset now, put this in you sakai.properties file:

  1. for best oracle performance
    validationQuery@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=
    testOnBorrow@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=false
    defaultTransactionIsolationString@javax.sql.BaseDataSource=
column45: This issue was not verified in the formal QA process but is included in a production version of Sakai (2.1). If you find this is still a problem, please re-open.

column1: [SAK-2908] User Presence persisting after browser shutdown without logout
column6:
User presence persists indefinitely if the browser is shut down without logging out of Sakai. When the user with the incomplete logout logs back in, only one instance of their name will be visible, but after they log out again, the name does not clear.

Steps to reproduce:
Login in user1 to a Sakai instance.
Shut down browser while still logged into session.
Log in user2; user1 will still be visible in the "users present" box of the page they were on at the time of the browser shutdown.
column10: User Presence persisting after browser shutdown without logout
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Laura, can you quantify "indefinitely"? Is it longer than the time-out setting on your instance of Sakai?
column45: Having checked with the developer, our timeout was upped to 10 hours, so this may be design rather than a bug. Should Sakai check to see if users are still connected?
column49: Sakai does check, but only gives up on someone when the persistance time-out is exceeded. So in your case, it sounds like it would be 10 hours.
column75: Laura, it sounds like Sakai was functioning correctly, just that you had a very long time-out set, so I'm closing this for now.
column80: Seems as if it should clear a user's previous login if they log back in, though. Should that be entered as a feature request?
column84: Laura, Sakai will clear logins after they have timed out, however, it sounds like you were probably checking before it had timed-out. Simply logging in again won't clear a previous login because Sakai allows you to login more than once.
column88: If there is a certain way you would like to see Sakai behave that the current design does not support, then, yes, please describe that in a Feature Request.

column1: [SAK-2905] Need to revisit the logic for the Status field in total scores page

"No Submission" - assessment not submitted yet by that user

"All Graded" Assessment is submitted and has been completely autoscored
