Please verfy against it. You might need to test both anonymous and non-anonymous grading. Create one assessment which all questions can be auto-graded and another one with some questions cannot be auto-graded (question type cannot be auto-graded: short answer, file upload, or audio). For the second assessment, make two different submissions. Answer all the questions in the first submission. For the second submission, don't answer the non-auto-graded questions. When you go to the total score page, you should see the status Auto-scored in the second submission but blank status in the first one. Please also test on Late submission as well. Thanks.

Pleaes feel free to ask me if you don't know how to verify this issue. Thanks.

column45: Yes they do. Let's say the users are in Chat Room A. They are having a discussion and then the instructor decides to change the name of the room to Chat Room B. The messages from Chat Room A not longer appear for either the instructor or the student. The instructor sees the chat room with the new title but from the student perspective, they are in Chat Room A and all the messages have suddenly disappeared. At this point all users can post new messages that persist. Does that make sense?
column49: Yep, thanks.
column75:

The logged in user still sees the original room until they log out and back in. I've added Jim as a watcher to this ticket so he'll get the comment and maybe he can confirm.
column80: It's been a long time since I looked at this. That was probably in Chef rather than Sakai. At that time, I'm not sure we were concerned about how quickly the changes would be propogated to users who were currently in a chat. It sounds like someone has introduced changes to schedule refreshes of the chat-tool's main iframe for all participants whenever a change occurs in the options for that tool. It may be possible to schedule refreshes of tool's title frame as well. Or if this refers to the tool button not getting updated, maybe you'd need to schedule an update of the entire screen. Just a thought. It's also possible there's some latency due to caching.

column1: [SAK-2878] To verb or not to verb?
column6:
Sakai's UI is inconsistent in what verb or noun forms and combinations are used in links, toolbar entries and buttons.

For example:

1. 'Permissions' is widely used as a toolbar entry to change permissions (noun), yet the link in Resources to change properties is 'Revise Properties' (verb + noun)

2. In some tools, the Cancel button is labelled 'Cancel' whereas in others (e.g. Account) it is 'Cancel Changes'. There are similar differences in button style elsewhere.

3. In Worksite Setup / Site Info, the toolbar options are all verb + noun (e.g. 'Manage Groups'), whereas in most other tools they are nouns ('Options', 'Permissions', etc.)

4. Preferences mixes option forms, e.g. 'Notifications' but 'Customize Tabs'.

This issue requires a clear decision on appropriate forms for toolbar entries, links and button text, which then needs to be applied across all Sakai tools.
column10: To verb or not to verb?
column19: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
column41: I believe the style guide has a stance on this in the writing guidelines section. We should proabably either follow it or change it to match how we'd like things to be.
column45: Daphne, can you tell us where this is in the Style Guide? Thanks.
column49:
The Style Guide is at:
http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/confluence/display/UI/Style+Guide

According to the style guide (p45), "Edit" should be used, not "Revise".

"Properties" should be dropped because not only can you edit the properties but in 2.1 you can also replace the file itself, change the title, in the case of a web resource, change the URL. These are not under the Properties subheading.

column1: [SAK-2875] Button style is inconsistent across tools
column6:
Different tools appear to have different button styles, e.g. Assignments and Section Info (see screenshots).

The same button style should be used across all tools.
column10: Button style is inconsistent across tools
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: As of rev 4127, the "active" button styles have been surrounded by a required "act" style element. It appears that this style is intended for buttons such as "Add" or "Cancel", but is specifically not used for buttons like "Search" or for paging.
column45: rev 4127 addresses this problem in Section Info... not sure if there were other instances where the buttons were not styled correctly.
column49: The hiFiWireframes don't address whether the assertion in my 22-Nov-2005 comment is accurate (namely, that the "act" css class is for some buttons but not others). Could someone more familiar with the SG comment on this?
column75:
The "active" style is for the primary submit button on a page. So if there were a form to add a photo to your profile, at the bottom of the form there would be two buttons "Add Photo" and "Cancel" - the "Add Photo" should have the Act style (by default this is a bold outline). This makes it easier for users to hit the right button without thinking about it, reducing the ocassional 'oops - I hit cancel by mistake' error.

It's not intended for use in other widgets (search, next and previous, etc).

Here's an example:
http://cvs.sakaiproject.org/cgi-bin/cvsweb.cgi/%7echeckout%7e/scratch/styleguide/example/form.html
column80: Thanks Ben. Actually, I wasn't talking about the "active" class... I was talking about the "act" div that surrounds the "Save" (which also has class='active') and "Cancel" buttons (which does not have class='active'). This div seems to appear for some groups of buttons, but not others. I'm wondering whether the div should appear for all buttons or not.
column84: Oh, I see. The "act" div is there for the buttons at the bottom of forms. I think it was necessary to keep the buttons lined up nicely and looking consistent across various browsers.
column88: Ben, could comment on what needs to be changed in the tools in question to bring them into compliance with the Style Guide, if anything? Thanks.
column92:
Sure, Peter.

Use of the highlighted 'act button' in the four samples above

1. activeButton.jpg - matches the style guide (cancel button optional - may not be logically possible on an actionable list)
2. buttonStyles.jpg - matches style guide (cancel button optional - may not be logically possible on an actionable list)
3. screenshot-1.jpg - Does not match style guide. The 'Add Sections' button should be highlighted.
4. screenshot-1.jpg - Does not match style guide. The 'Post' button should be highlighted.

column112:
SVN 4407

Made the changes to assignment preview, the last remaining issue, I think. Two notes:

1 - the wrapper class "act" is reserved for form button inputs, not for inputs used in navigation, it is used to contextually style inputs (as children of "act") if the institution wants to.

2 -the "active" class is reserved for the primary input, to highlight it - like Ben points out.

After user testing Michigan has opted out of both - in the case of 1, by letting the browser do its thing with button styles (if anything other than the font is touched, you need to recreate the button "look" from scratch, missing the browser-supplied chrome) and in the case of 2 to not confuse the user, the "active" definition is empty (users were identifying the highlighted input with what would happen if they pressed "Enter")

column1: [SAK-2873] Inconsistent use of Hide/Show across and within tools
column6:
When disclosure triangles are used with logical group headings to collapse / expand sections, the use of "Hide/Show" is inconsistent. For example Resources uses "Hide other sites" / "Show other sites", whereas when creating a resource, "Optional properties" doesn't include Hide/Show.

In Assignments, it's inconsistently used on the same page (see screenshot).

Usage should be consistent across and within tools.

My suggestion is to eliminate use of Hide/Show in these contexts, as:

1. The style guide does not indicate using Hide/Show.

2. In most instances, Hide/Show is not used.

3. The label is describing the contexts of the expanded/collapsed section. It's therefore inappropriate to use words which suggest that the label is an action or link, especially as the clickable link is the disclosure triangle itself, which mostly does have a tooltip with the action verb ("Hide ...").
column10: Inconsistent use of Hide/Show across and within tools
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: "Hide assignment: ABC" vs "Student view" shows inconsistent labelling next to disclosure triangles.
column45:
On further exploration, 3. above is not quite correct. In some situations (e.g. Resources Hide/Show), the label is clickable, while in others (Resources Optional properties, Assignments "Hide assignment") it is not.

This is another area of inconsistency.
column49: Style Guide currently doesn't provide help on this issue. Need to develop a set of guidelines for this post-2.1.
column75: Design suggestion for Resources tool.
column80:
For Resources, this would be a small change for consistency as follows:

Show Other Sites could be "Your Other Sites", "Resources in Other Sites", "All your resources", "Files and folders in all sites"

Hide Other Sites would be named the same as Show Other Sites

This could be included with the new (proposed) icon showing a pile of folders

column1: [SAK-2869] Non-ascii characters characters lost in simple text documents
column6:
transfering files via webdav having filenames with non-ascii characters does not preserve the filename (typically non-ascii characters
get changed to "?"). However content gets preserved.

All other forms of resource creation work with non-ascii characters both in title and content except one:

  • creating a text document online does not preserve non-ascii characters in content (but respects it in the title). In 003 the
    non-ascii content was preserved.

I guess they are related so I didn't fill 2 reports, and I'm aware there have been other reports in the past. I noticed some
changes between 002 and 003 and now with 004 so I wanted to report because it does not seem to be fixed.
column10: Non-ascii characters characters lost in simple text documents
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Jim, it looks 004 broke some of the foreign characters support.
column45:
I am changing the title to focus on the second item in the description. The first item mentioned a problem with non-ascii characters in titles during upload through webdav. Resources uses escape methods to convert such names, but webdav does not. That will not be fixed. Here's the gist of the other part of this item:

All other forms of resource creation work with non-ascii characters both in title and content except one:

  • creating a text document online does not preserve non-ascii characters in content (but respects it in the title). In 003 the
    non-ascii content was preserved.
column49: Feliz: Could you provide info about how to reproduce the second problem you mentioned, specifically non-ascii characters in text documents created online are converted to question marks. What do I have to do to create such a file and how do I view it to see the problem? Thanks. Jim
column75: Feliz, could you please provide the additional information requested above? We are having difficulties recreating the problem. Thanks.
column80:
I just tested 006. The problem is still there. I attach a sequence of events demonstrating what's going on.

I just finished fixing non-ascii char suport in 1.0 (we have been running it in a pilot, but people liked it and entered real content, which they now want to retrieve). From what I found there were several places where translations didn't preserve non-ascii chars, but mostly in the vm files calling escapeHtml and escapeUrl methods; there were no real deep problems with char support beyond what was done at the user inteface level. Filenames were preserved, content also, only some problems showing up content in some user interfaces.

The behavior has been changing from sakai 002 to 006. I wonder if it is also a simple fix like the one for 1.0.

I hope you'll understand without non-ascii support we can not go into production. I plan to go deeper into 2.1 code now that we've fixed 1.0 and hopefully I can be of any help.
column84: The file showing non-ascii char support in 006.
column88:
the issue "Non-ascii characters characters lost in simple text documents" is solved since version 2.1

It can be closed.

column1: [SAK-2864] Samigo Authoring / formatting change needed when adding matching questions
column6:
When adding a matching question in Samigo, it appears that at one time the 'Choice' field and the 'Match' field were displayed side-by-side. They now display one on top of the other but there is still a heading above the choice/match section that says "Choice" and "Match".

Steps to reproduce-

1. Create a new assessment
2. Add a matching question
3. Scroll to the portion of the screen that allows you to enter choice/match pairings. The Title bar is displayed at the top of that section.

See screenshot for an example
column7: Windows XP Pro / Firefox 1.0.7 / Sakai Maintenance Branch (running r3994 HSQLDB)
column10: Samigo Authoring / formatting change needed when adding matching questions
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
This heading is not for the choice and match fields. It's actually a header for the table of all created choice/match pairs. Since no choice/match has been created, you are only seeing an empty table header. Should we hide it or should we put a text saying something like "no pair has been created" ?

I'd like to postpone this to Post 2.1 until our UI designer comes back. But if you have any input please comment here. We are always soliciting design ideas.
column45: Hiding it may prove to be confusing to the end-user in the end. I would suggest adding the "no pairs have been created" text to help separate that heading from the choice/match input fields and make it look more visually appealing to the user.
column49: We are hiding it for now but will revisit this post 2.1.
column75: The bar for choice and match is shown. But if there is no pairs then will show: "No pairs have been created"

column75:
Interesting.

If you preview an assessment and then try to publish it, you wll get the unique name error on the oracle and hsql instances. The mysql instance does not have the problem.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create new assessment.
2. add questions.
3. Preview assessment.
4. Go to settings and click publish.

Saving the settings no longer triggers the error, just publishing.
column80:
Turns out that is true only for MySQL, which will show the error or not show the error depending on the route you take to leave the Preview page:

1. Create new assessment.
2. Add a question.
3. Go to Preview.
4. Exit at this point using the "Tests and Quizzes" arrow at the top of the box.
5. Go to Settings.
6 Try to publish, and it will show the error.

However, if you:

3. Go to Preview.
4. Click on Begin Assessment.
5. Exit using the Done button either above or below the question.
6. Go to Settings.
7. Try to publish, and it will allow you to do so.

This is true only for MySQL. Oracle and HSQL will show the error using both methods.

column100:
some explanation what we ve solved:

The action of previewing assessment actually publish the assessment. After previewing, users are
supposed to click the DONE" button which is the signal to remove this bogus published assessment.

However, if users exit by other means, such as using teh arrow key next to teh title T&Q, the bogus
publsihed assessment would reamin in the DB. This caused problem when we are trying to publish the
assessment for real. 'cos no two assessment should have the same title. This is a spec reinforced in
2.1. To get round that, I weed out these bogus publsihed assessment when I am checking for titel uniqueness,
hence, fixed the problem

dasiy

column1: [SAK-2857] Grading of MCMC question and Match the following question should have an option where an instructor can choose whether he needs a negative marking or not.
column6:
As per current design, MCMC answer type of questions and Match the following questions have an inbuilt negative marking feature. Here a student is discouraged to make a guess by picking up any answer which he is not sure of. If he picks up one correct and one wrong answer he gets 0 (zero).

How ever I think if we let the instructor to decide whether he wants to penalize the student with 100% negative marking or he wants to encourage the student to try to attempt all the questions and provide the marks of only those questions which are correct with no negative marking on incorrect options.

column1: [SAK-2854] JLDAP: dref setting causes timeout
column6:
The setting of the search constaint to setDereference(LDAPSearchConstraints.DEREF_ALWAYS) can cause timouts on searches on ldap servers that contain many alias object. This should be setable via components.xml

<property name="searchAliases"><value>false</value></property>

getEntryFromDirectory then needs:

if (isSearchAliases())

{ cons.setDereference(LDAPSearchConstraints.DEREF_ALWAYS); }

else

{ cons.setDereference(LDAPSearchConstraints.DEREF_NEVER); }

and it is implemented by:
/**

  • @return Returns the searchAliases
    */
    public boolean isSearchAliases() { return searchAliases; }

column1: [SAK-2851] model short answer doesn't display in preview, delivery
column6:
observed on nightly qa mysql and oracle instances, and also on MIT stable hsql instance. (003 build).

Short answer/essay questions have an optional model short answer field that the instructor can fill in with a sample answer. This field counts as question-level feedback; the student shoudl be able to see it in delivery and when reviewing submitted assessments, as long as question-level feedback is enabled. Instructors should also be able to see the model short answer when previewing assessments in authoring.

Right now, none of this is true. The Model SA field is always blank in preview, delivery and review.
column10: model short answer doesn't display in preview, delivery
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: This issue still exists - Laura says she can't see the model short answer links in delivery at all in 006.
column45: I can see the link, if I turn on feedback, but clicking on it does nothing but jump me to the top of the question page; my model answer does not show.
column49:
This turns out to be a bug both subtle and wacky: it is caused by putting an SA question with a model through the editing screen in Firefox, whether in initial creation or later editing. To reproduce:

1. Create an assessment with a SA question with model short answer in IE.
2. Preview to make sure that the popup works.
3. Open Firefox and log in to the same account.
4. Preview the assessment again. The model should popup.
5. Edit the question in Firefox; don't change anything, just open it in the edit screen and save.
6. Preview again. The model popup should be broken.
7. Go back to IE. Preview the assessment again. The model popup should be broken.
8. Edit the question in IE and save.
9. Preview yet again. The model should now popup again.

column92:
Hi Lydia & Marc,

In the ShowFeedback screen for the model answer for SAQ, we are currently using an alert box to do it. There is a couple of problem.

1. a character like ' and " will ruin the alert box. I suspect that the problem that Maragaret has encountered is to do with soem hidden character. So I started writing String -> unicode transformation. Then I realized 2.

2. the model answer is collected through the WYSIWYG which added a lot of HTML tag, the most common ones are <P> to keep the display on teh browser intact. Problem is when displaying in teh alert box with such sentence liek
"<P> this is the model answer:</P><P>   once upon a time ...</P> you get a full view of all these HTML tags.

My conclusion is that I think we should just display teh model answer with <h:outputText escape=false> simply because the text carries teh answer as well as the display format and JSF can display the HTML tag for us correctly.

Marc: I am going to fix it this way first and reassign to you.

Lydia: I am checking in the unicode transformation to itemContentBean in case we want to use it later.

Daisy

column1: [SAK-2848] Consistent grading needs to be used throughout application - Pass raw score to GB
column6:
In Samigo scores are rounded to the tenth place while the GB allows scores to the hundredth place. This should be consistant throughout the application.

I'm bumping up the priority on this as I've run into a use case where this discrepancy is causing a pretty big problem between GB-Samigo. I know at first glace it can seem trivial, but when it comes to the calculation of grades, faculty are very picky.

I have a Samigo assessment that has 1 question with 3.33333333333 points and I want it in the GB. The GB has the points for this assignment set to 3.33. However, since the scores in samigo are rounded to the 10th place - students can only get a maximum score of 3.3. Even if every student got every question on this assessment correct, the class average would read 99%. The student would see 3.3 out of 3.33.
column10: Consistent grading needs to be used throughout application - Pass raw score to GB
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: What does Assignments do?
column45: Assignments uses decimal points to the tenth place. I've heard one instructor here at IU comment that grades should allot for more than just the tenth place (in regards to Samigo). Of course that is something that will vary on an instructor by instructor basis Whatever is decided upon, we need to ensure that it's consistant throughout the app. I'm going to add GB and Assignments to this ticket. Hopefully the designers of those tools can share some comments they have gotten from any usability studies. Thanks!
column49: What do you think, Marc? Maybe it's a topic for discussion in Austin?
column75: Lydia, I think that is an excellent idea. Its too late now to standardize this for 2.1.0, however, it would be great to get this in 2.1.1.
column80: Actually, now that there is the Assessment Tools DG, I believe we should put it out to that community for input (sakai-assess@collab.sakaiproject.org). Megan, you want to do that?

column1: [SAK-2844] Exporting an assessment to the Gradebook truncates fractional total point values to an integer
column6: When the Gradebook and Samigo teams first agreed on a Gradebook service API, the assumption was made that an assignment's total points would always be an integer. That's no longer true, which means that wrong values can be exported to the Gradebook. I'll add a new signature for the GradebookService "addExternalAssessment" method which accepts "double points" rather than "long points". After that's done, the integration code in Tests & Quizzes should be changed accordingly.

column1: [SAK-2841] Publishing confused by different time zones
column6:
Samigo unsure as to whether it's using client time zones or server time zones in publishing content.
This works looking at sakai-stable from the UK - it won't work unless you're have different time zones.

as admin
1) Create a quiz
2) Publish it, setting the available date to today using the pop-up calendar. It will supply today's date and time as specified by the client computer - e.g. 11/17/2005 03:03:05 PM . The administrator expects that to mean it will appear instantly.

as user
1) Log on and look for that quiz. It won't have appeared yet because the UK time is ahead of the time where the server is located.

column88:
I tested this on the qa1-uk and qa2-us instances using the following steps:

1) Set instructor's timezone in preferences to Eastern.

2) Create assessment, publish with an available date of today 3 hours from now.

3) Log in as student and set the timezone to Eastern.

4) Visit the site as student. I should not be able to see the test - can I?

5) Change the student's timezone to London. I still shouldn't be able to - can I?

6) Log in as instructor, and change my timezone to Central. View assessment settings - have they changed?

7) Change release date to now, and set a due date to 24 hours from now.

8) Log in as student (London). Can I see the assessment? Is the due date 24 hours from London time now?

9) Change student timezone to Pacific. Can I see the assessment? Is the due date 24 hours from Pacific time now?

10) Log in as instructor (Central). Set retract date to 1hr from now.

11) Log in as student (London). Can I still see the assessment?

12) Log in as instructor (Central). Change retract date to now.

13) Log in as student and change timezone to Pacific. Can I see the assessment?

Everything looked right. Am I missing anything? Timezones are very confusing, especially since the calendar widget reflects your computer time rather than either the Sakai server or client time.

column1: [SAK-2838] Gradebook shows only integer points when listing assignments
column6:
Assigments created in SAMigo show in the Gradebook with integer points, truncating the decimal part.

Checked also in 2.1.003 mysql sakai-stable.
column10: Gradebook shows only integer points when listing assignments
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I added some screen shots which Oliver sent me by email.

Looking at them, there seem to be at least two issues.

1) The average percentage is not being calculated correctly for this fractional external assessment. Also, although we're specified to show up to two decimal places for an assignment points value (truncating, not rounding), the external assessment (with total points possible "10.6666") is showing as "10" instead of "10.66". I suspect these two are related.

2) Tests & Quizzes seems to be following a different rule for its score display. I assume that the graded student received a perfect score, which would be equivalent to "10.6666". But instead of truncating at two digits as the Gradebook is supposed to ("10.66"), T&Q is rounding at one digit ("10.7"). If that's the case, we might want to try to negotiate a rule between us to cut down on user confusion.
column45:
Well, the first problem is simple enough to explain. When we agreed on the Gradebook external service API with the Tests & Quizzes team, we set the "points" argument for an external assessment to be an integer. I suspect this was some limitation at the time which has since been dropped.

I'll open a bug report on Tests & Quizzes and link it to this one. Hopefully, we'll be able to coordinate a move to a floating point value before 2.1 final.
column49:
The Gradebook and Tests & Quizzes now communicate in floating-point point values rather than integers.

Checked in changes to Gradebook and Samigo as revision 3970.
column75: There is still a problem with the rounding of T&Q scores. I've commented on this in the linked issue.

column1: [SAK-2836] Wiki markup enchancements
column6: It would be useful to be able to represent en-dashes and em-dashes, somehow. Also, the numbered list thing currently relies on the initial digit being "1.", so that to get a list going 1.... 2.... 3..., you have to type 1. ... 1. ... 1. ... If you actually type 1. ... 2. ... 3. ... then it doesn't work. If you recognise all digit-followed-by-dot, then you can allow this more natural layout. On the other hand, if you had written 1. ... 1. ... 2. ..., it would come out as 1. ... 2. ... 3. ..., so the thing denoted in the markup as 2 would appear as 3, which could be confusing. As radeox uses regexps, that's difficult to do anything about, . Up to you....

column1: [SAK-2833] Statistics view in grading breaks last/all submissions views
column6:
The statistics screen in grading has a "Last Submission/All Submissions" pulldown menu. If you choose Last Submission, the stats view should only count the most recent submission from each site member. If you choose All Submissions, it should count them all.

Here's what I did/steps to reproduce:

1) Add 5 students to site, in various sections: A, B, C, D and F.

2) Took an assessment once as A, B and C each.

3) Took the assessment 4 times as F.

4) Didn't take the assessment at all as D.

5) In grading, viewed total scores page. I switched back and forth between Last and All in the submissions menu, and everything looked good - either 5 entries (including the no-submission one for D) or 8 showed up.

6) Went to statistics, which by default had Last Submission chosen. The overall histogram showed 5 entries. (odd, given the no-submission.)

7) Chose All Submissions. The number stayed at 5 That's not good.

8) Returned to the Total Scores page. Now I saw only 5 entries when choosing All Submissions here too!

9) Moreover, the user with no submission, D, had his status changed to "All Graded" suddenly. (I need to do more checking into exactly when this happened.)

10). If I choose Last Submission from the menu in Total Scores, let it refresh the page, and then choose All Submissions again, the missing entries will come back.. They vanish again whenever visit the statistics page, though.

So something about the submissions menu on the stats page is screwing things up on the total scores page. I don't see any exceptions in the logs.
column10: Statistics view in grading breaks last/all submissions views
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I added another site member with no assessment submission, and viewing statistics did not screw his entry up. So whatever did that is a separate bug, and I'll file it when I find the cause.

This bug is just about the all vs. last submissions display on the total scores page and in statistics.

column1: [SAK-2832] Add way to view model short answers in question scores

column1: [SAK-2825] Introduction of Portal Dependency in Non-Portal build.
column6:
When building Samigo standalone (as per sam/docs/README.standalone.txt), we found that some runtime dependencies were introduced on
org.sakaiproject.service.framework.config.cover.ServerConfigurationService, and possibly other Sakai services that are not really necessary.

These seem to be for evaluating whether the file upload questionis supported.

For example, in question pools, we get,

An error occurred at line: 101 in the jsp file: /jsf/questionpool/questionTreeTable.jsp
Generated servlet error:
org.sakaiproject.service.framework.config.cover.ServerConfigurationService cannot be resolved to a type

I suspect this code may be in multiple places wherever the file uplaod type is encountered.

column45:

column1: [SAK-2820] Should Samigo save state?
column6:
Most of the tools in Sakai save state when you leave them. If you edit an announcement and leave the editing screen to go to Resources, the next time you return to the Announcements tool you'll go back to the same screen you left (even if it's been a while).

Tests&Quizzes doesn't seem to do that currently. If I leave a page in, say, grading, to go to another tool, when I return to Tests&Quizzes I find myself at the top authoring page.

No loss of functionality, just a design question for Marc when he returns.
column10: Should Samigo save state?
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I wanted to add a couple notes:

  • The gradebook is another Sakai tool that doesn't save state
  • Usability tests at MIT have found that people using Sakai find the way tools save state is confusing. They expect that clicking the link of a tool in the nav bar will return them to that tool's 'front page'
column45: Ben, in regards to you last point above, is that they really find the saving of state confusing, or just that they expect clicking on the tool in the nav bar will reset things and it does not?
column49:
It's both. The confusion emerges from unexpected feedback (or lack of feedback) when clicking a link. In another case some one trying to get to their class tried worksite setup, that wasn't working, so they navigated to another tool, then went back to worksite setup and were confused because the page they'd left a while back was still there.

I fully acknowledge that whether to save state is a long standing (and slightly tedious) debate in Sakai. The legacy tools save state, most web applications do not. I think user expectations are clear, but the debate will never end.
column75: With the implementation of an option for saving state (see SAK-737 Closed and SAK-8115 Closed ), Samigo still lacks support for when saving state is the selected option.

column1: [SAK-2812] Enable WYSIWYG htmledit on Mac Camino
column6:
The latest stable version of Camino supports the WYSIWYG editor about as well as Firefox or Mozilla. (I only notice one minor display glitch, the cursor does not blink until after you start typing).

The javascript that loads htmleditor explicitly excludes Camino, this should be changed to enable Camino support.

Specifically, the section in the /library/sakai-htmlarea.js that reads

// Camino doesn't work
if (/Camino/i.test(navigator.userAgent))

{ return false; }

Should be changed to

// Camino doesn't work
if (/Camino/i.test(navigator.userAgent))

{ if (navigator.productSub < 20051107) // will not work in Camino prior to version 1.0b return false; }
column10: Enable WYSIWYG htmledit on Mac Camino
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
As somebody who has worked a lot with WYSIWYG editors in the JSF arena, we need to carefully qualify behavior before we turn it on as a supported part of the Sakai product.

Just one example of the sorts of problems you can run into if you do not do this. In Samigo we have several rich text edits in the settings page inside of collapsable divisions. In Firefox (but not in IE) all of the editors willbe disabled and will not work. This is one of the reasons that Samigo has its own version of the rich text editor, as we have an enormous kludge where every rich text editor is tracked in memory and reinitialized every time a division holding the editor is maximized.

We don't want to get suprised when the editor "appears to come up fine", but will not pass QA, and becomes unsupportable in production.

I suggest that if we pursue this, we do it as an R&D task with a software engineer paired with someone in QA and qualify the extension to a new browser against the whole UI of Sakai. We'd also need to qualify the extension tothe Samigo rich text and make sure it does not break the settings pages.

Alternatively, we could add the new code with a comment and comment it out by default with a warning that it is not officially supported. This could be done with a minimum of work, and somebody who experimentswith it can report back to the Sakai community.

It sounds like a lot of work, but whenever you integrate complex JavaScript you have to test browser compatibility carefully.

column1: [SAK-2804] Status screen in total scores page should reflect autoscoring
column6:
According to the mockup (p. 5) the "Status" field on the total scores screen should contain one of three values:

"No Submission" - assessment not submitted yet by that user

"All Graded" Assessment is submitted and has been completely autoscored

Blank - Assessment is submitted, but can't be autoscored because it has some questions that must be manually graded.

The blank category has not been implemented - all submissions in the total scores list say "All Graded" whether or not they've been autoscored.
column10: Status screen in total scores page should reflect autoscoring
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Oops, I forgot "LATE". There are 4 possible values for the status field, not 3. This doesn't change the bug though.
column45:
ok, help me with this logic

1. all graded = if the assessment can be autograded completely
2. blank = if some of the question need human attention
3. no submisison = if users didn't submit

Question, how would these status be changed, if the instructor use teh overridescore to upadte teh final score:

1. remains all graded?
2. changed to graded?
3. no submission ?

let me know. Thanks.

Daisy
column49:
#1 and #3 are easy, but #2 is very complicated. How do we know whether an assesssment has been all manually graded or not? we can't know what the instructor decided to do. Maybe they left some questions at 0 points on purpose.

My suggestion is that for now we change "All Graded" to "Auto Graded", and use that only for assessments that have been totally auto-scored. For assessments with some manually graded questions we don't say anything.

So, in all cases the status field should not change when the instructor adjusts the total score or makes a comment. Auto/All graded stays the same, blank stays blank, and No Submission stays No Submission.
column75: Yes that's a good suggestion. Let's do that for now. We'll ask Marc when he comes back.
column80:
1. At first glance, I originally thought the status "All Graded" means that this submitted assessment has been graded, no need to go through it again. Imagine if u are grading 100 studnets, it is useful to know that which students has been graded and which one has not. Sometime, u can only grade half of the class and u want to know where u were when u get back. And the no_submission alos fit well in this column.

2. then Margaraet said that it is really meant to tell instructor that this is auto-graded by computer. OK, if that is the case, most of the time, given that everybody took the same assessment, this value of this field is going to be the same except when you are pulling different set of question from a pool. In otehr words, some studnet took an assessment that can be auto-graded by teh computer and some took one that have a file upload question.

Wow! that is a big problem for the developer now. 'cos it means we need to shift through each assessment, look at each questions and decide if this is "auto-graded" or "need human attention". Well, if we truely wnat this feature, I suggest that this should be found out and recorded when studnet is taking/submitting an assessment. IU is alraedy complain that totalScore page is slow, I can't afford to have another of these method to clog it up again.

Do you get what I mean?

Daisy
column84:
ok, discussed this with Lydia and we agreed that we will make it a post 2.1 task/bug.

The problem: looking at itemGradingData record, there is no way to tell if a question is graded or not.

e.g. a MC question can be graded by computer but a SAQ need human attention. During a sucessful submisison, while the autoScore for these 2 questions were recorded as 5 and 0 respectively, the gradeBy and gradedDate remains as null.

To be able to distinguish a graded question and a not graded question, we need to utilize these two fields: gradeBy and gradedDate. E.g. for the MC question, gradedBy="computer and gradedDate="SYSDATE". These two fields should remain null for the SAQ question until someone actually assigns a score to it.

By the way, we need to make up our mind for the field "autoscore". Currently autoscore really means "score" not "autoscore". When instructor assigned a score to the SAQ question, it is recorded in "autoscore" not "overridescore".

Daisy
column88:
svn# 4072

Daisy

column6:

Recommendation is to put those functions on same line as resource in edit, move, remove sequence.

column1: [SAK-2799] Enable WYSIWYG htmledit on Mac Camino
column6:
The latest stable version of Camino supports the WYSIWYG editor about as well as Firefox or Mozilla. (I only notice one minor display glitch, the cursor does not blink until after you start typing).

The javascript that loads htmleditor explicitly excludes Camino, this should be changed to enable Camino support.

Specifically, the section in the /library/sakai-htmlarea.js that reads

// Camino doesn't work
if (/Camino/i.test(navigator.userAgent))

{ return false; }

Should be changed to

// Camino doesn't work
if (/Camino/i.test(navigator.userAgent))

{ if (navigator.productSub < 20051107) // will not work in Camino prior to version 1.0b return false; }
column10: Enable WYSIWYG htmledit on Mac Camino
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Joseph, have you had a chance to try this with one of the Sakai 2.1.0 release candidates?
column45:
No, I don't have a functioning copy of 2.1 to test on, at least not one where I have access to the javascript file that needs to change.

I seem to have missed the final "}" in my code snippet above, and forgot to change the comment to reflect that Camino does work. This is correct:

// Recent versions of Camino work
if (/Camino/i.test(navigator.userAgent))
{
if (navigator.productSub < 20051107)
// will not work in Camino prior to version 1.0b
return false;
}
}

That's just a simple change that would allow Camino to pass the browser check, however it could be improved - Camino will enter the next test in the javascript too - "if (is_gecko)" - so the entire block of tests should be one, to avoid any odd interaction from having them separated.

It's probably more appropriate and more predictable to have the camino test nested within the gecko test. This might work better:

if (is_gecko)
{
if ((/Camino/i.test(navigator.userAgent)) && (navigator.productSub < 20051107))

{ //alert("You need at least Camino 1.0beta.\n" + // "Sorry, your Gecko is not supported."); return false; }

else if (navigator.productSub < 20030210)

{ //alert("Mozilla < 1.3 Beta is not supported!\n" + return false; }

}

But I haven't tested that at all. I will if I get 2.1 working. This also removes an apparently redundant test for a Mozilla date earlier than 20030210.

column75: Actually you can mark it as "fixed" - someone seems to have removed the Camino exclusion at some point - perhaps during FCKedit integration, and it works in 2.3.x and 2.4 with FCKedit.

column1: [SAK-2798] Incorrect Grading in Match the following question
column6:
When I created a Match the following question with 3 matching pairs (15 point) in the question as
A - aa
B - bb
C - cc

When a student selects

aa - A
cc - B
cc - C

If I have to grade that question I will grade as 2 pair correct and 1 pair wrong. And will give student 10 points out of 15. But in here student is getting only 5 points.
Any comment to explain how student is getting 5 points will be appreciable.
column10: Incorrect Grading in Match the following question
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Good question! We assign negative scores for incorrect answers. This is to prevent guessing. Otherwise a student can pick A, A, A and get at least 5 points.

You can try selecting
aa-A
cc-C and leave the other one unselected, then you will get 10 points.
Note the minimum score a student can get is 0, so even if the students select 2 or 3 wrong, he'll get 0.

Hope this helps.
column45: This is not a bug, it's a feature
column49:
This seems like a real issue to me - am I being very dense?

Guessing doesn't help a student with matching questions, the way it does in multiple choice multiple choice corrections. If I take Mamta's question and answer "AA " for all of them, I still only get one out of 3 right.

Incorrect match pairs should be scored as 0 points, instead of negative points.
column75: Marc, can you tell us what to do? Do we assign negative scores for matching questions?
column80:
Consensus!

Marc says we're not going to assign negative points for incorrect choices in matching questions anymore. The total point value of the question will be divided fractionally between the choice pairs.
column84: (In other words, the scoring Mamta originally wanted is what we're going to have.) Is that enough to go on, Lydia, or should Marc draw up a formal thing?
column88: That's all I need. Will make the changes accordingly. thanks Margaret/Marc.

column41: The default template should only be viewable by admin. The default template is there for use by the instructor. Did you login as the admin or an instructor? This is a new feature in 2.1.

column75:
For clarification, more information on this change from Lydia's email to sakai-dev on 3 Jan 2006:
----------------------------------------

The default template was removed by design for Sakai 2.1. We figured that
since all settings should be viewable/editable by default from now on, it
would simplify things for instructors if the default template was
transparent. An instructor should only need to deal with templates if she
or he wants to limit the available settings in created assessments.

Does that make sense? There shouldn't be any loss of functionality at all
(if there is for you, please let us know!); the intent of this change just
to make the user experience less confusing. Hopefully it won't have the
opposite effect.

column1: [SAK-2791] Some characters not displaying properly in batch migrated sites
column6:
This is cloned from CT-241:"Some characters not displaying properly in batch migrated sites"

"Certain characters are not displaying correctly in the Course Description of sites that are batch imported from CourseTools. So far, I have noticed that quotation marks (") and the apostrophe (') are getting replaced with a box or a question mark, depending on your browser.

This problem was noticed with CourseTools to CTools batch migration, so it's of interest to UM, but it may point to a problem that would afflict other schools that use the batch migration feature."

The problem is related with some smart quote characters not decoded correctly. And it is an issue not only with Archive tool, but also to any tool which has base64 decode routine inside.

The solution is to replace smart quotes with normal quotes after decoding.

  • Zhen

column1: [SAK-2788] Resources--Layout does not follow other tools for adding new item
column6: User has to move deep within tool to add new resource, unlike other tools (announcements, assignments) that provide button at top of page.
column10: Resources--Layout does not follow other tools for adding new item
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Earlier versions of Sakai did have links at the top for operating on Resource items, however, a design decision was made (2.0 or 2.1?) to multiply and move some of these links next to each item.
column45: The point of that design decision is that resources are created in particular contexts (within collections or folders). In other tools, there is a default place that new items go. But that makes a lot less sense in resources. Resources is more like threaded discussion, where you can add messages by replying to messages deep in a hierarchy. In threaded discussion, you can also create a new message at the top level, but there's not an exact analogy to the "top level" in resources. You'd need to eventually select where to place the new item. If someone has a proposal for how this would be done, we'd be glad to hear it.

column1: [SAK-2784] Add Dutch translations of Sakai
column6:
The existing dutch translation of Sakai is incomplete. Most of the JSF-based tools have not been translated, as well as the XML-based tool registration and SQL initialization files.

Proposed solution: Check in the translated properties files. The translated XML-based tool registration and SQL initialization files can checked into a new source directory tree (sakai-src/i18n/nl_NL), where they will be available for institutions to use in place of default english definitions.

column1: [SAK-2782] Group memberships are incorrectly maintained when a user is dropped from a site
column6: When a user is removed from a site, his or her group memberships in the site must also be removed. They are currently maintained as group members, even though they are no longer a part of the site. Group memberships should be strict subsets of the containing site's memberships.
column10: Group memberships are incorrectly maintained when a user is dropped from a site
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: The current design is not to have the group membership being a subset of the site's. The tools may act that way now, but the underlying design is that the group membership can be any valid Sakai user.
column45: What is the use case for having group members that are not site members? This seems like an edge case that we're supporting at the cost of the very common case: users are removed from sites, while their orphaned group memberships hang around and confuse the site maintainer.
column49: Ok, new design is that site group azg is a sub-set of site azg... how things change...

column1: [SAK-2781] Sort Order of Replies Posted After a Draft
column6:
This is cloned from CT-219: Sort Order of Replies Posted After a Draft

"Maybe something to look at in an updated Discussions tool, or maybe a bug worth fixing now.

If I post a Draft reply, then post a live reply next. The live reply sorts under the draft, which puts it second on the reply list since the draft is first. But the expected behavior is for the live reply to sort at the bottom of the reply list since all the other live replies are posting in chronological order.

Refreshing the list on the discussion page (either by resetting the tool or by collapsing and then expanding all) will sort the new, live reply correctly-- which is good news.

I'm not sure this would come up in common use, but it comes up for me all the time in training. I demonstrate how to create a draft, then later I create a response and the list sorts strangly."

  • Zhen

column1: [SAK-2779] Multiple random draw parts  shouldn't be able to draw from same pool
column6:
This is new behavior in 2.1.0 that wasn't present in earlier versions.

When you create a random draw part in an assessment, the question pool you draw from should be associated with that part and not available for further use in that assessment. (That's if I understand the notes in SAK-1419 Closed correctly.)

Tested the following (separately) on all 3 nightly instances:

1. Created random draw part, followed by rd part using same pool

2. Created random draw part, followed by regular part with questions imported from same pool.

3. Imported questions from a pool to a part, then created a random draw part drawing from the same pool.

I was able to do all 3 of these on all instances, although after doing #1, previewing the assessment threw a nonfatal exception. (see attached).

#1 should definitely not be allowed. Possibly #2 and #3 should not be allowed either as they risk accidentally duplicating questions within an assessment. But at least they don't break anything.
column10: Multiple random draw parts  shouldn't be able to draw from same pool
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Sorry it took so long to write this one up- it had a lot of branching possibilities.
column45:
#2 and #3 are currently allowed. (They are not prohibited by our current specification)

#1 should not be allowed, I will look into that.

column75:
Margaret please verify the fix. The pulldown list should only show question pools not currently used by other random draw parts.

One thing to watch out: When you copy a pool, for example , p1 to p1-copy. you can only use one of them in random draw parts. A long time ago, someone decided that when you copy a pool, the items in the pools are actually shared. Only a new set of mappings are created. You can think of it as creating an alias for a pool when you copy a pool. I will have to ask Marc the rationale behind this. Anyways, we need to document this. Deleting items from a copied pool is fine, because it's the mapping that got deleted, not the item itself.
column80: One more note: it's possible to filter out all the pools that have shared questions with those pools already used for random draw parts, but it's going to be an very expensive. Also I'm not sure if it's the right thing to do. Users can copy p1 to p2 and then add another 10 questions in p2. We shouldn't exclude p2 from the available pools just because it shares a few questions with p1. Anyways, this needs to be revisited. Let's ask Marc why copyPool was designed this way and how people use it in real life.
column84: To avoid confusion, the work around would be to never include 2 random draw parts in the same assessment. If you want to have 2 random drawn parts, create 2 separate assessments for them.
column88: This issue was not verified in the formal QA process but is included in a production version of Sakai (2.1). If you find this is still a problem, please re-open.

column1: [SAK-2772] Inconsistent time selection widgets
column6:
Assignments and Section Info have different methods of selecting times, viz.:

Assignments: 3 drop-down list boxes (hh, mm, am/pm)
Section Info: freeform text input box for hh:mm, am/pm radio buttons

While the Style Guide does not appear to define a correct method, it creates a poor user experience to have different input methods in different tools.

While the Assignments style is somewhat limiting in the current implementation as it only provides time options in 15-minute intervals (0, 15, 30, 45), the am/pm selection style could be consistent at the very least.
column10: Inconsistent time selection widgets
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: This was a design decision for 2.1.0 to be re-visited in the future; standardizing across tools on a calendar/time widget.
column45: This is one of those trade-offs regarding legacy tools. Do we continue to use a control for consistencies-sake or make improvements along the way. Since Sakai tools are built on different technologies and built by different folks, I'm not sure how realistic it is that we will be able to systematically make changes to a control everywhere it's located. This is a much larger issue than the time control but something we need to think about and come up with a strategy moving forward.
column49: See SAK-7000 Closed for future progress on this issue.

column1: [SAK-2768] Rationalize timezone list
column6:
The list of timezones presented to the user is inconsistent and odd.

For example I'm not sure if the "SystemV/..." choices mean anything to anyone, and the geographical distribution is inconsistent (e.g. why Libya standalone rather than Africa/Libya, similarly for Poland rather than Europe/Poland). Some top-level groupings are continents, others countries.

It appears that this list comes from Java or system defaults, but it is not a good or consistent list from a user perspective. Sometimes geopolitical meanings are read into presentation issues like these.

In resolving this, offset timezones in the standard format GMT[+-]hhmm should be included, e.g. GMT+0200, which will further resolve a problem with system timezone settings not matching the list provided.

See SAK-2554 Closed for some history.

column1: [SAK-2767] when modifying questions from pools, duplicates are created instead of original modified
column6:
When you modify a question via an assessment (as simple as fixing a bad typo) that was set to be saved in a pool, the question does not get updated in the pool, but rather, the software adds a duplicate one with the changes.

This is a problem because when modifying a question, the user is not expecting a duplicate to be created, with the old/unmofified remaining in the pool. To eliminate the original bad one, the user would have to go to the pool, search for both instances of the questions, compare them, find which one is the most current, and delete the one without the modfications. Hardly any instructor will go through this trouble. If left as is, faculty will end up with lots of duplicate questions, half of which may have errors.

column1: [SAK-2766] Import/export assessment: multiple choice questions with more than four answers
column6:
There might be an existing issue on this, but I was unable to find one. Multiple choice questions with multiple correct answers are still not exporting/importing correctly. Specifically, most of the correct answers are lost.

An assessment with my test question is attached. The test question is:

Which of the following animals are not in the Chinese zodiac?

A. Pig/boar
B. Snake
C. Octopus ---- right
D. Dragon
E. Squirrel ---- right
F. Frog ---- right
G. Ox
H. Rabbit

All the selection-level feedback is lost and answer choices E and F get unchecked. (The Octopus answer always remains checked - maybe because it's the first correct answer?)

The feedback isn't so important, but the lost answer choices are.

Oh, I forgot. Important note: this is an EXPORT ONLY bug and fix. So an old XML file created with a correct answer in the range F, G, ... Z will not have that answer show up when imported.

To test the fix you need to export with the new code. (Either the old or new import code will work.)

column92:
The other regressions you mentioned are being tracked under SAK-2919 Closed .
I identified these are part of the regression fixed in SAK-2919 Closed .

There still appears to be a problem in single correct, if the correct answer is greater than the 4th. This was working originally, but with the new code that fixed everything else, that seems to be a problem. column96:
OK. I did some more testing with the current version.

It turns out that I am seeing very complex behavior, always with answers after the first four. However the problems do not show up on every possible combination, so it is actually possible to think that this probem is fixed or not to encounter it. I note that five and greater answers require the user to select a non-default number of answers, so this might have less impact than we think.

This is a major "go figure", so I am wracking my brains on this. Here goes:

1. MC SC with 6 answers with answer level, correct and incorrect feedback. Set E correct. Exports and imports correctly.

2. MC MC with 6 answers with "A"," E", "F" correct and with answer level, correct and incorrect feedback. Export and import lose the answer "F", but all else is normal.

3. MC SC with 6 answers with answer level, correct and incorrect feedback. Set "F" correct. Export and import lose the answer "F", but all else is normal. Of course there is no correct answer now, but I mean the feedbacks and text are retained.

4. MC MC with 9 answers with "A"," E", "H", "I" correct and with answer level, correct and incorrect feedback. Export and import lose the answer "H", but all else is normal.

5. I may see a pattern here. If we have a multiple correct with feedbacks and the correct selections are "A", "E", "F", "G", "H", "I", "J" . Export and import lose the alternate answers, and only "A", "E", "G", "I" are marked correct. And--

6. If I do an identical question, but mark all correct, the correctness on the first four is preserved, but ALTERNATES on every other answer past the first four.
column100:
FIX DETAILS
==========
I fixed import to correctly align correct answer feedback so it doesn't affect correct flagging, export to work independed of order in answer feedback
modules:
component/src/java/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/qti/helper/item/
ItemHelper12Impl.java tool/src/web

app/xml/xsl/dataTransform/import/v1p2/
extractItem.xsl
Fix revision 4414.

Testing notes:
This is primarily an export bug. The answer feedback was misaligned and resulting in unflagging alternate correct answers beyound the first four (as described above).

In doing so this exposed an order dependency in import. I changed import to not care about the answer feedback relative position. So to properly read post-4414 XML you will need to have a post-4414 server.

However, I also tried to make this backwardly compatible with earlier answer level feedback, such as found in the actual 2.1 release.

TESTING SUGGESTIONS
1. To test this fix, make both MCSC and MCMC questions, add at least two extra questions.
For the MCSC flag "F" (or "H","J", "L".... etc.) as correct and add all feedback.
For the MCMC flag all as correct.
Export/import

2. Also, if you have XML from the 2.1 release, run the same test.

3. Do at least one regression test vs a 2.1release build for all types.

4. You can make other combinations, but the only thing I was seeing pre-fix was alternate>4 correctness, so test case 1 is aminimum.
column104: verified on stable instances

column1: [SAK-2765] SG validation example is insufficient for complex forms
column6:
The validation example provided by the style guide (http://cvs.sakaiproject.org/cgi-bin/cvsweb.cgi/%7echeckout%7e/scratch/styleguide/example/form-val.html) works well for simple validation scenarios, such as missing text inputs. But when there are different kinds of validation problems that can occur on each form control, things get more complex. The Section Info tool, for instance, has several different validation rules applied.

– End time must not be before start time
– End time can not be entered if no start time is entered
– Start/end time is not a valid time

Plus, combine any of the above with any of the below:

– Title is empty
– Title is a duplicate

The validation messages must be displayed on the components themselves, since there may be different kinds of problems on each individual form control. A message at the top of the page is good, but insufficient.

column1: [SAK-2761] Presentation Tool Help Content Incomplete
column6:
Presentation tool help does not adequately explain process. Steps should be described sequentially and completely: 1. Go to Resources tool 2. Create a folder named "Presentations." 3. Create a subfolder with the name of the presentation you plan to create (example: "Margaret's Presentation"). 4. Upload the image files for your presentation into that folder. Only image files, such as jpeg, tif, etc. can be used.

Also need to indicate if PowerPoint slides can be uploaded, and if not, whether they can be modified so they can.

We should also consider making this whole thing less confusing by adding "Presentation" as a type of file in the Resources Add File dropdown, which would automagically create a presentations folder and prompt users to create the folder for their presentations.

column1: [SAK-2753] True/False question doesnt remember answer
column6:
At our pilot server at Stockholm university. A teacher raported it to me and I've reproduced it:

Create a test/quizz with a True/False question with point value set to 1.0. I also included a multiple choice question (also 1.0) to have something to work with. Add an access student, log in and take the published quizz, answer the quizz with correct answers. Submit for grading.

Back to the maintain account, look at scores, the point value for the T/F question is't counted, it's 0.

Also, I found out that the mark for the correct answer on the T/F question wasn't recorded/remembered. It was left blank, so maybe that is what cased it.

column1: [SAK-2750] SSL cert validation error
column6:
TwinPeaks is only partially successfully in search repositories. Steps to reproduce:

  • Click on Bookmark link in HTMLArea editor (e.g. when adding new html doc to Resources)
  • Search for "Catalysis"

Screen display output is:
—
Results of searching all repositories for Catalysis
Highly regioselective diels-alder cycloaddition of 1,1-dimethyl-1,3-butadienes under lewis acid catalysis : application to taxoid synthesis
http://hdl.handle.net/1783.1/1120
Nanoscale confined biomimetic catalysts : synthesis, characterization and catalysis
http://hdl.handle.net/1783.1/1476
P-chiral phosphine oxide ligands for asymmetric catalysis
http://hdl.handle.net/1783.1/1117
Studies on asymmetric reactions and catalysis using axially chiral 2-substituted N,N-dialkyl-1-naphthamides and p-chiral secondary phosphine oxides
http://hdl.handle.net/1783.1/1214
The preparation and reactions of P-chiral phosphine oxides for asymmetric catalysis
http://hdl.handle.net/1783.1/1484
Results of searching all repositories for Catalysis
Results of searching all repositories for Catalysis
Failed: RepositoryManager Exception org.osid.repository.RepositoryException: Operation failed
—

catalina.out logs:

—
SRW Query: https://hedwig.mit.edu/dspace-srw/search/DSpace?query=dc.title+%3D+%22Catalysis%22+or+dc.title.alternative+%3D+%22Catalysis%22+&version=1.1&operation=searchRetrieve&recordSchema=info%3Asrw%2Fschema%2F1%2Fdc-v1.1&maximumRecords=1&startRecord=1&resultSetTTL=0&recordPacking=xml&recordXPath=&sortKeys=
javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: sun.security.validator.ValidatorException: No trusted certificate found
at com.sun.net.ssl.internal.ssl.BaseSSLSocketImpl.a(DashoA12275)
...
INFO: sun.security.validator.ValidatorException: No trusted certificate found (2005-11-10 14:44:53,228 http-8443-Processor24_org.sakaiproject.component.osid.logging.WritableLog)
—

This appears to be a certificate validation error with https://hedwig.mit.edu which is using a certificate signed by MIT CA rather than a public CA.

Presumably this could be worked around by importing the MIT CA public cert into a local keystore, but there must be a more elegant way for Sakai to handle this rather than present an exception to the user.

column1: [SAK-2748] Worksite tab spacing
column6:
Currently there is a small space between each worksite tab. This prevents look and feel options that require overlapping, shaded tabs.
This can be avoided by stringing all the <li> together on one line, as opposed to having each tab on a new line.
column10: Worksite tab spacing
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Andrea,

Could we have more details please?

If there is a rendering issue - a screenshot would be of great value. As well as the circumstances under which the issue became apparent (where, what tab, user agent, operating system, etc.)

If this is a recommendation - some markup (before and after) would be of great use.

The "site navigation" tabs already consist of an unordered list of items set to display inline. This should result in a single line display.

If what you are refering to is the "whitespace" in the markup having an unintended result in the rendering - I would be very interested in hearing more about it.

Thanks!
column45:
Thanks for the clarification - that is what I thought. Am very sorry for the trouble this is causing you.

We might not get this done this turn around - it is the portal servlet that produces that markup - and am not sure how much work we can put into it at this point when it is quite likely it will be replaced soon with something more templatized that separates logic, content and presentation.

That said, may I offer an interim solution if you are willing to undo it after the root issue is resolved?

Give the unclassed <li> a negative hmargin: this will pull them together, then you can separate the contents via padding of the <li> or the margins of the contained <a> Some fudges and hacks in the portal sheet may need to be tinkered with.

I will send you an email with the address to a test server where this is done. Let me know if this works for you or if you come up with some improvements to the suggestion or if it does not work at all.
column49: This involves removing all whitespace when printing the tabs into the response. Since there is a workaround and since the portal may be revamped anyways I am marking this as post 2.1, and downgrading it.

column1: [SAK-2745] Clicking on a folder name causes screen to jump
column6:
gsilver (Jim: since we are reloading the page not sure what can be done with this - I thiught to consolidate all Resources issues on your plate so as no to confude matters.)

-------------------------------

Click on a folder name or the expand/collapse icon in Resources or Dropbox causes the screen to jump and then reposition back to where it should be.

This only occurs on IE6, and only where there is already a vertical scrollbar (for example where the list of tools is such that it extends off the bottom of the page on 1024x768).

To recreate, setup a site with all tools visible, select Resources or Dropbox, and click on a folder name.

What is happening is IE is repositioning the page such that the top of the tool (below the title, i.e. Location is at the top of the browser window, and then shortly after repositioning again back to the usual display (Sakai banner is at the top).

This is extremely visually distracting.

column41: The user actions described here involve a round-trip to the server. A new page is being loaded within the frame. Unless we make some kind of wholesale change in the way Sakai works, there is no way to avoid this kind of "jump" when the page is being reloaded.

column80:
OK scratch that last commment completely everyone's now using .navIntraTool, and the FF thing isn't really part of the issue.

The difference is that – at least for Wiki – we stick a XML process instruction at the start. If we remove that then IE renders the toolbar without the spacing at the side.

Should we remove the PI from the wiki jsps?
column84:
Hi,

Yes - I see it: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>

Any node before the doctype declaration may bung up display in IE, I am afraid. This includes any node, comment, anythnig. They will shortcircuit the doctype declaration and throw IE into quirks mode, which means all rendering bets are off. And certain things, like the toolbar (because of the special margins), really depend on the browser operating on standards compliance mode.

See:
http://www.designpride.com/index.php?id=97

This should be fixed for IE 7 (yawn)
http://blogs.msdn.com/ie/archive/2005/09/15/467901.aspx

This is the case with all the tools where this issue crops up. Please see:

http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-1443
http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-1715

Tests & Quizzes (aka Samigo) still has the problem - in that case it is html comments before the prolog. Other tools may too (pi, comment or whitespace even).

Andrew - would you consider testing this - removing the PI and checking to see if that takes care of the issue? Many thanks, and sorry for the trouble.

Stephen - if there are toolbar issues with any other tool that you know of - can you check the source and see if any of the bits mentioned above are present? Many thanks.

  • Gonzalo
  • - - - - - quoting - - - - - - - -
    The difference is that – at least for Wiki – we stick a XML process instruction at the start. If we remove that then IE renders the toolbar without the spacing at the side.

Should we remove the PI from the wiki jsps?

column1: [SAK-2733] Accessibility: Add heading levels to content (Global)
column6: <h5> tags should be added to text for: Title, Open Date, Due Date, Accept Until, Student Submissions, Grade Scale, and Assignment Instructions to facilitate navigation.
column7: Windows XP service pack 2, IE 6.029, JAWS 4.5, MySQL instance
column10: Accessibility: Add heading levels to content (Global)
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Mike,

Correct me if I am wrong.

  • this was not on the individual tool reviews
  • it is an "accessibility enhancement" rather than somethig that would merit a "major" label
  • it is something that should be reformulated as a general rule, rather than targetted specifically to this or that tool - something of the order of "all input labels should be a header, one level higher than the parent header (so if parent header is h4, label should be h5)"
  • it should be discussed by participants as a "general rule" and adpoted and codified.

For these reasons I am making this fixable Post-2.1 - as a part of a accessibility second pass.
column45: That sounds right. I wanted to be sure that it was captured in Jira so it could become part of the post 2.1 workflow.
column49: For 2.5 we will have a concerted effort to remarkup semantically - following a new markup style guide. This will be part of that effort.
column75: [Bulk Change] This issue is currently Unresolved, however, it has a Fix Version set. In keeping with the newly added Target Version, Fix Versions should only be set for Resolved Issues, and only after it has been merged to that version specifically. The Fix Version is being reset to Unknown for this issue. Please use the Target Version to indicate when you plan to address this issue.
column80:
I am going to go with the following heuristic, and close this so that the issue gets the attention it needs.

1 - Reserve headers for delimiting semantic blocks to which SR navigation might be needed. Once inside the block, SR should be provided with navigation/markers native to that block: labels and inputs, properly constructed tables, text block markup, etc.

2 - Do not double up headers with any other markup that has SR meaning on its own.

3 - The maximum depth/number of headers should be constrained to 2 and 5 (at each level) respectively. This is somewhat arbitrary - the aim of a limit here is to provide enough information but no overwhelm.

So - am closing this. If any specific recommendations (following the heuristic above or not) are made to specific tools, please open an accessibility JIRA.
column84: Reopening of closed accessibility issues for review by Accessibility group.
column88: Closing this. Headers should be specified if needed on a view by view basis.

This appears to be an IE bug. After discussion with Ray and Gonzalo, the best solution appears to be to inform users that the up and down keys work properly in combination with the alt key. The alternative, to provide a javascript workaround, is considered too fragile and inconsistent in non-IE browsers.

It is recommended that the following text be inserted so that it is read 1) prior to selecting items in menu, or 2) prior to entering combo box. Is the below possible?

<option value="" selected="selected">- more - Press alt + up and down arrows to scroll through menu</option>

with Press, etc. in hidden text format?

Finally, are we sure that adding "onkeypress" or "onkeydown" won't solve the problem? :^)

column1: [SAK-2726] Email-archive tool should change the smtp return path for outgoing mail
column6:
The outgoing email service does not change the smtp envelope from address (return path) for outgoing mail. Consequently, a user who sends an email to a site email address will receive any bounces that happen to be generated because one or more user email addresses are invalid, or the message is bounced for other reasons (spam/virus filters, etc.).

This is undesirable because the user sending the email message is emailing a group address, and has no control over the individual destination addresses.

The email service should have a config option to allow the return path address to be configured so that bounces go to a site owner (similar to mailing lists) or a globally defined bounce address rather than the original sender address.

This problem is currently visible on collab.sakaiproject.org - emailing to a DG (e.g. sepp-ui@collab.sakaiproject.org) produces a string of "out of the office" and other auto-replies.

column80: '#' should not be allowed in resource-id's for the same reason that '?' and '%' are not allowed. They are all used as delimiters in URLs. So we are now treating '#' the same way we treat '?' and '%', by turning them into underscores when they appear in a resource-id.
column84: Thanks, Derek, for catching this and giving us good info about the conditions under which it ooccurred.
column88:
Changed the title to reflect additional characters that cause this or similar problems.

The original report related to '#' in a filename or title of a newly uploaded resource. The problem also occurs if '#' is in the title of a newly created resource (such as a folder, html page, simple text document). The problem also occurs if a resource is created with '&' or '=' in the title.
column92: Now we have dealt with '&', '=' and '#'. Please verify that they all work OK.
column96: This issue was not verified in the formal QA process but is included in a production version of Sakai (2.1). If you find this is still a problem, please re-open.
