column1: [SAK-2506] Accessibility--Enhance "Refresh" function (Stage-2)
column6:
Refresh Change Request
Goal:
¿ Allow screen reader users to successfully use Sakai (refresh bumps screen reader to the beginning of the page every 10 seconds)
¿ Get rid of annoying click and page redraw every 10 seconds
¿ Keep current dynamic update functionality

Stage 1
Implement refresh in a way that the browser doesn't click or repaint the screen with each refresh. The screen will only be repainted when there has been a change in the active tool. This likely utilizes JavaScript and XmlHttpsRequest technology.

Refresh control will still need to be user controlled for this stage since, however infrequent, refresh will disrupt the AT user. If stage 2 does not make the 2.0 release plan, we should look at improving the flow for this control. A potential solution is to (display a hidden for sighted users) message or link on the first page users hit upon log-in to take them to the page where the control exists.

Stage 2
Implement "you've got mail" type functionality that will display a message to users that let's them know something has changed in their active tool (or maybe in the site in general) and allows them to choose to see those updates. Screen reader users will likely have some sort of sound alert. We'll potentially give the users a digest of what's new. TTools team will design in the legacy tools refactor project.

Exception: By default, chat tool will refresh and will implement an "accessibility mode" for screen readers that allows them to manually update the page.
column10: Accessibility--Enhance "Refresh" function (Stage-2)

Thank you.

column49:
permissions does not solve the problem, because there isn't a separate browse permission. There's still no way to handle things like images in tests. Instead some tools have developed ways of hiding things in nonstandard places, and others continue to have the problem.

I offered to implement a separate permission, but had no takers. This is clearly too late for 2.9, but should be on the list as a requirement for either 2.10 or 2.9.1. Last time I made this offer I had the development time to actually do a clean permission implementation, and had roughed it out. At this point it's not clear that I am in a position to do it.

column1: [SAK-2474] Active web services sessions time out
column6:
An active long-running web service session gets timed out after the default timeout interval.

How to reproduce:

1. Set the timeout interval in sakai.properties to something short, e.g. 180s:

inactiveInterval@org.sakaiproject.api.kernel.session.SessionManager=180

2. Start a long-running web services script, e.g. this perl script which creates new sites:

—
#! /usr/bin/perl

use SOAP::Lite;
use DirHandle;
use FileHandle;
use strict;

my $true = SOAP::Data->value('true')->type('boolean');

column1: [SAK-2471] When creating a Sakai Site through web services do not automatically add the admin to the site
column6:
The web services automatically adds the adminsitrator to each newly created site. This causes a performance problem when the administrator is trying to do their work.

The admin can already enter any site and if there is a desire to have the admin added explicitly, this should be done by a spearate web service call (i.e. allow the WS client to make the choice).
column10: When creating a Sakai Site through web services do not automatically add the admin to the site
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
More detail: the webservices call that does this is addNewSite() in SakaiScript.jws. If the user calling addNewSite is not admin however, then the calling user should probably be added to the site automatically with maintain rights, otherwise it would be possible to create an orphaned site (that the creating user cannot access).

Or perhaps addNewSite could have an extra parameter to control this (add creator to site).
column45: This is no longer an issue. The person who creates the site is the only one added to the site with maintain permissions at creation time. If its the admin user that creates the site, then they are added, but if another user does it, they are added and the admin user is not.

1) The following message displays when the Wiki tool is clicked when logged in as admin. The same message displays for both Course & Project sites. The links for default_template are not operational because the template is not available in Realms. Message:

Default_template
Page Does not exist.
The page you just accessed does not exist, and so has been created for you. You may now edit this page to change its content
Default Template
This page default_template is used as a template for new pages. You may:
Change it on a worksite basis by editing default_template
Change it on a installation wide basis by changing DefaultPage.txt referenced in components.xml

Permission Denied
You do not have the correct permissions.

Issues 1.
Although this is confusing, I think this is working correctly, unless there is annother error message that isnt in the report. I will try and explain.
There is a page "default_template" that is used to populate pages that dont exist. This page, wihch is configured in components.xml (as the page says) contains the words "Page Does Not Exits". So on the Home page for the first time. You see the Home page, newly populated with the defualt_template. Which contains links to "default_template" itself. You will notice that the links dont have a ? at the end. Click on the link you get to the "default_template" page.

If you edit the "default_template" page, save it, go back to the Home page, Edit it, (add a new link eg [Page2]), save it, click on the Page2? link, you will see a copy of the "default_template" page.

Does that make sense ? If there was an additional error, or it does not, please say.

Issue 2

None of the rwiki.permissions are set in the !group.template !group.template.course (and possibly other realms) So there is no permissions to read the page. This should have been set by the realm sql script.

I think this only applies to the Oracle instance, but this needs checking.

column1: [SAK-2463] User information not shared between Account and Profile Tools
column6:
User information is not shareed bewteen the Account and Profile Tools. For example, if you create an account as admin using the User tool, and specify the First and Last Name, those fields are still empty in the profile tool. If you assign a First and Last Name in the Profie tool, then those values do not change what appears in Account.

It looks like the Account tool wins in 2.1. For instance, if you post a Resource, Sakai users the First/Last Name from Account for the Created By field.

Will these two tools often be used in the same installation of Sakai? Or is the general intent to use one or the other?
column10: User information not shared between Account and Profile Tools
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Our change to the profile code to allow propagating name and email address changes from profile to account info is here:

http://source.cet.uct.ac.za/svn/sakai/trunk/patches/patch_profile.diff
column45:
This is a big issue for some users, particularly women whose legal, married name is different from the one that they commonly use. It also affects people who generally prefer to be called by their middle name or a nickname.

But if the "Profile" name is going to be used instead of the account name, some care has to be taken about how that works. For instance, in the roster or gradebook, the name should probably match the authoritative university records (the "account" name), otherwise paper rosters would not match what is seen in Sakai and students could cloak their identities, creating some confusion for the instructor. But communication tools (presence, jforum, message center, chat, etc) should reflect the profile name.

column6: Looking at the the add sections page now, I realize we should also let the users know how the location will be truncated. Let's change the note next the location field to say, "12 characters max; i.e. "117 Du...Center" for "117 Duderstat Media Center".

column41:
I can't believe I'm going to continue on this thread, but here goes

"12 characters max..." is confusing. It's not the max. How about merging the old with the new:

"12 characters will be displayed; i.e. "117 Du...Center" for "117 Duderstat Media Center"
column45:
Well, if we're going to continue this thread and I really just cannot resist this one, unless the President of U-M is willing to deal with folks knocking on her door...

I'm not sure truncating short text fields in this way – when the fields are used for this specific type of meeting place context – is a good approach. The first part of a typical "address" or "location" string is almost always unique, like the street number or room number. The next part is generally unique as well, the first part of the name of the street or first part of the name of the building. The last part of the name, however, is generally not unique; for example, Street/Avenue/Road/Parkway or Building/Hall/Center/Lirbary/Annex. So, if you are giving up half of the 12 spaces to the last part of location, then you may can run into non-distinguishable strings very easily. For instance – and I'm just guessing at the logic of how space or word breaks are handled here because I can't get to a running Sakai 2.1 at the moement – "4234B LSA Admin Annex" might become "4234B ... Annex", which doesn't really do much to differentiate it from "1200A Museum Annex" becoming "1200A ... Annex". Which "Annex" is the section in?

Or, my personal favourite, "2074 Fleming Administration Building" (our President's office), which would become "2074 F...uilding", to be confused with "2074 Frieze Building" as "2074 F...uilding" (a classroom I used to teach in)
column49: The idea is to allow for "Smith Lecture Hall #3", where the #3 is very important. But your points are well taken. Perhaps we stop trying to do a human job with a computer and simply limit the max size of the field. THe instructor can then abbreviate how s/he sees fit.
column75:
Nice example. We've got a few like that too, such as Angell Hall Auditorium C, but they are in the vast minority, and happen to appear on my syllabus this term as Aud C Angell Hall Wonder what campuses are like?

I would agree that forcing the human to take care of doing the right thing here would be the best, quickest fix.
column80: Let's ditch the internal truncation. Aud C Angell Hall = 17 characters including spaces. Is UM being profligate here? Or is this the perfect use case?
column84: I set location to a 20 character limit. If after testing it out a bit this value doesn't seem right, we can reopen this.

column1: [SAK-2446] Resources tool should handle runtime exceptions but let dispatcher deal with catastrophic errors

column1: [SAK-2445] List of Supported Tools in Site Archive
column6:
It has generally been the case that when new tools are added to Sakai, (e.g., Samigo, Gradebook) they don't have Site Archive support in their early releases. Because there is a high-expectation that any tool in a Sakai site is part of the Site Archive import/export, it should be clearly emphasized which tools are not. (See also SAK-2440 Closed .)

The list should not be an exhaustive list of what is and is not supported, that belongs in the release notes, but rather should be an accurate indication for the specific site being archived. It could be presented as a table listing all the tools in the site and indicating their inclusion in the arhcive or not. Or, it could be a simple list of the tools in the site that are not being included in the export.
column10: List of Supported Tools in Site Archive
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

column1: [SAK-2444] Create special icon for very large collections
column6:
Folder icons are used in the list view of the resources tool to indicate the following:

  • an empty folder
  • an unexpanded folder that is not empty
  • an expanded folder that is not empty

Another icon should be added to indicate a folder that is too large to expand. This icon should be used for resource collections with more than a few hundred members (actual number to be determined). The user's ability to expand such folders should be disabled, and that should be replaced with the ability to navigate to a paged view of the collection.

Until that is implemented, let's replace the "expand" icon with a new icon indicating the collection is too large to expand. We will also disable the expand icon but let users navigate to the collection. And if the user clicks "expand all", very large collections should not be expanded.

See SAK-2442 Resolved for information about design of the paged view.

column1: [SAK-2443] Add support in ContentHosting for paged view of very large collections
column6:
Folder icons are used in the list view of the resources tool to indicate the following:

  • an empty folder
  • an unexpanded folder that is not empty
  • an expanded folder that is not empty

Another icon should be added to indicate a folder that is too large to expand. This icon should be used for resource collections with more than a few hundred members (actual number to be determined). The user's ability to expand such folders should be disabled, and that should be replaced with the ability to navigate to a paged view of the collection.

The paged view should include a search capability. It should allow the user to select/specify the number of members that should show per page. In this paged view, the user will be able to expand the members of this collection (provided the member is not too large).

column75: Assigning to Gonzalo for design work
column80:
I would suggest this approach:

1) If the top-level folder in a site or dropbox contains more than N items, use the same paging widget as in the other sites area.

2) Allow each subfolder to expand/collapse as usual, except if a subfolder contains more than N items, make it a folder that can be navigated to but not expanded (special icon, title attribute, etc).

3) If a user navigates to a subfolder with more than N items, use the paging widget.

What is N? Probably whatever is used for page-size in the other sites paging widget.

This approach allows us to use the paging widget at the top level but not within any subfolder unless you navigate to it.
column84: What is N? In SAK-2444 Closed , N is 255. For collections with 255 or more members (i.e. folders and resources at the next level down in the hierarchy) the special icon is shown and the user must navigate to the folder rather than expanding it in line. Does it make sense that the page size should be 255? Or would it make more sense to split that in half, make the default page size 128?
column88: I think that paging is set up elsewhere (site participants at Site Info, Announcements list, Gradebook list, list of sites at My Workspace) with a dropdown that offers 5, 10, 20, 50, 100, 200. So, I'd say that 200 is kind of a magic number. Easier to predict than 255 or 128.
column92:

http://www-personal.umich.edu/~gsilver/sak-2442/
column96:
This design is very nice. I think it would work ... pretty much ... for drop boxes only. The UI for other resources collections would be different.

We could support pagination as described (or paging by accounts rather than by rows in the table) for drop boxes. Search in the drop box UI by user would work with additional work in CHS or filtering at the tool level. But there is not an efficient way in the current CHS to do search by title in a large collection like this. If you do a search, I'm assuming the results would be shown below, and if the result is more than the page size, you'd get a paging widget in that display as well.
column100:
So

Dropbox: search and pagination (and paginate search returns)
Resources: pagination.

Is this correct? Thanks!

column1: [SAK-2437] Site dropdown list should be limited to a reasonable max number of entries
column6:
When a very large number of sites is created (for example over 10,000), logging in as Admin causes all of these sites to be listed in the 'more' dropdown list in the site tabs bar.

This has a performance impact, partly because the resulting HTML file for that frame is very large (1.7M for about 12000 sites for example) and partly because it takes the browser a long time to parse all that. It probably also takes the Sakai code a while to generate it.

So the 'more' dropdown list should be limited to some maximum, for example 100 sites. This does not limit functionality, since it's possible to navigate to any site through Worksite Setup.

Seth

column1: [SAK-2433] Creating and populating Site Groups deletes previously created Sections from site
column6:
Wsan't sure if this should go to Zhen or Josh . . . .

Creating and populating Site Groups deletes previously created Sections from site. To reproduce

Log in as admin

1. Create multiple sections in Section Info tool without adding any additional metadata or populating the sections with members
2. Create a new group in Site Info and add all site members to the group except admin
3. Sections no longer appear in Section Info or in Sites under add/edit groups
column10: Creating and populating Site Groups deletes previously created Sections from site
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
It appears that this is a case where optimistic locking is needed. This problem occurs only if you:

1. Open Site Info and start revising the site
2. Create the sections in Section Info
3. Add a group in Site Info
4. Save the site in Site Info

My guess is that Site Info is keeping a copy of the Site object in session scope, so when it saves the Site, it overwrites any changes to the site that have occurred in other tools. As an alternative to keeping the Site itself, perhaps Site Info can keep the site ID and when it is ready to save the site, it can get a fresh copy, do whatever group manipulations are needed, then save the fresh site object.

column1: [SAK-2431] Apply the Rutgers Performance Fixes for MySql
column6:
Take Rutgers MySql Patches from http://rulink.rutgers.edu/sakai/ and apply.

We're not completed yet. We started out with 20 active users taking 90% of our 2-processor Netra for the MySQL process. We got it down to 5-25% by using the appropriate /etc/my.cnf. Now we're starting the hard part: optimizing the queries. The changes shown here have been done by running mysql with "-log-slow-queries=/tmp/sqllog --log-queries-not-using-indexes". I've been attacking the non-indexed queries.

While we haven't yet tried the results under a real load, we have verified that the most bothersome queries take .25 sec on our pilot system, and they're fairly common. Our production configuration will have 20 - 100 times the number of users, and these queries will probably scale as number of users (actually number of realms). So we clearly wouldn't be able to survive these in production. The optimized version takes < 0.01 sec on the pilot system. On a build system I've gone through many of the common paths through the system to make sure that none of these maximally problematical queries are generated. However I'm sure that are other problematical ones I haven't found yet.

Files:

DbRealmService.java
DbRealmService.java.orig
DbRealmService.java.diff
Tuning guide
Changes:

Aug 8, 2005. New DbRealmService.java. Fixes SQL syntax. The syntax normally worked, but would fail if run with prepared statement caching on.

WARNING: I have made no attempt to check which DB is in use and issue different SQL. This code is for MySQL. This version of DbRealmService may not even work with Oracle, much less perform well.

column6: Request the ability to change the username or user_id of a user in Sakai.

column41: See SAK-817 Closed for request to change a user's name in Sakai.
column45:
A suggested workaround for changing a user's username, as practiced by Indiana:

From: Brokamp, Kevin M
Sent: Thursday, October 27, 2005 11:20 AM
Subject: User Renames

Here is how we currently handle renames-

1. We receive an incident from ITPO. Oncourse is usually the last stop on
the rename train so all of the other accounts (ADS etc.) have already been
renamed.

2. We run the following query which tells us if the user has ever logged
into CL-

select title from sakai_site where site_id like '%username'

3. If they haven't logged in (query returns with a value of 0), we get in
and rename them on the classic side. If they have logged in (query returns
with a value of 1), we run the following queries to check and see if they
have any items in 'My Workspace' resources-

!--Lists files in My Workspace resources
select * from content_resource where IN_COLLECTION like
'%/user/kmbrokam/%'

!--Provides information on folders located in My Workspace resources
select * from content_collection where collection_id like
'%username%'

4. If they don't have any items in resources, we proceed by renaming them
in original Oncourse. If they do have items in resources, we rename them in
original Oncourse, create a local Sakai account under their old username,
log in under that account and pull down the resource items manually. We
then create a local Sakai account under their new username and upload the
resource items to that account. After this is complete, we delete both of
the local Sakai accounts and use the 'Become User' tool to make sure the
resources are appearing under their new username.

There are some concerns with this process as it does not address how the
student shows up under the gradebook (and I'm sure there are other things
that probably need to get updated on the backend), but this is the process
that's currently in place.

Thanks,
Kevin

nightly2's tomcat logs shows this (several times in a row) when trying to add multiple sections:

WARN: Sql.dbWrite(): sql: insert into SAKAI_SITE_GROUP_PROPERTY( GROUP_ID, NAME, VALUE, SITE_ID ) values (?,?,?,?) binds: 04fca70c-fbbb-4c75-800c-02289ae55f7b sections_sunday false 93cfcb35-7b9b-45e7-00e5-07f73cff24fa java.sql.SQLException: ORA-00001: unique constraint (SAK.SYS_C0020987) violated
(2005-10-28 12:15:21,944 http-8082-Processor24_org.sakaiproject.component.framework.sql.BasicSqlService)
column75:
This appears to be the problem:

ALTER TABLE SAKAI_SITE_GROUP_PROPERTY
ADD ( PRIMARY KEY (SITE_ID, NAME) ) ;

instead of what we have in hsqldb:

PRIMARY KEY (GROUP_ID, NAME)

This should have been:

ALTER TABLE SAKAI_SITE_GROUP_PROPERTY
ADD ( PRIMARY KEY (GROUP_ID, NAME) ) ;

MySql and Oracle were incorrect.

To fix, either re-create the Site tables from the sakai_site_group.sql or just drop and re-create this index with correct DDL.

column1: [SAK-2422] Add Method to UserDirectoryProvider to cause User Record to be created
column6:
Before calling authenticate(), if the User object does not exist the UserDirectoryService calls the following method:

boolean createUserRecord(String id)

The provider indicates via "true" that the User Record is to be created for this user before calling authenticate. If this is true, there will always be a UserEdit passed in for you to mess with in the provider.

If the provider ever says "yes" - U.D.S will create the user record, the record is created and stays forever. The provider is not asked again once the User rtecord exists.

This method may not be called everytime authenticate() is called - only for those cases where the user record does not exist.

column1: [SAK-2361] Can't create sections
column6:
Tested on the nightly oracle and mysql instances at Stanford
( oracle = http://coursework-s1.stanford.edu:28080/portal )
( mysql = http://coursework-s1.stanford.edu:29080/portal )

Creating/viewing sections throws an exception on both these nightly instances, although the behavior is significantly different on each one.

I'll test the nightly2.sakaiproject.org instance next and report.

Steps on mysql instance:

1. Log in as marith/marith

2. Go to "project test site" > Section Info tool

3. See overview page, and the "There are no sections" message.

4. Click on "Add Sections" and choose Lecture type from the menu.

5. Fill in all fields and click add button to create section.

6. Exception (see attached file 10.26.view-section):

org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: Hibernate operation: null, message from server: "Duplicate entry '' for key 2"; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: null, message from server: "Duplicate entry '' for key 2"

------------------------------

Steps taken on nightly oracle instance:

1. Log in as marith/marith

2. Go to project site "marith oracle" > Section Info tool.

3. See overview page and message that there are no sections yet.

4. Click Add Sections and choose to add 1 lecture section.

5. Fill in all fields and click add button to create section.

6. I'm returned to the Overview screen. There's a message with a green checkbox saying the section was created successfully, but I don't see it - there are still no sections listed.

7. Click on Add Sections again and choose to add 2 discussion sections.

8. Fill in all fields, again, and click Add.

9. I'm returned to the Overview screen again with the same success message saying the 2 discussion sections have been created. Now I see an entry for section "discussion1" on the overview page, with the appropriate links. But there's still no sign of the lecture section or the other discussion section.

10. Go to My Workspace and then back to the Section Info tool, to see if that refreshes/updates the list.

11. boom! Exception (see attached 10.26.view-sectioninfo):

ERROR: Servlet.service() for servlet sakai.sections threw exception (2005-10-26 15:21:55,749 http-28080-Processor22_org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.[Catalina].[localhost].[/sakai-sections-tool].[sakai.sections])
javax.faces.FacesException: org.apache.jasper.JasperException

12. Log out of Sakai and back in again to try and reset the servlet. Nope, I still get the same exception every time I visit Section Info in this site.

column1: [SAK-2358] No way to remove Gradebook storage
column6: There's currently no way for the framework to delete all data of a Gradebook for a given site. This means, for example, that when a course site is deleted, its gradebook-related data will continue to clutter up the DB. And, if a new site is created with the same UID as the old site, it might pick up the old gradebook data.
column10: No way to remove Gradebook storage
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Oliver, I assigned this to you to check the priority and think about whether it should be reclassified as a bug.

(Since the subject's fresh in my mind, I'll make a technical note: this will involve adding a Sakai EntityProducer to the Gradebook to be notified about site changes. When that happens, we should change gradebook creation to use the same approach.)
column45: This issue with other tools was treated as a bug, and should be here as well. Tools should always clean up after themselves
column49: Peter, I must admit to feeling some sympathy with that sentiment....
column75: Let's prioritize and start work on it after the feature freeze.
column80:
I added a deleteGradebook method to the Gradebook service in revision 3333.

Next I'll hook it up to the Sakai EntityProducer to listen for site deletions.
column84:
When Sakai removes the Gradebook tool from a site or deletes a site with a Gradebook, the Gradebook storage is now deleted.

Checked in as revision 3339.
column88: I don't think that when the GB is removed from a site that the information should be deleted. What if someone inadvertantly clicks GB when removing another tool? The only time data should be removed is when the site is deleted.
column92: If possible, gradebook data should be expunged only upon site deletion.
column96:
I'll go ahead and follow the marching orders. But, as with import/export and Help functionality, it would be helpful to developers for the folks in charge to define the requirements across Sakai.

Glenn's comments indicated that he expected tools to delete storage when removed from the site.

Peter's comment suggests that it should be standard procedure for tools to clean up after themselves, but when I check the code, it looks as if the legacy "Announcements", "Calendar", "Chat", "Content", "Discussion", and "Mail" services all just disable themselves, keeping storage in place, even when the site is deleted. Maybe I'm searching for the wrong thing, but I don't find anything else (other than the Gradebook) reacting to site deletion at all.
column100:
The Gradebook will now only delete its data when the site is deleted. Removing the Gradebook from a site and then re-enabling it will result in the old Gradebook data being restored.

Checked in as revision 3586.

column1: [SAK-2351] File picker should be more configurable
column6: In some cases, users will want to choose where newly uploaded attachments should be added. In others, they should automatically go to the attachments area or to a site resources collection. More details to come.
column10: File picker should be more configurable
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
The changes are checked in that allow a tool launching the file-picker to
specify whether it should attach links to the resources themselves or to make a
copy of the resource in the hidden attachments area and link to the copy. For
now, all legacy tools will attach links to copies, and the OSPi tools will make
links to the resources themselves.

Typically in a legacy tool, state attributes are set as follows when launching
the file-picker. This set of attributes will result in attachments being saved
as copies in the hidden attachments area:

state.setAttribute(ResourcesAction.STATE_MODE, ResourcesAction.MODE_HELPER);
state.setAttribute(ResourcesAction.STATE_RESOURCES_MODE,
ResourcesAction.MODE_ATTACHMENT_SELECT);
boolean show_other_sites =
ServerConfigurationService.getBoolean("resources.show_all_collections.helper",
ResourcesAction.SHOW_ALL_SITES_IN_FILE_PICKER);
/** This attribute indicates whether "Other Sites" twiggle should show */
state.setAttribute(ResourcesAction.STATE_SHOW_ALL_SITES,
Boolean.toString(show_other_sites));
/** This attribute indicates whether "Other Sites" twiggle should be open */
state.setAttribute(ResourcesAction.STATE_SHOW_OTHER_SITES,
Boolean.FALSE.toString());

In the OSPi tools, you can get links to the existing resources rather than to
copies by setting the following attribute:

state.setAttribute(ResourcesAction.STATE_ATTACH_LINKS, Boolean.TRUE.toString());

Note that the value of that attribute doesn't matter. If that attribute is set
with any non-null value, that mode will be selected.

As we discussed, all of this will change soon after the 2.1 release. At that
point, we will be able to link to existing resources no matter where they are
and override the permissions to make them available to any set of users. We
will revise the UI of the file picker at that point to surface more
configurability to the tool developer AND in some cases to the user.
column45: The file-picker will have a different UI in legacy tools and OSPi tools. It should be possible to upload a file, create a URL or attach a copy of an existing resource (if the user has read access to any existing resources) in the legacy tools.

column1: [SAK-2349] Move to site-scoped fine-grained permissions
column6:
After prioritizing the remaining Gradebook features targeted for 2.1, Oliver has decided that it's time for us to move to the next transitional step in our authorization approach: use fine-grained permissions at the site level, but still rely on Section Awareness for section level authorization.

This will align the Gradebook more with Samigo's projected 2.1 approach and has a good chance of helping with backwards compatibility post-2.1.

There will probably still need to be changes post-2.1 once the framework fully supports role-determined group-scoped permissions.
column10: Move to site-scoped fine-grained permissions
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: I've got the site-scoped fine-grained permissions working in my local build, and should be able to check the changes in as soon as they're added to the realm templates.
column45:
We are now using fine-grained site-scoped permissions instead of the coarse-grained role-like permissions used in 2.0 and 2.01. (These can be used, for example, to create a "Head Grader" role who can grade all sections but not edit assignments.)

Group-scoped grading authorization is still being handled by checking the SectionAwareness TA role. As group-scoped permissions become fully supported, this will have to change.

Checked in as revision 3178.

column1: [SAK-2343] Config option for email-archive to change the smtp return path for outgoing mail
column6:
The E-mail Archive tool does not change the smtp envelope from address (return path) for outgoing mail. Consequently, a user who sends an email to a site email address will receive any bounces that happen to be generated because one or more user email addresses are invalid, or the message is bounced for other reasons (spam/virus filters, etc.).

This is undesirable because the user sending the email message is emailing a group address, and may have no control over the individual destination addresses.

Patch attached to SAK-908 Closed for the E-mail Archive tool provides a global config option (set in sakai.properties) so that bounces go to the defined bounce address rather than the original sender address.

column1: [SAK-2337] Moving from Assignment Details to Overview breaks on Windows IE
column6:
On Internet Explorer, clicking some links on the "Assignment Details" page causes JSF to throw an exception, resulting in a blank frame in Sakai. No similar problems occur on Firefox. No similar problems occur on "Course Grade", despite the code shared between the pages.

The following links trigger the problem:

  • Overview
  • Roster
  • Grade Options

The following links don't:

  • Edit Assignment
  • Remove Assignment

Unfortunately, even at the most detailed logging level, JSF doesn't help indicate what particular portion of the page is causing the problem – just that it's happening somewhere. FWIW, here's the best information we have to work with:

15:21:04,593 INFO RoleFilter:123 - gradebookUid=QA_6, userUid=authid_teacher
15:21:04,593 DEBUG FacesPhaseListener:41 - BEFORE RESTORE_VIEW(1)
15:21:04,718 ERROR ClassUtils:320 - Cannot coerce java.lang.String to java.lang.Long
javax.servlet.jsp.el.ELException: An exception occured trying to convert String "null" to type "java.lang.Long"
at org.apache.commons.el.Logger.logError(Logger.java:481)
...
15:21:04,734 ERROR ValueBindingImpl:457 - Cannot get value for expression '#

{assignmentDetailsBean}

'
javax.faces.FacesException: Cannot coerce java.lang.String to java.lang.Long
...
15:21:04,750 ERROR [/sakai-gradebook-tool]:665 - Root cause: An exception occured trying to convert String "null" to type "java.lang.Long"
...
javax.servlet.jsp.el.ELException: An exception occured trying to convert String "null" to type "java.lang.Long"

column1: [SAK-2333] Publishing/unpublishing sites doesn't update immediately
column6:
Observed on 3 stable (rc4) instances, and also on the 3 trunk instances with one difference.

When I publish or unpublish a site in any instance, the site's appearance does not change to reflect this until I log out and back in. The tab for the newly created/published site also does not appear until I log out and back in.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Log in as user (not admin).
2. Create project site A, but leave "publish site" box unchecked.
3. Site is created with "Unpublished site" warning in sidebar.
4. Go to Site Info > Site Access.
5. Check the "publish site" box and click Update.
6. The site is now published, but it doesn't look like it - the "unpublished site" warning text is still at the top of the sidebar.
7. Log out and back in again - now the site appears correctly.

1. As user (not admin), create project site B and publish it.
2. Go to Site Info > Site Access.
3. Uncheck the "Publish site" box and click update.
4. Site B is now unpublished, but doesn't look like it.
5. Log out and back in again - now the "unpublished site" warning appears in the sidebar.

column1: [SAK-2329] Table names are case-sensitive: CollectionUtil.java
column6:
This issue will not replicate on Windows as MySQL table names are only as case sensitive as the underlying OS. If tables are created in caps, information needs to be retrieved in the same way.

WARN: Sql.dbRead: sql: select ss.site_id, ss.title, sstool.registration from sakai_site_tool sstool, sakai_site_user ssuser, sakai_site ss where (sstool.registration = 'sakai.resources' or sstool.registration = 'sakai.dropbox') and sstool.site_id = ssuser.site_id and sstool.site_id = ss.site_id and ssuser.user_id = ? order by ss.title admin (2005-10-24 11:15:23,071 TP-Processor11_org.sakaiproject.component.framework.sql.BasicSqlService)
java.sql.SQLException: Base table or view not found message from server: "Table 'sakai.sakai_site_tool' doesn't exist"
column10: Table names are case-sensitive: CollectionUtil.java
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: SAK-2338 Closed contains the contributed patch which addresses this issue.
column45: Also affects 2.1.0.002.
column49: What impact does this have, i.e. what should we expect not to work in 2.1.0.002?
column75: Dave, will this issue be fixed for 2.1.0? Thanks.
column80: I don't expect this to be fixed for 2.1.
column84: This is a very simple fix for which there's already a contributed patch in the linked issue (simply changing the table names to upper case). Why leave something obviously broken in 2.1 that produces exceptions in the log and presumably has some impact on functionality (or is it harmless?)
column88: Applying the patch is easy enough. The issue is the testing required to ensure that the patch works for all databases, that it works with pre-existing databases, that the instructions are on how to set the mysql case variables are reviewed and correct for all the permutations.
column92:
I don't think it's that complicated. mysql table names are case sensitive on certain platforms. All Sakai core tables are created uppercase, and referenced in upper case in the code everywhere except here. The SAKAI_SITE_TOOL table is specifically referenced in upper case in:

legacy/component/src/sql/mysql/sakai_site.sql
legacy/component/src/sql/hsqldb/sakai_site.sql
legacy/component/src/sql/oracle/sakai_site.sql
legacy/component/src/java/org/sakaiproject/component/legacy/site/DbSiteService.java

It is only referenced in lower case (sakai_site_tool) in this one instance, which leads to the sql statement in question failing and producing exceptions.

If it's correct elsewhere in upper case (for all databases), it's correct to reference it here in uppercase. Fixing this would move the code from an obviously broken state to a presumed correct state, subject to QA, which is surely an improvement.
column96:
Stephen put this as well as possible, but to reiterate, if the table is created in caps (see below), we should refer to the table in caps in our select code. This one query in CollectionUtil is the only place (besides conversion scripts) where that table is referred to in lower-case.

[samo@server3 sakai]$ grep -r SAKAI_SITE_TOOL *|grep -v ".svn"|grep -i "CREATE TABLE SAKAI_SITE_TOOL"

column1: [SAK-2328] Replacing Resource does not update URL, so name and mime-type may become incorrect
column6:
The file name of a certain file is not updated properly when a new file is uploaded replacing another file of a different mime type. This may only be problem when the file that replaced the original file has a different mime type and file extention. The actual file is replaced but the file name and extention are not.

Reproduce thus:

In Sakai 2.0.1,

1. Upload e.g. a PDF file to resources an assign an arbitrary "Title" to it. Make no other choices in the dialogue. Save.
2. Replace the previously uploaded PDF file with a Word file. Retain the "Title" and make no other choices in the dialogue. Update.

The URL for the word file is now the same as it was for the PDF file that was replaced. The mime type is set correctly however this is not reflected in the URL.
column7: Client: OS X 10.3.9, Safari 1.3.1 + Win2K, IE6 (this appears to be a server-side problem)
column10: Replacing Resource does not update URL, so name and mime-type may become incorrect
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: SAK-2328 Closed is another example of confusion resulting from the different references by which a Resource is known. In this case, the main point of confusion is that URL is not changing when a file is replaced with one of a different type, e.g., replace a PDF (.pdf) file with a Microsfot Word (.doc) file, even though the mime-type is correctly updated.

This should not have been elevated from minor to critical 10 days before the release as if this was a new problem or regression. If it was critical, the issue would have been raised and dealt with earlier in the development cycle for release 2.1.

column104: MAINTANCE TEAM: Unassigned so these get reviewed by the Maintance Team
column108:
The id of a resource has to be immutable and currently the id is based on the site, folder(s), and file name when the resource is first created. Further changes to the file will not change the identifier. In other words, replacing laptop.jpg with macbook.png will still result in a path that ends with laptop.jpg (because that is the identifier). The mimetype is correctly handled and the title is correctly displayed. Only the URL (which uses the id in it) would continue to reflect the original file name.
if we want to change this is should be done via a feature request as this is not really a bug.

column1: [SAK-2393] Confusion Over Which "Home" is Which
column6:
I'm troubled by the repitition of 'Home' especially when you first land in the Wiki: you get Home on the toolbar, Home on breadcrumbs, Home as page title.

Logically Home on the Toolbar is a navigation link, whereas View, Edit, Info, History, Search are action / change view links.

So how about making Home always appear as the first entry in the breadcrumb list (it just stays there) - breadcrumbs is for navigation links, so from a usability / logical navigation point of view, that makes sense.
column10: Confusion Over Which "Home" is Which
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
We tried doing
Home>Page1>Page2

then when the list got longer it truncated to
Home>...Page20>Page2>Page30

But this confused users here so we went for

Home on the toolbar

and
...Page20>Page2>Page30

I dont know which one is right, perhapse it should be a configuration option?
column45:
I understand the concern, and we have tried it both ways. I would like to leave it as it is now until we have a broader user base.

The argument in favour of the current layout is:

  • there is a clear place to go to when you want to 'reset' or 'go back to the beginning' if lost. The tool 'reset' button in an alternative here, but we are not sure how consistent tool reset behaviour will be across tools and if users will recognise it and understand it's purpose.
  • the old 'breadcrumb' is now implementing 'recently visited pages with duplicates removed' to add the Home link here would make it 'recently visited pages with duplicates removed PLUS a home link', which is starting to be a complicated concept (although learnable by careful observation of behaviour)
  • the page title will always need repeating for consistency with other pages
column49:
Another suggestion from some wiki reviewers here: to avoid the "triple-home effect" when you first arrive at the wiki (Home on the toolbar, Home first entry in the breadcrumbs, Home page title), omit the breadcrumbs until the user has visited at least 2 pages.

That makes sense from the point of view of the user being able to understand what each element is about - the function of the breadcrumbs only becomes obvious when they show a navigation history, i.e. at least 2 pages.
column75:
The Home button in the left navigation bar leads the user to the "Home" for the worksite (displaying description of the project, recent announcements, discussion, and chat items).

The Home link in the Wiki leads to the "home" page for the Wiki.

These are two different things, and showing buttons/links with the same name that go to different places is not good.

The Wiki "home" page also states: "This page is your Home page for this worksite" which it is not.

I think the "home" within the Wiki tool should be named something different. Not sure what, but something that differentiates it from the worksite Home.

Perhaps: "Wiki Main" "Wiki Start" "Wiki Homepage" or something better that someone else thinks of.
column80:
Home in left nav leads to worksite home.

Home in Wiki frame leads to Wiki home.
column84: I would like to see this name as a customisable option. In our context we would like to call it 'Index', but that might not be appropriate for everyone.
column88: We will make this a customisable option (in sakai.properties) with the default being Home.
column92:
You can now name the home page by setting wiki.ui.homepage in sakai.properties eg

wiki.ui.homepage=Wiki Home

This ONLY changes the name of the page on the Menu bar. The wiki name of the home page itself and hence all the links remain.

IF you need this to be configurable,please open a new Jira item.

column1: [SAK-2385] CSS should support print view
column6:
CSS can define alternate media types, so that print views do not include page navigation components (e.g. toolbar, breadcrumbs, etc.) and can format differently if required.

See Mediawiki for an example of this in action.

Ideally one should be able to right-click / Print in IE or in Firefox, right-click, open in new tab/window and then print that, and get an appropriate print layout.

May also involve changes to Sakai tool CSS (for toolbar)?
column10: CSS should support print view
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: I have made it a global task instead of a rWiki feature request, as it affects everything.
column45:
We are going to need to think about this more in terms of tool functionality than as a tool rendering (albeit for print) issue.

Several requirements:

1 - printing should print the contents of a specific tool
2 - it should be a one click operation
3 - it should send to the printer a printer-friendly rendition

Some possibilities

1 - Simple

A <a href="#" onclick="window.print()">Print</a> that gets rendered in toolbar. This puts the focus on the iframed tool and sends it to the printer. This will work in most tools whose content consists of only one iframe. Others will need more work (Chat, Discussion, etc.).

The print styling will be applied at the printer and the user will not see that print version till she picks it up in the tray. This works in all browsers. Some IE5.5 issues that need to be addressed (problems with the @media type applying to other media than the one specified - for example: hiding from screen things meant to be hidden from print)

In this case the print and screen css will live in the same file - the css links are

<link href="/library/skin/tool_base.css" type="text/css" rel="stylesheet" media="all" />
<link href="/library/skin/ctools-mod/tool.css" type="text/css" rel="stylesheet" media="all" />

2 - Two step

An <a href="#" onclick="customPrintFunction()">Print version</a> that pops the contents of the iframed tool in a new window with the css link targetting the print version - the new window has a "Print" link as above.

<link href="/library/skin/print.css" type="text/css" rel="stylesheet" media="all" />

Cons:

  • 2 clicks
  • one more stylesheet to keep track of.
    Pros:
  • user gets a preview of what things will look like
  • since some tools will need an intermidiary rearrangement that will involve 2 steps anyways this will provide consistency.
column49:
OK - regardless of the flow chosen above - what characteristics would such a printable version have? Asterics indicate "probably yes", Question marks "not sure"

1 - omit from printed output

  • navigation and action elements (inputs and links) in views devoted to content
  • background colors (substitute with font formatting, borders)

2 - change in printed output

  • color as information > font-weight, border as information
  • font size for screen > font size for print
    ? sans-serif for screen > serif for print
  • line height of large blocks of text (screen) > line height for print
  • reduce topmost padding and margin to 0
  • increase topmost margin to 0
  • underline links

3 - add in printed output
? provide link url in print version
? user id
column75: revisions for SAK-3392 Closed incorporate a css version of major elements targetting the print media. I would like to close this issue and create a new one that specifically asks for a tool or a functionality that addresses how to get the contents of a tool to the printer.

I finally managed to replicate this problem with our backport of rwiki to 2.0.x today. In my case the problem was due to the fact that I had not setup Sakai properly; I had 'hibernate.dialect' in sakai.properties not placeholder.properties. This meant that hibernate was running with the HSQL dialect and hence was converting the text columns to longvarchar. Creating placeholder.properties and adding the appropriate things fixed this problem for me.

I suspect that Stephen Marquard was suffering from a similar setup problem.

column1: [SAK-2322] Discrepancy between points in grade entry page and roster
column6:
There is an odd discrepancy between the actual points entered for an assignment and how they are displayed in the roster. I entered the following for a 20 point assignment:

17.99
16
15.75
21.2
19

These numbers were retained in the assignment garde entry view. In the roster they displayed as

17.98
16
15.75
21.19
19

Nightly2 went down while I was in the midst of taking screen shots, so I managed to capture only the grade entry page. I've only seen and tested this once. The test course used was SMPL 001 001 SpSu 05
column10: Discrepancy between points in grade entry page and roster
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Ok, some slightly more solid evidence. From the limited sample,there doesn't seem to be a pattern to this.
column45:
Not surprising at all, I'm afraid. Java's never been very bright about this stuff, and JSF just builds on that.

1) At first the Gradebook just displayed the scores "as entered", since the application restricts entered scores to two decimal places.

2) However, we have no control over the scores coming in from Samigo. The specification says that score displays have to be rounded down to two digits no matter how close they are to the integer line. To fix the display problems we were having, I now convert the stored scores to a high-precision form and truncate.

3) Scores were specified to be regular floating point numbers (as opposed to exactly-two-decimal-places pseudo-currency or to integers divided by 100). Computer storage of normal floating point numbers isn't exact.

Result: You say "17.99" but the floating point number stored in the database is actually (viewed at a high enough precision) equivalent to, say, "17.989999999999998436805981327779591083526611328125" – which we now truncate to "17.98". Similarly, multiplying "17.99" by 100 and dividing by 100 will give us something which truncates as "17.98". Searching the converted output string for a decimal and then truncating the string makes too many assumptions about internationalization.

Two options that come to mind:

  • Decide on some arbitrary decimal position at which rounding will occur (5 or 6?), and then truncating the result.
  • Try to produce a DecimalFormat class that provides rounding down capability.

The formatting classes are pretty hairy, and so the second option would take a lot longer, worthwhile though the effort might be.
column49: The Gradebook now rounds numbers at 5 decimal places before truncating them at 2 decimal places. Let me know if you'd prefer 6 or 7 decimal places as the maximum resolution instead....

column1: [SAK-2321] improve the security function registration for Sakai applications
column6: Sakai 2.0 required new applications to edit a single file in legacy to register their security functions. Improve this so function registration is distributed out to the applications, so that whatever applications are selected for deployment bring their security function registration with them without having a single file that needs to know about all applications.
column10: improve the security function registration for Sakai applications
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
If you have an application that will be working with Sakai 2.1, and has security functions, there's a new and improved way to register these with Sakai. Please read carefully, as the old way is no longer supported.

The old way was to edit the single file:

legacy/component/src/config/registration.xml

and add your application's security functions.

Actually, the older way (Sakai 1.5, I believe) was better; you could register your security functions with your tool registration. That was removed in 2.0.

The new way is to have your application register your security functions. This is best done in a manager or service, i.e. a singleton that starts up at server startup and contains your applications storage and business logic. This is loaded by our component manager, and can be designated as having an init() method to call on startup.

The best place to define your security functions is in your manager API. The really really best place to enforce security in in your manager API's implementation component. It's in there, in the init() method, that you can register your functions.

The Sakai kernel now has a FunctionManager. You can inject this or call it's cover. The examples below use the cover:

import org.sakaiproject.api.kernel.function.cover.FunctionManager;

In your manager's init() method:

/**

  • Final initialization, once all dependencies are set.
    */
    public void init()
    {

simply call the registerFunction() method, like this (from content hosting):

// register functions
FunctionManager.registerFunction(EVENT_RESOURCE_ADD);
FunctionManager.registerFunction(EVENT_RESOURCE_READ);
FunctionManager.registerFunction(EVENT_RESOURCE_WRITE);
FunctionManager.registerFunction(EVENT_RESOURCE_REMOVE);
FunctionManager.registerFunction("dropbox.own");

...

See how there are nice constance defined in the ContentHosting API (all except for that dropbox.own) that makes it just the right place to make the registration.

Registration is transient - there's not database behind it. The set of applications that you start up with your Sakai determines what functions are registered, each time you start.

There is another, less preferable way, to register an application's functions. This would be good when integrating some external application, or when you have built an application that does not follow the Sakai method of separating persistence and business logic into a separate singleton manager or service. If there is no convinient singleton from which to call registerFunction(), you can (once again) register the function in the tool registration .xml file. This is a return of the feature we had in Sakai 1.5.

Alongside of the <tool> elements in a tool.xml file, simply add some <function> ones:

...
</tool>

<function name="news.test" />
<function name="news.other" />
...

(this is from a bogus example, since the Sakai code will not be using this feature).

Either way works.

The dependency for Maven, to include in your project.xml, for code using the function manager, is:

<dependency>
<groupId>sakaiproject</groupId>
<artifactId>sakai-function</artifactId>
<version>$

{sakai.version}

</version>
</dependency>

Functions so registered are really only used (for now) in the admin "realm" (now called the authorization group) editor, and in the permissions helper tool that runs the permissions mode of many Sakai tools. This list is the list that forms the lists of functions we present to the end user.

In the future, this area will be further extended, to get more interesting information associated with each function, so end users can have a better idea about what they are picking when they assign a function permissio

column1: [SAK-2315] Preferences/Customize Tabs, change 'My Sites' to 'My Inactive Sites'...
column6:

They will have both Fall and Spring courses and using 'Customize Tabs' is a little vague in terms of the 'My Sites' column where sites that are being 'removed' from the active tabs list are placed.

We don't want the users thinking they have to re-join the course to get the tab to reappear.

column1: [SAK-2310] File picker should make sure attachments have right permissions
column6:
In the filepicker, we show other sites with the idea that the user may want to choose a file in another site to attach an item to something in the current site. The problem is that in the new file-picker, the user can do that by clicking the "select" action link for an item in the other site. The user can complete the attachment, but it may not be visible to any other users in that site.

I can think of a couple possible approaches to solving this problem:

  • If user picks an item in another site, next step is to ask the user
    to select a place in the current site to paste the attachment. Maybe
    the action-links in other sites should be "Copy" instead of "Select".
  • Automatically make a copy of the selected item in a hidden place and
    attach that item. The disadvantage is that the user may be confused
    about which item is actually attached, the original or the copy.
  • Instead of showing other sites in the file picker, let users add
    an item in the current site, and then in the "add-item" dialog, let them
    choose an existing item from any site they have access to.
column10: File picker should make sure attachments have right permissions
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

column1: [SAK-2300] Grade display rounding when it should not
column6:
Raw score and percentage displays for individual assignments are being rounded in both the instructor and student views. These values should be chopped at two decimal places. The affected views and fields are:

Student Roster (Instructor)
-Assignment name column scores

Grade report (Student)
-Score column percentages
column10: Grade display rounding when it should not
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
To clarify after a conversation with Oliver:

1) The Student View code is mistakenly calculating the "friendly" letter grade equivalent for a assignment score based on the displayed percentage rather than the real percentage.

2) No matter what's shown in the wireframes, all percentage values should be displayed as floors ("rounded down" to an integer).

3) All point values should be displayed with a maximum of two decimal places.
column45:
An additional major change being contemplated as part of this fix: Switch the score display in the student view grading table from a percentage value to an unrounded raw score. This would allow all percentage displays in the app to be treated uniformly, straightforwardly, as integers without a loss of data for the student display.

I'd like to get comments from Indiana on this proposal and have sent a message directly to IU stakeholders.
column49:
In my testing, part 1) is not true – that is, even though the percentage value being shown in the Student View is mistakenly rounded up, the displayed letter grade is based on the real percentage.

If I create an assignment with 100 points, and give a student a score of 89.99, the Student View wrongly shows "90%" (instead of "89%") but correctly shows "B+" (instead of "A-").
column75:
The core of this issue seems to me to be that the grading style of this instructor is strongly points based. The original case mentioned "I have assigned grades ranging from .5 to 4.5" - he doesn't want percents and grades, he wants the raw points shown. Trying to satisfy the endless variation in grading style with a simple gradebook is nearly impossible, moving to a variety of grading styles will eventually help, but for now we've got to do our best with one.

So according to the 2.0 specs, and assuming the default grading scale is in place, the student grading report for a student who got a 2.5 points out of 4.5 possible would show something like:

Score Pnts. Grade
55% 4.5 F

Probably not the desired result, in this case, but it is following the specs.

So my question is:

  • What is actually displayed in this case?
  • Are the results different than what the specs show?

A natural follow up question is what did the instructor want to see, but we can't necessarily use that as our answer, since there's a very strong chance this instructor doesn't want the same thing as most other instructors.

I would endorse replacing the % score shown in the specs with a raw score - it will be more general and work for all kinds of examples.
column80:
Having looked through the specification and all screens....

1) The reported percentage (assignment or course) for an invididual student is being rounded, whereas the specification says it should be a truncated integer instead. I'll fix that. (As previously noted, this is purely a matter of numeric display. The correct letter grades were always being displayed.)

2) Although internally entered scores are limited to 2 decimal places, pretty much any number might be inserted into an externally managed assignment. For displaying individual student raw scores, I'll truncate (not round) them to 2 decimal places.

3) For showing mean performance across the entire class, I think it may make more sense to round rather than to truncate. Oliver, Ben, do you agree?

4) Similarly, for showing the points possible in an externally managed assignment, I think it may make more sense to round to 2 decimal places rather than to truncate. Oliver, Ben?

5) I enthusiastically support the idea of entering a feature request to change the Student View percentage score column to a raw score column instead. Getting the percentage from the raw score and the possible points will be educational for them.

6) To improve developer sanity, I request that the specification wireframes be updated to reflect all this.
column84:
1) The reported percentage (assignment or course) for an invididual student is being rounded, whereas the specification says it should be a truncated integer instead. I'll fix that. (As previously noted, this is purely a matter of numeric display. The correct letter grades were always being displayed.)

Actually, the spec was just not very clear about this. Mea culpa. For gross class-wide averages, the percentages were supposed to be truncated integers. The student specific percentages with related grade displays were supposed to be truncated at two decimal places.

That said, your approach of first addressing the student view display bug by rounding the percentages down makes sense. I'll enter a 2.1 feature request to introduce a greater measure of precision by either using the raw scores or adding decimals to the percentages as originally intended.

3) For showing mean performance across the entire class, I think it may make more sense to round rather than to truncate. Oliver, Ben, do you agree?

This seems like a good idea. My one hesitation is that it might also be nice to make things simple by applying the same display rules to all of the percentages.

4) Similarly, for showing the points possible in an externally managed assignment, I think it may make more sense to round to 2 decimal places rather than to truncate. Oliver, Ben?

Sounds good.

5) I enthusiastically support the idea of entering a feature request to change the Student View percentage score column to a raw score column instead. Getting the percentage from the raw score and the possible points will be educational for them.

Waiting for IU feedback on this (or from any other institution currently with wide GB usage).

6) To improve developer sanity, I request that the specification wireframes be updated to reflect all this.

Yes, Ben or I will take this on.

column1: [SAK-2297] File upload needs to support deployment on a cluster
column6:
The current implementation of SAMigo's file upload question type does not support deployment of the application in a clustered environment. Currently, the files are stored on the app server under /tmp. It should leverage the same storage mechanism that ContentHosting is using (i.e. if configured for BLOB storage stick the binaries in the database; if configured for file storage, store the files on a network mountable file system).

While I am not suggesting that the file upload files need to be tightly integrated with ContentHosting, it should behave in a similar way. For the time being, I suggest we comment out the file upload question type until we have a better cluster-aware solution. Thanks, L

column1: [SAK-2295] Moving folder and inner-folder in same action leads to strange error message
column6:
Suppose resource collection in site "X" contains folders named "f-1", "f-2" and "f-3". Suppose "f-1" contains subfolders named "f-1.1" (id == "/group/X/f-1/f-1.1/") and "f-1.2" (id == "/group/X/f-1/f-1.2/").

Suppose user selects "f-1" and "f-1.1" and attempts to copy the two items to "f-2". The copy command does a deep-copy, recursively copying each selected item and its contents into the destination. The result is that "f-2" contains two subfolders, "f-1" (id == "/group/X/f-2/f-1/") and "f-1.1" (id == "/group/X/f-2/f-1.1/") and the copy of "f-1" contains a copy of "/group/X/f-1/f-1.1/" whose id is "/group/X/f-2/f-1/f-1.1/".

Now suppose user selects "f-1" and "f-1.1" and attempts to copy the two items to "f-3". The move command does a deep-copy and delete, recursively copying each selected item and its contents into the destination and deleting each one as it completes the copy. The result is an error message saying the resource/collection does not exist. Also the selected items will be moved, but not all of the copies will be created as expected. The folder "f-3" will contain a subfolder named "f-1" (id == "/group/X/f-3/f-1/"), but "f-1.1" will be moved to just one of the two possible places, either in "f-3" (id == "/group/X/f-3/f-1.1/") or inside the new copy of "f-1" (id == "/group/X/f-3/f-1/f-1.1/".

The problem here is that the original version of "f-1.1" is gone by the time the second copy operation is done. Move is implemented by copying and then deleting each item, but they are closely coupled. The deletion is done just after copying is done. We could decouple the two operations (recursively copy everything and then recursively delete them). Or we could detect the intention to move an item twice with the same command and disallow it.
column10: Moving folder and inner-folder in same action leads to strange error message

column1: [SAK-2292] Users may see WebDAV resources for another person
column6:
I have seen two separate examples of users having access to another user's resources via WebDAV and Sakai.

First, on collab:

Second, on our own installation:

We have enabled RemoteUser, and I don't know how the DavServlet is handling/caching information (IP, username, etc.?). Basically, the scenario is this:

user1 logs into Sakai
user1 connects to WebDAV, authenticates, and sees their information.
user1 closes network places (Windows), but stays logged into Sakai
user2 logs into Sakai
user2 tries WebDAV, and enters user1 username and fake password
user2 can see user1 information.

I wouldn't think remoteuser enabling should cause this, however I am not certain? I will attempt further to repeat this without container auth set

I just wanted to log this before I forget.

Thanks,
Scott

column1: [SAK-2285] Scope of "Allow Resubmission" is misleading or broken
column6:
When grading or viewing a submission to the Assignments tool, after clicking on a student name there is a box for "Allow Resubmission" directly beneath the area where you would enter comments and/or grades for the individual student.. Its presence on a page specific to an individual student leads one to believe the option only applies to that particular student, but turning this option on allows all students to resubmit assignments.

If the option is meant to apply to the assignment in general and to affect all students, it should be part of the page where the assignment options are set up (both the "new assignment" and "revise assignment" pages). It should be removed from the "grading" page since the other items on that page only apply to the individual student (and the priority of this bug should be lowered to "minor")

If the option really is meant to apply only to the individual student, then turning it on should not affect all students.

column1: [SAK-2279] Architectural issue in Total Scores/Standalone support, needs to be covered.
column6:
The recent fix using "AuthzGroupService for the roles of the users instead of just getting the AuthGroup... for each user." r 2583, needs to be covered, as it introduces (a very efficient) dependency on running in a Sakai context.

The AuthzQueriesFacadeAPI has two context based implementations, injected by BeanDefinitions.xml and made available through the PersistenceService.
These are:
org.sakaiproject.tool.assessment.facade.authz.integrated.AuthzQueriesFacade
org.sakaiproject.tool.assessment.facade.authz.standalone.AuthzQueriesFacade

I suggest you add a wrapper method for the call to AuthzGroupService in AuthzQueriesFacadeAPI, and then implement it in each version.

It is OK to have the standalone version throw an IllegalArgumentException, as long as this is indicated in its Javadoc. You can ask the agent if it is integrated or not, and if it is then call the optimization. If you need to modify the context driven behavior of the agent, a short explanation follows.

Currently the AgentFacade delegates its static and nonstatic members' integration-context related behavior to a helper interface which is injected by the IntegrationContextFactory. This was a recent change to eliminate the standalone/integrated build code overlays.

The implementation class is AgentHelperImpl and it is in different packages,
org.sakaiproject.tool.assessment.integration.helper.integrated
org.sakaiproject.tool.assessment.integration.helper.standalone

The AgentFacade "knows" what environment it is running in, even though the delegate implementation class is "hidden" form the developer:
public boolean isStandaloneEnvironment()
public boolean isIntegratedEnvironment()

column1: [SAK-2276] Fractional scores should round in delivery
column6:
Observed on all 3 nightly qa instances.

While you're taking an assessment with immediate feedback turned on, you can see the scores for each question on the TOC page.

The total scores for a part get rounded up, but the individual question scores do not. (see attached screenshot). They should round up to the nearest tenth as well.
column10: Fractional scores should round in delivery
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Marc, I know we decided not to round each individual items, only the total score. What should we display here?
column45:
I thought we agreed that scores for questions, parts and assessments should round to tenths in all displays. The total for the question never being more than the entered total score.

If it's a MC/MC, matching or FIB, then it's the selections right minus the selections wrong, rounded.

Example: MC/MC, 10 total points, 3 possible selections (each worth 3.33333...). Student gets two right - 2 x 3.33333... = 6.66666..., rounds to 6.7 for student score. Student get two right and one wrong - 2 x 3.33333... - 3.33333... = 3.33333... rounds to 3.3 for student score. Student gets all correct - 3 x 3.33333... = 9.99999... rounds to 10.0 for student score.
column49: Okay thanks, so the scores are being rounded only for display.
column75:
Another one in delivery. Maybe you can try <f:convertNumber maxFractionDigits="1"/>
Note we only want to store truncated total scores not individual question's scores in DB.
