column1: [SAK-2136] Behavior of remove/move/copy buttons
column6: Buttons/links labeled "Remove Selected", "Move Selected" and "Copy Selected" should appear near top of list view of resources tool if the current list includes items that the user has rights to remove, move and/or copy. Each button should appear only if the current view contains at least one item which respect to which the current user can take the corresponding action. The buttons should be disabled initially. If the user selects one or more items which can be deleted by this user, the "Remove Selected" button will be enabled. If the user selects one or more items which can be moved by this user, the "Move Selected" button will be enabled. If the user selects one or more items which can be copied by this user, the "Copy Selected" button will be enabled. If some items are selected and then deselected, the buttons will be disabled whenever no elements are selected with respect to which the user can take the corresponding action. ...

column1: [SAK-2134] Add getUnassignedMembersInRole to SectionAwareness
column6:
Although we've mostly focused on "get all unassigned members in role" as a query for Section Management, it's also of interest to the section aware applications for their drop-down filters. (In particular, I can see it being very useful for Announcements.)

How would you feel about adding this to the SectionAwareness API?

List getUnassignedMembersInRole(siteContext, role)

As a performance FYI, this would be called along with getSections(siteContext) to decide whether to include "Unassigned Students" on the filter dropdown or not.

Thanks,

column1: [SAK-2132] Extend Site and Security APIs for Site Groups
column6:
Extend the Site API to introduce the concept of site groups. A site can have multiple groups, each with it's own descriptive information and authorization group.

Extend the Security API to accept list of authorization groups, in place of the the single entity reference, to use when making security questions. If the list is provided, it is used instead of asking the Reference object to get the authorization groups for the entity. This list can include site groups for applications which track groups for authorization per entity (i.e. are "group aware"). The list API will also let us make more efficient security calls from applications.

As a christmas bonus, remove the "Edit" and "Locking" aspects from the Site and Realm APIs, and rename Realm to AuthzGroup. Extend the Site API to be a complete cover for it's under-the-cover use of the AuthzGroup API, so that with
only the Site API, membership and permissions can be set.

column1: [SAK-2128] Add siteContext argument to getSectionCategories
column6:
Josh, I see that you've made a no-argument version of the "getSectionCategories" method. I presume you made that decision to reflect the limited functionality of the first release, where a single section category list is supported deployment wide.
But if there's any possibility of site-specific categories being supported in the foreseeable future, it might be safer to have the interface take a site context argument and just document the restricted functionality of the first implementation. That way all the section-aware clients won't have to change their code if the restriction is ever lifted.

What do you think?
Posted by Ray Davis

column1: [SAK-2122] Refactor and Extend the Sakai Entity Model
column6:
Rename the model to "Entity" from "Resource", to avoid confusion of the term "Resource" which is more likely used to talk about the resources tool and content hosting.

Change the few parts of this API that are classes to be interfaces, introducing a manager and components so that the objects can be produced as needed.

Distribute the hard coded / application aware code from this component out to all the applications which are part of the Entity Model.

Extend the Entity Model to handle the needs of security and reference as well as those of archive / merge / import as they do now.

Extend the Entity Mode to handle the needs of entity creation at Site lifecycle changes (creation, modification, deletion), distributing the hard coded code in the SiteService component out to the applications.

Update any code that is part of this model.

Document the new Entity Model and how to use it to build Sakai applications.

column1: [SAK-2113] Server Configuration Service prevents kernel modularity
column6:
The Sakai kernel and related software is almost capable of standing on it's own. The one piece of software that prevents a Sakai platform bundle is the legacy ServerConfigurationService and it's implementation in BasicConfigurationService.

In general, this service provides access to system configuration parameters, but it also provides convenience methods for commonly used URLs. It is this mix of functions that causes problems.

I propose a new service, perhaps ServerConfigurationManager that is focused purely on server configuration parameters. I propose that we move URL methods and Resource Service registration to another service, since neither are directly needed by the kernel, Mercury, or the LoginTool. This in turn would remove dependencies in the implementation on UsageSessionService, ResourceService, SiteService, and CurrentService – all legacy services outside of the kernel.

I think that this new service should be part of the kernel, since it serves a core purpose in configuring Sakai.

I have attached a proposed ServerConfigurationManager API and an implementation called KernelConfigurationService that works in conjunction with Mercury and LoginTool.

  • mjn
column7: This is a general Sakai organization issue and is not specific to a particular environment.

column1: [SAK-7863] Use a Single "Name" to identifiy Resources
column6:
A continuing source of confusion for users is the lack of correlation between the Title of a Resource and the ID by which the system knows the Resource. In general, users are expecting Resources to behave in a manner similar to their computer's file system. A single "name" should be used to identify Resources for all purposes in the UI and should be part for any internal logic, such as not allowing duplicates.

Resources violates the user's expectations in a number of ways currenlty, such as by only looking at a Resource's system ID and ignoring the Title when a user performs actions which result in duplicate names. For example, users can end up with two or more Resources with identical Titles. The system knows the Resources are different because each was assigned a unique ID when it was uploaded, however, the user cannot necessarily tell from the UI what's going on. Also, they may attempt to upload a new version of a file using the same Title assuming that it will replace the old version; it does not, instead you end up with two identically named Resources.
column10: Use a Single "Name" to identifiy Resources
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: SAK-2250 Closed provides another example of user-confusion resulting from multipe "names" for a Resource. In this case, the user replaces a Resource with a newly uploaded file having a different name (perhaps with a new date or revision number in the name) and the Resources Title doesn't change to reflect this, nor does its system ID for that matter.
column45: SAK-2328 Closed is another example of confusion resulting from the different references by which a Resource is known. In this case, the main point of confusion is that URL is not changing when a file is replaced with one of a different type, e.g., replace a PDF (.pdf) file with a Microsfot Word (.doc) file, even though the mime-type is correctly updated.

column1: [SAK-2104] Adding an item in Resources that already exists,did not ask for any name change or did not give any error asking file already exists.
column6:
Here are the steps to replicate,

In Resources, if you add an item as a 'File Upload' and add few files in your resources, then if you try to add a file that already exists in Resources it does not give any kind of error that file already exists.
And it added the file in the resources with the same name.

If I tried to add an item of type 'Form Item' I was able to add the same form with the same name again and again.

I came to know through Kristol that expected behavior is for the file to add consecutive numbers at the end of each file name for each copy made (e.g., File Name 1, File Name 2, File Name 3).

In the attached screen shot you can see that contactInfo.xsd and Contact Info form are twice in resources that I uploaded two times.
column10: Adding an item in Resources that already exists,did not ask for any name change or did not give any error asking file already exists.
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I'm not sure what to do with this ticket. First I'm not sure that the expected behavior is as described in this ticket. And if it is the expected behavior, there's no efficient way to achieve that behavior.

The problem is real. We can't have two items in the same collection with the same resource-id, but we can have multiple items in a collection with the same display-name. Having more than one item with the same display-name is likely to lead to confusion for users. But how do we make sure there are not duplicate display names?

The problem is most likely to occur when the user uploads more than one copy of the same file (possibly a revised version of a file uploaded earlier). We already have a way of making sure we don't have duplicate resource-id's in that case, and an efficient way of assigning variations on the resource-id to allow creation of the new item. If a resource-id is already taken, we insert a number into the "desired" resource-id and try again. If the resource-id with the number inserted is already in use, we increment the number and try again. We keep doing that until we find an unused id, or until some arbitrary limit on the number of attempts has been exceeded. If we find a valid id, we save the uploaded file. This process is relatively efficient because the Content Hosting Service enables a very efficient query to see if a resource-id is in use.

There is not such an efficient way of finding whether a particular display-name has been used in a folder. Since this is most likely to occur when someone uploads multiple copies of the same file, one approach might be to add the same number to the display-name that is added to the resource-id when a clash is encountered. That would work for simple cases, but it doesn't cover some cases, and in others it might actually get in the user's way. For example, a user might upload a file name "file.doc" and assign a display-name of "First version", and then upload a revision of the same file assigning "Second version" as the display-name. Assuming "file.doc" was not already in use as a resource-id in that folder, these two files would be assigned resource-id's of "file.doc" and "file-1.doc", but the display-names would be "First version" and "Second version (1)". And suppose someone next uploaded two versions of a file named "sample.doc" assigning display-names of "First version" and "Second version". Now we'd have two files with display-names of "First name" and two files with display-names of "Second version (1)".

This suggests that we should check every time we add an item to a folder to make sure that the user-assigned display-name is not already in use in that folder. This would involve getting a list of all resources in the folder. Then for each resource, we would check to see if it has the same display-name as the user-assigned display-name for the new item. If we find one that has the same display-name, we would change the name (add the next number in the sequence) and start over, checking the new candidate against the display-name of each other item in the folder. We would keep doing that until we find a variation that is not already in use.

This approach would be likely to have a noticeable impact on performance.

BTW, the desired behavior described in this ticket is close to what we have done in the case of duplicating a resource within a folder. But even in that case, it could be wrong. The number added to the display-name might not relate to the number of copies that are actually in that folder. If items get deleted or moved, the numbering might not be sequential. And we could end up with multiple numbers added to a display-name (for example, "Copy of Copy of file.txt (2) (3)").
column45: Mamta, As Jim points out, Sakai is currently behaving "as designed". Now, most folks would take issue with the design as-is. Your example is one of several related to problem of using system IDs to differentiate Resources, rather than their Titles. So, since the current behavior is as-speced, I'm changing this issue to a Feature Request. ( SAK-7863 Closed also brings together other un-anticipated Resource behavior related to the root problem here.)
column49: I found a way to provide unique IDs that is less inefficient than I thought it would be, though it does add a little overhead to adding new items in large collections. I have added code that does that for new file-uploads and form-items. We may revisit this if it raises other issues.

column1: [SAK-2101] Cannot distinguish read and unread messages, or new and old messages
column6:
I'm filing this as a "bug" rather than a "feature request" because the omission of the feature is so flawed that it makes the discussion tool eventually become completely useless.

There is no method in Sakai to distinguish between messages that have previously been read and new or unread messages. Threaded discussions often allow you to hide messages that have previously been read (e.g., WebCT), provide some visual indicator that the message has not been viewed yet, or have a filtered search for new messages. At a very minimum, and usually the case in unthreaded discussions, there is a link to the first new message in each category since the user's last visit.

Because the current implementation of the discussion tool fails to provide any method to differentiate between new and old messages, the user is forced to remember the date that they last read messages and scan the message list for posting dates that are more recent. Typical usage at Rutgers of a discussion board in a large lecture course can result in thousands of messages per term, so manually scanning posting dates would be too cumbersome and time consuming to be practical.

The synoptic "home" view of discussion does show the most recent posts (limited by quantity and date) so could help alleviate the problem, but since there is no link from the "home" page directly to the discussion message or topic, you end up needing to scan the message list anyway to find the new messages that you know are there.

Finally, because of the way the links are written you cannot even use stylesheets to differentiate "visited" links - to the web browser each discussion link is identical, effectively disabling the built-in ability to distinguish between visited and unvisited links.
column10: Cannot distinguish read and unread messages, or new and old messages
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Joseph, while I wholeheartedly agree with the desire for this functionality, it is not currently supported in any way by the code. It requires changes to the current design, rather than simple fixes to incorrect behavior of the code, hence, it really is a feature request. (Also, if you are not already aware, you might be interested in the ongoing work to integrate JForum in Sakai, see http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=6349.)

column1: [SAK-2100] Default permissions prevent posting of new messages (new.topic)
column6:
The default permissions on the discussion tool are set so that "access" has the following permissions: new, read, and revise.own. This should also include new.topic

Without new.topic, students cannot begin a new conversation, all messages must be in reply to an existing message. This is contrary to how most discussion boards work. Most tools prevent students from creating new categories, but allow the creation of new topics (or " threads") within the category. Here students can create as many categories as they like; they just can't put any message in them.

By default, Sakai forces the maintainer to initiate each conversation. This flies in the face of standard practice, where the discussion tool is most frequently used as place for the students to ask questions outside of the classroom, begin group work, post essays for peer review, etc.
column10: Default permissions prevent posting of new messages (new.topic)
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
Joseph, there seem to be two separate issues here:

(1) The permission to create new Categories is currently mixed up in the "new" and "revise.any" permissions; whereas, Topic has a separate "new.topic" permission, but also requires "revise.any". The Discussion permissions need to be cleaned-up to better match their usage (see SAK-175 Closed .) Being able to create Categories but not Topics is a strange combination indeed, and being eable to create both or neither seem like the primary pedagogical choices here. (Currently there is no support for being able to create Topics but not Categories, but that doesn't seem to have many use cases behind it.)

(2) Should Access be able to create new Categories and Topics with the default out-of-the-box permissions? There are folks who provide use cases to support both ways of doing this, but only one can be supported by default. The other use case, however, should be easily achievable by adjusting the permissions; see above point. Currently the directed-discussion style-of-use, where Access (e.g., Students) can only reply to exisiting Topics/Categories was the consensus default, therefore, changing the default to match the more loosely-controlled discussion is really a design change and needs to be treated as a Feature Request.
column45: Part (2), the Feature Request asepct, has been cloned to SAK-2144 Closed .
column49: this is to decouple the revise.any with new permission in Discussion tool.

Yes, this is still an issue. If the page is very long, then the browser's scrollbars are already there to handle scrolling. Internal scrollbars should be avoided whenever appropriate and feasible.

You can demonstrate the issue just using the Sakai News feed. See attached screenshot. (In fact, note the horizontal scrollbar that appears too, but the content does not appear wide enough to have a need for one.) Vertical scrolling should be achieved using the browser's scrollbar. The frame should not have one.

column84:
You can save a blank named assessment in both MIT stable 006 and the nightly build.

1. Create named assessment.
2. Go to settings, edit Assessment Introduction to remove name.
3. Save settings.
4. Return to assessments, name will now be blank.

While this is not terribly critical in the case of Core Assessments, as the author can simply clink on settings and readd the name, it's also possible, in sites without a Gradebook, to publish a blank named assessment, and the published name cannot be edited.

1. Create named assessment.
2. Go to settings, edit Assessment Introduction to remove name.
3. Publish.
4a. if there is a Gradebook, this will fail and error that it cannot make a gradebook entry. however,
4b. If there is not a gradebook, the assessment will publish with no name.

The one limiting factor is that this can only be done once – once you have a published blank named assessment, all further attempt to publish will fail, as 'duplicate names'.

column1: [SAK-2092] Quiet MyFaces variable resolver's excessive logging
column6:
The Sakai JSF VariableResolver first attempts to delegate the task of locating a managed bean to the JSF implementation. If the JSF implementation fails to locate the bean, the Sakai Variable Resolver attempts to locate the bean itself in the Spring ApplicationContext.

The MyFaces JSF implementation prints obnoxious WARN messages each time it fails to locate a managed bean. Since this is often not an error condition, we should quiet these messages from the logs.

This is a suggestion for a logging configuration change, not a change to the JSF code. Something like this should do the trick:

log4j.logger.org.apache.myfaces.el.VariableResolverImpl=error
column10: Quiet MyFaces variable resolver's excessive logging

column1: [SAK-2089] Ability to change entries in GB, regardless of where that grade/entry came from.
column6:
Ability to change entries in GB, regardless of where that grade/entry came from.

I know that the GB was designed so that the grades needed to be changed from the tool they come from (presently this would only be Samigo). However, if a student doesn't take an assessment in Samigo, there is no entry for them on the scores page; making it impossible to adjust the score. In addition if multiple assessments need to be released (accessability issue) for 1 Assignment in a gradebook, there is no way to link the assessments up.

A use cases

  • a student that for some reason needed to take the exam in paper form.
  • due to a learning disability a student would need extra time on a timed assessment. Multiple assessments would need to be released (right now the only way I see to do this restriction on this is via IP but this will likely change once sectioning/groups is implemented). However, it's impossible to have these grades automatically enter into the GB since the assessments would created assignments in the GB that applied to all students.

Just to throw out how IU's legacy course system gotten around these types of scenarios is the instructor would create an assignment in the GB. Via the testing tool, they had the option to select the GB (we permitted multiple GBs) and then choose an assignment to enter those grades into.
column10: Ability to change entries in GB, regardless of where that grade/entry came from.
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: upping priority as the accessability issue alone makes this worth addressing
column45:
Lance just assigned this to me as a task rather than keeping it a feature request.

It's definitely a new feature, and wasn't prioritized for 2.1 delivery. Maybe you guys can work it out?
column49:
By the way, I don't understand how the feature request addresses the described use cases. (I understand other use cases for a fuller Gradebook service – just not these.)

We don't show a student a misleading score of "0" if no score has been entered yet, so the extra time scenario doesn't seem to apply. What seems really to be wanted there is selective release of individual assignment scores to students, not an entire API. But we don't even support selective releases of assignments yet.

And obviously the gradebook code has no idea whether an exam is being taken in paper form or not – the score gets updated whenever you want to update it. Here, it sounds like what they want is a way for some scores to be entered automatically while other scores for the same assignment are entered manually. But I'm not sure. We need to understand what the goals are before we can figure out the best way to meet them.
column75:
While I'm waiting for Oliver or Lance to say something, and for a build to finish, I might as well throw in another piece of background on the current design....

Samigo doesn't use the Gradebook for score storage. It lets us know when it's made changes, but it doesn't read Gradebook scores back again. If we supported "gradebook override", the instructors, students, and TAs would see completely different results when looking at the same assessments in the two tools. To make it as easy as possible for instructors to jump to the right place in the external assessment tool to change a grade that they're viewing in the Gradebook, the Gradebook API accepts a URL to link to. That link (if available) will be displayed alongside the externally-maintained score. (I don't remember any more why this feature isn't being taken advantage of – it was some missing piece of functionality in the portal framework or Samigo or both.)

There's also the UI complexity that the Gradebook would have to deal with to "unlock" externally maintained scores, and the question of how external assessment engines deal with their scores being "unlocked" – so, all in all, it seemed safest for the external assessment tool to handle special "manual override" cases itself. That is, if a test being administered via Samigo has to be taken on paper by some student, then the grader would go to Samigo and input the grades there. That way the student can get the same level of feedback as all the students who took the test online. (Samigo has far more powerful student feedback features than the Gradebook.)
column80:
I apologize for not adding a comment in response to this earlier. If I had, it would have been clear that there is no way this kind of functionality will get into the gradebook for 2.1. There are interoperability issues with T&Q that would need to be worked out. In other words, this wouldn't just be about the gradebook. Two-way synchronization of grade data was not even on the table for 2.1.

There is a broader, Sakai-wide post 2.1 requirements process being defined right now. I suspect that there will be a lot of different requirements submitted against the gradebook. Prioritizing these collectively will be quite tricky.
column84: It is highly doubtful that grade data synchronization will be implemented at any time in the foreseeable future. The selective assignment release functionality is in the process of being merged into the trunk for 2.3.
column88: Assignments tool will create "internal' gradebook assignments in 2.4, thus allowing those assignmenst to be managed in both GB and Assignments tool. T&Q needs to store its own data. The management of that data will probably always remain in that tool.
column92: As of 2.4, there should be enough service methods to support this. See SAK-7474 Closed for details.

column41: How about calling this something more understandable outside the US, e.g. a privacy level setting?
column45:
----Original Message----
From: Speelmon, Lance D
Sent: Thursday, October 20, 2005 4:09 PM
To: sakai-dev
Subject: RE: FERPA flag

These are good points and well taken. The "FERPA" flag should, for all
practical purposes, be called the "privacy" flag as it is not specific to
FERPA and can easily be renamed. However, in its current implementation it
is coarse-grained and only affects behavior of the new Roster Tool. It is
like a big privacy switch; either on or off.

I agree that moving forward there should be a much finer-grained option
available. It would be useful for implementers that have concerns in these
privacy areas to begin spec'ing out a design as to how it should be
implemented and how the behavior of the application should respond to a
finer-grained mechanism.

Cheers, L

column1: [SAK-2082] Copyright interferes with downloading pdf files in Resources
column6: If the copyright alert is set to on for a pdf file, when you try to download it, it is treated as a txt file. The browser's save as form seeds the filename field with 'tool.txt' rather than <file>.pdf. If I take off the copyright notice, then the file name seeded into the save as form is <file>.pdf and it downloads ok. The file has the correct type and ends with a .pdf. It seems just the copyright alert on or off is affecting what type the file is treated as when trying to download it.
column10: Copyright interferes with downloading pdf files in Resources
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Could we get more info about this ticket. When I upload a pdf file, it shows in the list with the acrobat icon, indicating the mime type is correctly set. That happens with and without the copyright notice. Also, the file name is correctly set as <filename>.pdf. Then when I retrieve those files, in both cases the link to get the file from the access servlet has a filename ending in ".pdf". I don't see any difference between the two URLs. The only difference is that when served without the copyright notice, the link has "target" set to "_self", and with the copyright notice, it has no target set. Are there particular environmental factors at work? I'm using firefox on Mac OSX 10.3.9. My environment always wants to save PDFs instead of opening them, but trhat's because I haven't bothered to change the defaults in the browser.
column45:
In IE, trying to use the browser's Save Target As on a pdf file properly uploaded and typed that has the copyright notice set on tries to download the file as a .txt file named 'Tool'. Without the copyright notice, IE tries to save it as a pdf with the proper file name.

In FF, using the browser's Save Link As on the pdf properly upladed and typed that has the copyright notice set tries to download the file as bfbcd958-a55c-4106-0073-04600db583a2.htm. Tryint to download a pdf w/o the copyright notice tries to save it as a pdf with the proper file name.

This is not when I click on the file title in resources - both open fine. It is when I try to save as using the browser's popup menu that appears when the right mouse button is clicked.
column49: It seems to me that the resources tool is handling this correctly. When the copyright notice is required by the user who posts the document, you cannot access the document through the resources tool without going to the copyright notice. If you left-click on the link for such a resource, it opens the copyright notice. In the window containing copyright notice, the link at the bottom labelled "I agree" contains the actual access link to the resource. If you right-click on "I agree" and select "Save target as" or "Save link as", it will treat it as a pdf, exactly as it would if the copyright notice were not required. The link in the regular list is actually a link to the copyright notice, I think, although it actually calls a browser script that opens the copyright-notice window.

column1: [SAK-2077] Assignments Option for Automatically Accepting Resubmissions
column6:
A critical requirement for an assignement, when the focus is on 'process' more than a final 'product', is for the instructor to review a student's progress and give them feedback along the way. In an unstructured setting where there are no firm dates for submitting versions for review, or where students are encouraged to revise and submit often, with or without feedback, students need to be allowed to resubmit whenever they need to. In the current Assignment workflow, each student needs to contact the Instructor or TA and ask them to go to their current submission and return it whenever they want to update their work.

So, when creating an assignment, an instructor should be able to select an option that allows automatic resubmission for that assignment. Resubmissions would be allowed up until the Due Date; it might also be desirable to limit the student to x number of resubmissions (specific use case?). Students and Instructors should be able to view previous submissions too, not just the most recent one.

This option may also be useful (and perhaps the right default in general?) if an instructor does not care when an assignment is submitted, as long as it is submitted before the due date. This would allow students to re-submit on their own when they notice they've forgotten something or submitted the wrong assignement, without having to contact the instructor and wait for their assignment to be returned.
column10: Assignments Option for Automatically Accepting Resubmissions
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
This feature would satisfy a request made by instructors and students here at Michigan as seen in our Winter survey (1,357 instructors & 2,485 students). In our case, users wanted a way to allow resubmission until the due date. This would a highly useful option for students and instructors since often students submit their assignment, but realize they omitted something.

Is there a developer who would be willing to work on this?
column45: rSmart is also seeing requests for this. It would be nice to have some sort of setting on the assignment itself that allowed the instructor to make a global decision without having to go into each student's assignment and check the allow resubmission box. If you're dealing with very large classes, this would be a huge time saver.
column49: This is a top support issue for us with Assignments too.
column75:
The trick here seems to manage version control. I imagine that there are at least two separate use cases.

1-- auto-submission on due date. The student wants to draft and draft and draft, but doesn't want to have to remember to return to the site that one time to submit the assignment. In this case, the instructor doesn't expect to see the students drafts marked as "submitted" until the due date. Since the instructor doesn't see it until the due date, she doesn't assess the "wrong" version if she begins to grade the early submissions before the due date.

If we allowd students to opt in to auto-submission (provided the instructor first opts-in to allowing it), then students won't have to submit at all. They could just keep drafting. Maybe it wouldn't even have a submit button in that case, just save! That could cut down on both accidental submission problems and failure to submit problems.

But it could introduce different problems. The instructor may give the student(s) a verbal extension. Unless she modifies the due date, the system will manually turn in students (unfinished? blank?) work. In that case, the instructor would need to indeed return the auto-submission manually. And what about students who fail to do the work? Would the system turn in blank work. Will the instructor be mad at "the system" for making her page through blank submissions? We've got instructors who post optional assignments. Would the system auto-submit these as well? How does the Gradebook currently import null submissions? Zeros? Making the instructor go back and seek out auto-submitted work and treat it differently will create a whole new set of support issues.

To what extent will we be trading one problem (accidental submission before the due date) for another (accidental submission on the due date)? In the face-to-face world, the instructor doesn't come to your dorm room and take your draft off your desktop if you miss class. Not that we should live virtually by physical rules, but that the physical model might inform us of further complications.

2-- drop-box-esque assignment type. The student re-submits and re-submits and re-submits up until the due date and the instructor can view/respond to these incremental submissions. Once the system allows for incremental submissions, instructors may expect to be able to view and respond to these early submissions-- like they can now to submitted work. For instance, the first draft is due by Oct 1, second draft by Oct 7, final by Oct 21). How might that work? Would the feedback be logged like the Gradebook grade is logged? Will sltudents' previous submissions be accessible to them, to the instructor? Furthermore, could they opt to select a earlier version of their work as their final submission?

This requirement is about accidental submission and accidental failure to submit, but the larger idea of Resubmission exposes a range of interactions for consideration.
column80:
There needs to be some granularity to the resubmission option. I see four likely use cases

1. an instructor wants to allow resubmissions for the entire class as part of the assignment process (automatic resubmission, as described in the opening comment)
2. an instructor initially wants only one submission, but may choose to re-open the assignment resubmissions for the entire class at some point
3. an instructor only wants one submission, but chooses to allow a limited group of students to resubmit
4. an instructor only wants one submission, but chooses to allow individual students to resubmit

Currently Sakai only allows #4. The second and third options could be implemented by a checkbox/update kind of scheme (similar to what's seen on the Site Info page for changing roles or deleting participants, but with an added "check all" button for the entire list). Rutgers faculty have requested #2 and #3.

column104: Will this issue be addressed for 2.5?
column108:
This is huge for UW.

We have encountered a few situations with 300+ students (and even with the same course).

Details:
Assignment goes bad for some reason (system / site).
Problems / situation requires a need to change / update the assessment to allow all to re-submit the assignment whether or not they had submitted it in the first run.

Currently, we have no choice other than to advise the instructor to:
a. create another assessment item and insist that all students submit here.
b. give all students full marks.
c. weight the next or another assessment heavier.
d. go into each and every single one of the 300+ submissions / resubmissions (mark it with a "0", return to student and allow for re-submissions.

Please tell me that we are not the only instance facing this situation again and again!
We need a solution and would be ecstatic to learn that it already existed and that we won't have to wait until next year to tell our instructors that they finally have what we thought they would have had by now (I am almost positive that it was slotted for but didn't make the cut for 2.4).

Terry
column112:
I'm curious about the status of this issue, as we have customers who are also interested in this feature. Why was it pulled for 2.4, and has it been enabled for 2.5?

I see two levels of resubmission counts: one at the assignment level, set by the instructor when the assignment is created, and one at the submission level, set when the instructor grades or reviews the submission, and defaulting to the assignment level value.

I also see the need for the ability to manage the submission level value by groups instead of individual submissions.

So far, these sound like straightforward requirements, unless I'm missing some dependencies on the gradebook or other tools.
column116:
This item lists several use cases where the ability to resubmit assignments is needed.

The case where students should be allowed to upload multiple revisions of an assignment before the due date has already been addressed in a related issue, SAK-14746 Closed .

The new subtask, SAK-14931 Closed , addresses the feature needed by instructors to permit assignment resubmission for more than one student at a time, by tagging entries in a list of students.

The current implementation doesn't make each resubmission as a separate submission object. Submission revision control is under consideration now.

column1: [SAK-2074] Improve Hibernate handling in Sakai component system
column6:
(I'm starting this off with minor priority since it addresses no end-user functionality. It just improves life for developers and deployers.)

Currently, any Sakai component implementation which relies on Hibernate to handle persistence must be split into two JAR archives:

  • One containing Hibernate mapping files, Hibernate-mapped classes, and any classes they refer to. This JAR is placed in a shared-memory area of the web server – conventionally "shared/lib".
  • One containing the remainder of the business logic which implements the service interface.

This split is problematic for several reasons.

First, the DB mapping is logically part of the implementation and is most naturally maintained, tracked, and bundled with it. This division unnecessarily complicates directory layouts, builds, and deployments.

Second, due to J2EE classloader constraints, putting classes in shared-memory forces all the classes to which they refer to also be put in shared memory. This results either in massive pollution of the shared area, which causes library version contention, or (more likely) in artificially constraining the logic of Hibernate-mapped objects, making them simple data holders rather than object-oriented code. This defeats one point of an ORM system such as Hibernate: to map regular full-featured Java classes to a DB.

Third, there's no built-in clean-up of obsolete "shared/lib" JARs from Maven. (That might be addressed by changing the Maven Sakai plug-in, though.)
column10: Improve Hibernate handling in Sakai component system
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I would say this is more serious than minor but that is just my opinion.

Here is the way to workaround it for now:

1) Create a maven.xml file similar to the one below:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project
xmlns:j="jelly:core"
xmlns:license="license"
xmlns:util="jelly:util"
xmlns:ant="jelly:ant"
xmlns:artifact="artifact"
xmlns:maven="jelly:maven"
default="sakai:build">

<postGoal name="java:compile">
<ant:copy file="src/java/edu/vt/sakai/provider/UserData.hbm.xml" todir="$

{maven.tomcat.home}/shared/classes/edu/\
vt/sakai/provider/" />
<ant:copy file="target/classes/edu/vt/sakai/provider/UserData.class" todir="${maven.tomcat.home}

/shared/classes/\
edu/vt/sakai/provider/" />
</postGoal>

<postGoal name="sakai:clean">
<ant:delete file="$

{maven.tomcat.home}/shared/classes/edu/vt/sakai/provider/UserData.hbm.xml" />
<ant:delete file="${maven.tomcat.home}

/shared/classes/edu/vt/sakai/provider/UserData.class" />
</postGoal>

</project>

2) Place that maven.xml file into the same place as your project.xml file.

Good luck
-AZ

column1: [SAK-2073] Importing question(s) from a public pool to an assessment causes error and blank tool
column6:
Adding a question from a pool that has been copied in to the question pool manager by another user to an assessment results in a blank iframe and the following error in the log file:

ERROR: Servlet.service() for servlet Faces Servlet threw exception (2005-09-19 14:07:10,237 http-8080-Processor21_org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.[Catalina].[localhost].[/samigo].[Faces Servlet])
java.lang.Error: java.lang.Exception
at org.sakaiproject.tool.assessment.services.ItemService.deleteItemMetaData(ItemService.java:132)
at org.sakaiproject.tool.assessment.ui.listener.questionpool.ImportQuestionsToAuthoring.importItems(ImportQuestionsToAuthoring.java:143)

Easiest way to reproduce:
As user A create a question pool, add at least one question to the pool, copy the pool to the Pool Manager.
As user B create an assessment, add a question of type 'Copy from Question Pool', choose the pool created by user A, choose atleat on question to import and click 'Import'.

Cause:
When an item is imported from a pool to an assessment it is cloned and the meta data is deleted from the copy, however the original owner still owns the question and only the owner of a question can delete it's meta data.

One way to fix:
By setting the cloned question item as being created by the current user this error is removed.

One way of doing this is by adding:
itemfacade.setCreatedBy(AgentFacade.getAgentString());

at line 110 of /sam/src/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/ui/listner/questionpool/ImportQuestionToAuthoring.java

(It maybe worth discussing if a user should or should not own a question they import from a pool).

column1: [SAK-2071] Questions created in pools, uneditable
column6:
Clicking on a question that was created in a pool to edit the question results in blank iframe were the question editor should have been and a java.lang.RuntimeException: failed to populateItemBean error is written in the logs.

Easiest way to recreate the bug: Start from Samigo, click on 'Question Pools', create a question pool, add a question to the pool, click on the question to edit it.

By adding a check at line 108 of /sam/src/org/sakaiproject/tool/assessment/ui/listener/author/ItemModifyListener.java to see if itemfacade.getSequence() is null or not before using it's intValue() solved the problem.

such as:

if (itemfacade.getSequence() != null)
itemauthorbean.setItemNo(String.valueOf(itemfacade.getSequence().intValue()));

This fix works, but there probably is a better solution as getting the sequence of the item in the context of a question pool doesn¿t really make much sense.

In case nobody understands what I meant, there were two defects that were being tracked under SAK-1825 Closed . Since then, we have split the bug into two different tracking numbers.

Although SAK-1825 Closed was supposed to be an authoring bug, it consisted of two parts
a) disabling feedback did not unselect feedback cheakboxes in authoring, and
b) students were seeing dated feedback, when it should not yet have been shown.

So a) is an authoring bug, and b) is a delivery bug. The part a) in authoring has been fixed, and noted as resolved and this open bug has been created to track b), superceding SAK-1825 Closed , part b).

column1: [SAK-2069] Changing Email Notification And Access options not saving
column6:
Steps to duplicate

Upload some .xsd files in your resources( for example I uploaded Contact Info.xsd, education-history.xsd, career-plan.xsd,Interests.xsd in my resources.)

Go to the Meta Object tool,

  • click New
  • Fill out Name of form
  • Clicking Pick Schema will take you to the resources select any .xsd file(I selected contactInfo.xsd)
  • Click finish(it will take you back to the form)
  • Click Save

Go to the Resources tool

  • click Add
  • Pick 'Form Item' as a Change Item Type
  • Select form type will show up
  • Select COntact Info as a Select Form type
  • You will see all the fields of Conatct Info Form

In the properties Section You will see the fields with Title, Description, Access and Email Notification.

  • Give the title to form.(say Contact Info Form)
  • click the check box of Access field as a Display to non-members
  • Select Email Notification as LOw- Only partici....
  • Click Add

You will come back to Resources homepage with Contact Info Form added in your resources

  • Click Edit properties link of Contact Info Form

******
You will notice that Email Notification is on None- No notification
Email Notification was not saved.
****

Now if you uncheck box of fileld Access as Display to non-members not selected

  • Click update.
  • Click Edit properties link of Contact Info Form
  • You will notice that Display to non-members box is checked and uncheck was not saved.

Rashmi - I found the Site Roster tool on Nightly 2, it looks great!! I found a few problems with the tool that I've reported below along with a few design issues. I've tried to separate them out and to prioritize them, because the problems are a higher priority than the design issues. You may not have been ready for me to take a look at this yet, so if I've looked at it too early and you're not quite finished, I apologize.

Problems

1. I chose to hide my personal information and when I returned to the Roster tool and selected my Profile, my personal information is still available. I should see 'No personal information is available for this user' and my photo should not appear. In it's place I should see the 'No Official Photo is Available' box. Additionally, my picture is still available when I click 'Show Pictures'. I should see the 'No Official Photo is Available' box.
2. I am seeing the same behavior when I select 'Hide my entire profile'.
3. First name field seems to be using the last name field. When I click Profile next to my name, My first name displays as Hancock and my last name displays as Hancock, even though it is correct in the Profile tool in My Workspace.
4. I am seeing some weird behavior when I view a Profile, Cancel out of that Profile, navigate to another site and then return. What happens is the profile is displaying inline. Here are the steps I take to reproduce the problem:

  • From the Show Roster view, select the Profile link
  • Click Cancel
  • You should now be in the Show Roster view
  • Navigate to another site - My Workspace for example
  • Now navigate back to your original site
  • The Roster tool appears, but the profile you just viewed appears inline. When trying to click Cancel, nothing happens. I have to click the Reset button for the tool to get back to the Show Roster view.

5. Other Information added by the user doesn't appear when viewing the user's profile from the Roster tool.

Design

1. The Role (e.g., access and maintain) and All Users should be shown in a bar as shown in SR-1 (pg. 3) and SR-4 (pg. 6) of the Site Roster design doc.
2. We need to add a space between the role and the number of users in that role and between All Users and the total number of users as shown in SR-1 and SR-4 of the Site Roster design doc.
3. The title for Photo ID when user selects 'Show Official Photo ID' is 'Picture' and title for Picture when user selects 'Show Pictures' is 'Photo ID'. These titles need to be switched.
4. Is it possible to hyperlink the Home Page as shown in SR-5 (pg. 7) of the design doc?
5. Is it possible to center the user's info with the picture rather than aligning the user's info with the top of the picture as shown in SR-3 (pg. 5) of the design doc?
6. Is it possible to enable the sort by user or user ID as shown in SR-1 (pg. 3) and SR-4 (pg. 6) of the design doc?
column45:
I wanted to add a comment to the first 2 problems I reported. I tested this a bit further today and found that other users cannot see information that I have chosen to hide. Therefore, these problems are not quite as high priority as I first thought. However, if the user chooses to hide his/her information, the user should not see this information either in the Roster tool. Otherwise, the user will think that other users have access to their information even though they don't.

I did find one additional problem when testing with multiple users. When viewing users by role in the Show Roster view, the alignment is of center. The Profile, Name and User ID columns for the maintain user are farther to the right than the same columns for the access user. Not a big problem, just a cosmetic issue.

Please let me know if you need any additional information to replicate the problems I've described above. Thanks!!
column49: when testing this on our oncourse staging build, there are roles that are showing up that don't have users assigned to them. if a role doesn't have a user assigned, then the role shouldn't show up when viewing the roster by role. i've attached a screenshot to show you what i mean. thanks!!

column1: [SAK-2067] Error message for locking out editing of site refers to site ID, not title
column6:
When attempting to edit a site that another person is already editing, the user is prevented from doing so and gets an error message. This error message is good and descriptive, but it refers to the site's ID rather than the title of the site--basically, it says "You are unable to edit the site <site ID> at this time because someone else is editing <site ID>". It would be more user-friendly and easy to read if it used the site's title instead.

  • Zhen

column1: [SAK-2066] tools forget their placement configuration
column6:
Tools sometimes forget their configuration. This is transient, a browse refresh will restore the tool's proper configuration. This is most easily seen with web content tools that sometimes display the instruction page instead of their configured URL.

The problem is a multi-thread concurrency issue with the Site object's lazy parts. The code to date has let multiple threads access a tool's configuration, one going off to the db to resolve the lazy status, reading the values, while others assume the read is done and see no options.

The problem seems to have been made worse with the recent introduction of caching in the Site service.

column1: [SAK-2419] Breadcrumb doesnt appear quite right.
column6: It seems odd to have pages repeated in the breadcrumb list. Perhaps listing each page only once (either the first or last occurence) would keep this shorter and simpler, effectively making it a "recently visited" page. It's value is to go back to a previously-visited page (e.g. analogous to the Go menu in Firefox), so listing pages more than once doesn't help.

column41:
On reflection I agree with Stephen. I propose the following logic: As a new page is visited, it's name is added to the end of the 'breadcrumb'. If the name already exists in the breadcrumb, the previous entry is removed.

In case it is not specified elsewhere, I also think there should be a permanent link to 'Home' somewhere on every page. Initially, this should take you to the first page created when adding the RWiki tool. In future versions we may want to make the location of 'Home' configurable...

column49:
The breadcrumb now is more like 'Recently visited pages' It seems to be working well on sakai-beta until you exceed 8 items. The trail starts OK:

Home > Harriet's Pages > Page 1

But after 8 Items, it takes the form:

View_right > ... > HOWTO-Pages > HOWTO-Public > CO Liaison > Stephen Marquards Com > AERC Test Page > HOWTO-Images > Recent Changes > Sakai Dev Meeting 200509

And whichever page is to the left of > ... > remains fixed while the trail to the right of > ... > is refreshing itself as one would expect.

I imagine this is left over from when we were preserving 'Home' as the first entry. Now we have moved home to the menu bar this is unnecessary and is not working anyway.

Probably the best solution is to have a fixed prefix/header that says 'Recently visited:' and then the behaviour to the right of > ... >

column1: [SAK-2418] Tool state is lost when switching worksites
column6: If you're in edit view with unsaved changes and move to another tool or site and then back to the wiki, you lose the changes. Javascript warning might be appropriate.
column10: Tool state is lost when switching worksites
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
This is a mjor issue. At present RWiki does not maintain state, hecne navigating away from the tool and returning causes the tool state to reset to the home page. This is not right.

Solutions.....
We can catch onbody_unload events but FF will only inform and will not prevent unloads, IE is perfectly happy to prevent a people from unloading. It's probably possible to capture the state of the form/whole tool and store in cookies but maybe a lot of javascript magic

using the above trick we can store the state in the client, hence when you open 2 windows, 2 seperate client sessions they both have seperate state. If we do this server side, it will become impossible to have 2 threads of viewing in the wiki tool. We will try the client side state first. Lots of dificulty, like 4k cookies etc. (could use ajax!)

Ultimately we want to be able to store tool state, client side, per session.
column45:
We will try and get this into the code freeze using the Sakai Session State service.

Spec:
State should be maintained on on location in the site (easy), and if in an edit page, the current state of the edit page when you move away should be saved (hard)

Imp:
Server Site session stores the pageid and function on a per tool basis, and causes reload to that place when the user comes into home.

On the edit page, state is stored to a cookie on unload and restored on load. This includes the version id of the page.
column49:
I would say remembering the page you were on in RWiki if you move to another tool and back again would be useful. I would expect to reset to home if logged out and logged back in. Not sure what I would expect if I moved to another site and back, either behaviour seems reasonable.

In the edit page I would _not_ expect to retain state if I moved away, but it may be useful to warn me that my edits will be lost if I move away from the page if this can be accomplished easily with javascript. I would say leave this for a later version unless the javascript warning is easy.

column45:
I have put some code in to do this in edittoolbar.jsp

However.... it will never work in Safari or Konquerer since they "forgot" to provide text are selection support

In these browsers it will append the markup.
column49:
1. In Firefox it works ok, with this exception:

  • When you double-click on a word in a sentence, it includes the trailing space in the selection. Clicking on 'bold' leads to markup as such:

__word __next word

The renderer doesn't render this correctly (although it does render italics correctly, i.e.

~~word ~~next word

So the bold rendering needs to be fixed, and/or the markup applied to the selection without the trailing space (better).

2. In IE 6.0, it works as you suggest it would work for Safari/Konqueror: you can highlight a word, but when you click on a formatting link, it highlights everything in the editor, and appends the markup.
column75:
fixed for the buttons (firefox) also added a new bug for the asdasd_bold_JKLKJLK bug.

Looks line if there is no space before the frist __ and after the second __ it doesnt markup
column80: Firefox behaviour is now OK, but IE behaviour is still incorrect.
column84: looks like this went into 005 as a merge before I go a chance to assign it back to you. I did test it quite hard.
column88: This is also in 2.1.
column92:
This is a small issue, but anyway:

In Firefox, if you double-click on a word to select it, it selects the word and the trailing space. When you click on a format link (bold, italics), it applies the markup to exclude the trailing space (correctly I think) like this:

in this wiki i am _bolding_ some words and ~italicizing~ some others

But if you do the same operation in IE, it selects in the same way but applies the markup differently to INCLUDE the trailing space, viz.:

in this wiki i am __bolding __ some words and ~~italicizing ~~ some others

I think the IE behaviour should be changed to act like FF.

column1: [SAK-2063] Nested forms in structured artifact editor handled incorrectly
column6:
The structured-artifact editor saves only one set of values for nested form elements. For example, the sample form "contactInfo" has a nested form called "phoneNumber", and "phoneNumber" has three fields ("type", "number" and "contact"). There should be at least one and possibly many instances of "phoneNumber" in a "contactInfo" instance. But when two or more instances are added, only the inputs for the final instance are saved.

(Hint to self: The problem is in the way the nested form-elements are named).

column1: [SAK-2058] Title Confusion
column6:
During new Worksite Setup and on the Site Info page (Edit Tools), the user is prompted to assign a TITLE to Web Content and News tools. But on the Options page, a change in the TITLE field does not effect the TITLE on the tool bar.

The TITLE one types into the Options page is represented in the iFrame wrapper only.

It makes sense that these two fields can have different text. It doesn't make sense that the fields are called the same thing. The user thinks it's a bug that she changes the title but the title doesn't change.

Perhaps the title for the tool navigation could be called "tool title" and the title for the iframe could be called something like "tool sub-title". Would be grand if both could be edited from the Options page. If not, then perhaps the Options page could include a hint on where to change the nav tool title.

I've never seen anyone find this on their own. Even making it to Site Info > Edit Tools isn't enough. One has to click the Continue button before one is presented with the option to rename the nav button.

Looks and smells like a bug to the user. [dlp]
column10: Title Confusion

Please see the linked ticket SAK-2079 Closed for checked in fixes. If the Web Content tool is the only tool in the page, changing its title can also change the tool menu's title with an automatic browser refresh.

thanks,

column1: [SAK-2057] auto-submit shouldn't be checked if a timed assessment isn't selected
column6:
We had an instructor contact us because he had published an assessment in Samigo and had 26 students take it. When he went to look at the scores, only 12 students showed up as having taken the test. Further investigation into the matter revealed that students who had manually submitted the assessment were the ones that were showing up, and those that had relied on Auto Submit were missing. We managed to recover the submitted assessments that were not showing up for the instructor, but this seems like a significant flaw.

Authors should not have the ability to publish an assessment with the following combinations:

No time restrictions AND Auto-submit checked
**Assessment will never be submitted as in IM270077

or

Time restrictions given AND Auto-submit unchecked
**Assessment will not be submitted

I can't think of a use case where someone would want a time restriction put on an assessment and not want the assessment to submit after the time limit has expired. This leads me to the question of whether auto-submit should even be an option, or if it should happen by default for a timed assessment.
column10: auto-submit shouldn't be checked if a timed assessment isn't selected
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Updated brief description.
column45:
The system is working as designed. If there is an assessment isn't timed and autosubmit is checked, it would never be submitted. That is what is occuring in the use case above. However, including some error checking so that autosubmit can't be checked if timed assessment isn't checked is definately nessecary. This type of bug is related to SAK-1956 Closed (Time restrictions given AND Auto-submit unchecked
**Assessment will not be submitted)

Also, the ability to not check autosubmit for a timed assessment is nessecary. An instructor may want it timed, but elect to accept late submissions.
column49: SAK-1956 Closed is actually Should not be alble to publish timed assessmentwith 0 time alloted
column75:
The original specification from Indiana that Caitlin prepared allows user selection of a timed assessment with or without auto-submit. This is how it was implemented. Indepencence of these two variables allows for late submission after the time limit--the use case that Megan May explains.

It does make sense, however, to put a warning in the settings page after auto selection:
"For timed assessments, auto-submit should be selected unless you allow late student submissions after the time limit."

Also, , "Auto-submit. . ." should be greyed out until "Timed Assessment" is checked. This is because "Auto-submit. . . " is meaningless unless "Timed Assessment" is checked.
column80: Fixed. Margaret - Could you please check? Thanks,Huong
column84: I'll check the implemented behavior, but it would also be good to get Marc's input on it. Marc, do Charles' suggestions work for you? Do they address the user concerns sufficiently?
column88:
There's two types of new behavior requested in this issue if I'm understanding it right.

1 - put a warning message in the timed assessment settings.

The warning is there, but you need to add a space between the words "unless" and "you". (see attached image).

2 - Auto-submit should only be enabled if the timed assessment box is checked.

Looks like this is backwards. Right now, autosubmit is automatically turned on, and can only be turned off if the timed assessment box is checked. It should be the other way around.

Marc, can you clarify exactly what you want and pass this back to Huong? Thanks.
column92: Margaret is correct for #1. For #2, the way it is implemented is correct. You do want auto-submit to be pre-selected since that is what you are telling people to do in #1 anyway. Also, Megan confirms that auto-submission, even if selected, will not happen unless there is a time-limit.
column96: fixed #1
column100: Verified fixed on all three nightly instances. Linking to SAK-1547 Closed to wait for stable.
column104: Verified on the MIT instances.

column1: [SAK-2056] Samigo does not calculate questions drawn from pools correctly
column6:
We are getting emails and support call from panicked students who are being told by the system that they have failed an assessment.

A faculty member has set up an assessment of multiple parts with each part being a draw of some set of questions from a random pool.

Part A - 6 from 12
Part B - 6 from 24
Part C - 6 from 18
Part D - 1 from 6
part E - 1 from 6

The entire assessment totals to 5 points, meaning that each question is a fraction of a point.

some questions are multiple answer FIBs, others are single answer FIB.

When calculating the grade you would expect the answer to be drawn as:
(total points earned/points for questions selected)

Instead the calcuation appears to be:
(total points earned/points for questions IN POOL)

This information also propagates to the gradebook where the F is displayed.

To fix assignments that have already be posted to gradebook, go to the published assessment that you want to modify, and click on 'settings', then go to 'Grading', select "None" in Gradebook Options, then click on "Save Settings". This will remove the incorrect assignment from gradebook. Then go back and click on 'Grades sent to Gradebook' under Gradebook options, and 'Save settings'. The correct Max Score and all students' scores for this published assessment will be sent back to gradebook.

column1: [SAK-2055] Moving a top-level question pool to top level duplicates in other sites
column6:
To trigger the bug:
1. Create a pool at the top level (not as a "subpool") and add some questions.
2. Save the pool, returning to the main pool page. Click "Move" under the pool name.
3. Click "Pool Manager" as the destination (essentially moving the pool back to the same place that you are moving it from)

It seems like nothing happens, but if someone logs into another account and checks their site pools, they will have a duplicate of this one. If the creator deletes the original, it deletes the pool from other people's sites, including any copies that might have been made of it (this actually would be a neat feature if the destination could be targeted and the copy was left behind, i.e, move a pool to another site).

column49: Can we remove samigo.css from the maintenance branch?
column75:
The purpose of this patch is to add additional styles needed for Samigo, and to rename the files to follow Sakai convention.

To apply the patch for Samigo (Tests and Quizzes), please follow the steps below:

1. download all 3 attached files.

2. copy tool_sam.css to sam/webapp/css. The samigo.css is no longer needed.

3. copy sam_header.inc to sam/webapp/include and rename it to "header.inc". This replaces the old "header.inc", used when running Samigo standalone.

4. copy sakai_samigo_header.inc to sam/sakai-samigo/webapp/include and rename it to "header.inc". This replaces the old "header.inc", used when running Samigo inside Sakai.

To verify your patch is installed correctly, a quick way is go to Assessment Authoring page and try creating a question. You should now see the numbers for the steps in dark purple circles.

You do not need this patch if you are checking out the source code from the SVN Head. This patch is only for people who are checking out the source code from the maintenance branch.

column1: [SAK-2050] Error messages needed when file is inaccessable  (Sakai site using file storage system)
column6:
When a user attempts to access a file that is unavailable (perhaps quarentined due to a virus) an error message needs be be displayed. Right now depending how the file is accessed this is what they will see
1) Empty doc is displayed/downloaded
2) If it's not a public doc and accessed via a url, the document opens with the authentication screen
3) If you attempt to edit the file (ie the title), it asks you to choose a file.

When a file is stored in the DB, a message displays stating that it is unavailable. Something similar needs to be done when a when files are stored on a separate file storage system
column7: This only applies when Sakai is being used with a file storage system
column10: Error messages needed when file is inaccessable  (Sakai site using file storage system)
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: This is a problem with the access servlet. Can it be assigned to the developer who implemented the code to handle files stored in the file system?
column45: Glenn, if someone else can/should do this, please reassign.
column49:
Here is the scenario: ContentHosting is configured to store content in the file system rather than the database; e.g.:
bodyPath@org.sakaiproject.service.legacy.content.ContentHostingService = /mnt/sakai
bodyVolumes@org.sakaiproject.service.legacy.content.ContentHostingService = a01,b01

If for some reason, the file system becomes unavailable to Sakai (e.g. nfs mounted file system is inaccessible) then Sakai must detect the error condition and display an appropriate error message to the user.

As the code stands right now (as of r2433) two very bad things happen:
1) Even though the file could not be created (FileNotFoundException) the row is still insterted into CONTENT_RESOURCE. This must be resolved. As it stands, the user thinks the file has been uploaded successfully when in fact it has not.
2) No error message is ever diaplayed to the end user.

Here is the current exception that gets logged in catalina.out:
WARN: org.sakaiproject.component.legacy.content.DbContentService$DbStorage@1a796c8: failed to write resource: /user/lance/config.xml : java.io.FileNotFoundException: /mnt/sakai/b01/2005/280/15/f1969fdb-d6b5-4d3b-003b-c019ac328237 (No such file or directory) (2005-10-07 10:27:56,996 TP-Processor67_org.sakaiproject.component.framework.log.CommonsLogger)

Thanks, Lance
column75: updating severity to match that of duplicate bug
column80: This issue is related to SAK-2225 Closed but is not the same (as my previous comment stated)
column84: We need to test this very thoroughly, to make sure appropriate error messages occur in resources, access servlet, webdav and other tools when the filesystem is unavailable, and to make sure no regression was introduced when running in other configurations.
column88: Ready for retest.
column92: From Megan: This is giving an apache error - this was not the intended error message.
column96: This is an unrecoverable system error that requires intervention by a sys admin. Should this error be caught in the dispatcher, logged with a stack trace and redirected to a message saying the system is temporarily unavailable?
column100: This really sounds like a new problem. We haven't gotten an apache error before under the circumstances described in the original JIRA ticket. Could you give more details about the new circumstances? Was this tested by removing permissions from the file-space? What user actions generated an error? Can you give a screen-shot of the apache error message?
column104:
If you click the "Edit properties" button for a file when the file system is unavailable, you get an error message in Resources saying "Operation could not be completed at this time." When you try to retrieve the file itself, you get a 404 error.

The "problem" is in the AccessServlet. When it cannot retrieve a file, it returns a 404 error. That is the normal, expected behavior for the AccessServlet. I'd say this should be resolved as "not an issue".
column108: I tend to agree that we should not tackle a change lick this to AccessServlet this late in the release cycle. Let's mark as won't fix and come back to it after 2.1.0. Thanks, L
column112: Will decide post-2.1 whether to change this. AccessServlet returns error codes. Proposal is that it should generate custom error messages instead.
column116: This was mistakenly marked as a duplicate of SAK-3093 Closed . The behavior described is probably correct. A request to the AccessServlet should either serve a file or return an error code. The only known deviation from that is in the case of a required copyright alert.
column120: This was implements in the 2.1 release. I have created a feature request for the ability to specify a custom message ( SAK-3656 Closed )

column1: [SAK-2046] Unable to modify "accept until" date in assignments tool after due date
column6: An instructor creates an assignment in the assignments tool. she sets the begin, end and accept until dates on the assignment, adds content and posts the assignment to her students. Students submit their assignments up until the due date, but some students aren't able to submit by the expected due date (in this case it was due to a bug in Sakai that has since been fixed). The instructor would like to go in and change the "accept until" date so that she can effectively grant an extension on the assignment (she wants to keep the same due date, but wants to provide additional time for those who didn't get the assignment turned in). When she clicks the post button to update the assignment, she gets an error that the due date cannot be in the past. I have included a detailed description submitted to us by the user who was having this problem.

column49:
John, I'm not sure what the use case would be. I am speculating that once the due date has passed, it was decided that the assignment shouldn't be edited.

column1: [SAK-34830] Support for Import/export pools, release tests to groups, better web editor..etc
column6:
I'm copying Charles' email here to keep track of them in JIRA.

Charles Hedrick <hedrick@rutgers.edu>

  • we need to be able to copy sites, export them, and import them. This has to include test content. Examples: creating a new semester based on the old, transferring responsibility to a new faculty member. Saying that I can export tests as QTI is not a good answer. (1) there will be lots of tests. I don't want to have to do each one individually (2) if tests are based on a pool, the pool also has to be copied (3) there are going to be lots of tools in Sakai. We can't have a separate export/import function for each one. Faculty expect to be able to export or move the whole site.
  • we need to be able to export and import tests that use pools. I
    realize this is complex. I'm willing to accept a compromise where the exported copy only has pointers to the pool items. Then to successfully move the test, you'd need to move the pools.
  • we need to be able to export and import pools. It would also be
    useful to give others access to the pool. In particular, it would be useful to give admin access to pools. I can't debug any user problems with tests involving pools because I can't see their pools. I believe they will also want colleagues to be able to see them.
  • we need to do something about getting tests from publishers. A
    possible workaround involves getting the tests in QTI format (e.g. by importing into blackboard from the publisher and exporting as QTI). That requires better QTI support.
  • faculty need to be able to do makeup tests. They want to make them available just to a few students. I have two suggestions. One is release to a group. Presumably that will happen as part of the current work to support sections. But another approach is something like the anonymous quiz that isn't anonymous. I.e. like anonymous it generates a URL, which you have to give to the students. But it would require a login and report who took it. With these special and makeup tests, the faculty really need to know who took them.
  • the ability to change the default template. Default settings will
    differ among institutions.
  • a better web editor. HTMLArea isn't quite functional enough. Sferyx has the right functionality, but it takes too long to start and is going to generate support problems. I'm going to have to talk 50,000 students through downloading and installing Java, and all the Mac users will require hand-holding through the java shim installation. Furthermore, even after installing the shim, Mac browsers are a bit iffy with Java. Furthermore, Sferyx is hard with tests. There are a number of text areas on the same page that need an editor. Sferyx is too big to put in each of the areas. So I end up starting it as a separate window, with buttons under each blank to feed data to and from Sferyx. This is just clumsy. We need a reasonably good editor, that doesn't have a separate long startup time, complete with equation support, that can appear in multiple text areas on a page. The commercial CMSs' have managed to identify such editors. I'm willing to buy something.
column10: Support for Import/export pools, release tests to groups, better web editor..etc

Feedback is pretty much binary. If you set immediate feedback,

column1: [SAK-2035] "to" address in announcement with e-mail notification should be hidden
column6:
In a site that uses the "Announcement" tool but does not use the "e-mail archive" tool, announcements still show the archive address as the "to: " line in the e-mail that is sent out. This should be on the "bcc:" line. Participants who use "reply all" will receive a "bounce" error message, this address is not meant to used publicly in these cases and should be hidden.

In sites that do use the "e-mail archive", reply-all to announcements will send the message to the archive tool and to all participants in the site, this is not necessarily the expected behavior since announcements are conceptually distinct from the mailing list. It aggravates the perennial listserv problem of accidentally replying to the list.
column10: "to" address in announcement with e-mail notification should be hidden

Besides the standard type of do-not-reply header on this type of message, it would be useful if the reply-to address was set to an email address that would let Sakai/James bounce back a specific reply explaining the situation and that no one will receive the message.

Anyone making use of the current "functionality" of having replies goto to the Email Archive? I expect there are some folks who might be using that behavior currently. Use cases anyone?

As an example in addition to having the choice to send e-mail as "low" or "high" priority, it would have the option to "allow replies to e-mail archive" or not, defaulting to not (and not allowing it to be set if the e-mail archive was not being used).

Ok, what we now have is:

For all notifications except for the email archive ones
(which includes resources, announcements, syllabus):

  • the From: will be the service identifier (as specified in sakai.properties "ui.service") with the address of "no-reply" at the service.
  • to To: will be the individual user, not the list
  • the "no-reply" mail will come back to the server, if replied to, and be quietly eaten - no record, no log.

These notifications are now from Sakai to a user, and are not expected to be replied to.

These notifications are no longer sensitive to the site not having an email archive or the user who makes the change that generates the notifcation not having an email address.
