column1: [SAK-2032] Samigo assessment timer does not reset between tests
column6:
If a student is about to take several timed tests in a row, the assessment timer is not reset between assessments.

e.g.

1) Student starts taking Test 1 with the assessment timer set to 10 minutes.
2) He/She finishes the test after 4 minutes with 6 minutes remaining on the assessment timer for Test 1
3) Then he/she starts taking Test 2 which is setup to us a timer with 10 minutes as well
4) As soon as the student starts taking Test 2, only the remaining time from Test 1 is allotted, which in this example is 6 minutes instead 10 minutes.

So the assessment timer doesn't get reset properly from one assessment to the next one.

column1: [SAK-2031] Gradebook's roster doesn't match the current official roster
column6: One of our pilot instructors has had a student add his course a little later than the others, still during Michigan's drop/add period. The student appears on the official course roster in Site Info, but doesn't appear in the Roster in Gradebook.
column10: Gradebook's roster doesn't match the current official roster
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: So the rest of the class roster is coming from the provider, and one student has been added manually.
column45: No, the rosters don't match. The Site Info roster has the student who has just registered for the class, but the Gradebook roster doesn't have that student.
column49:
The Gradebook doesn't keep a separate roster. It just asks the Sakai legacy SecurityService for everyone who has "gradebook.access" permission in the site.

Michelle, I don't know anything about your provider implementation, but is it possibly following a different code path from manual adds, one which doesn't add that permission for a new student site member?

If so, this might be related to SAK-1361 Closed . According to a recent conversation with Chuck, we were given the wrong advice for how best to handle Gradebook permissions in the 2.0 release, and we should have stuck to our original plan, which was just to base authorization on site maintain and access. That could easily be done now if backwards compatibility isn't an issue. See my last comment at:

http://bugs.sakaiproject.org/jira/browse/SAK-1361#action_18037
column75: Our provider implementation is through the Realms and our campus provider ids give the class roster and instructors of record. I just checked that the general realm template our course sites are using does enable the "gradebook.access" permission for the Student role. In this case, the student who is not appearing would have not been listed under that provider id when the Gradebook was first turned on for the site, but subsequently has become an official registered student, so now is listed under that provider id along with the other students. It seems like Gradebook just isn't checking if there are any changes to the list of users in the given provider ids.
column80:
But have you checked to see if that access role has the "gradebook.access" permission in that specific site?

I'm sorry to sound insistent about this, but the Gradebook application honestly does not store enrollment data anywhere (except in standalone mode, of course). It doesn't store what students are in the course, it doesn't store their names, it doesn't store their email addresses.... All it stores about students is their UIDs in any grade records they've been given. Every time you move to a new screen in the Gradebook, the Gradebook asks Sakai "Who are the people with gradebook.access permission right here right now?" and uses that data to display the roster and to figure out whose name belongs to whose grade records.

So there's something more mysterious going on than just the Gradebook data being stale. We literally don't have the power to be stale.
column84:
You're right! The specific site in question does not have the gradebook.access permission for the Student role. It was created by one of those really prepared instructors who created the site months before the term started (and we updated our realms and permissions).

I'm going to turn gradebook.access on for Student role in that site and see if that solves the problem.
column88:
Turning gradebook.access on for Student role solved the problem - now Gradebook shows that one student who was missing.

Interestingly, turns out NO ROLE had either gradebook.access or gradebook.maintain permissions, yet this was the only problem that has been reported.
column92: Closing this down, although I'll link it to the other permissions issue for easy tracking. Hopefully, integration will be smoother next time around!
column96:
Ray, Michelle--

I just had a report from one of our pilot instructors that two students indicated at Site Info as coming from the provider weren't showing up in the gradebook. Both were showing up at Realms from the provider too. I saved the realm (making no changes!) and rechecked the gradebook and they showed up.

I didn't check the roles-- Michelle, can you do that here as you did with Mark's site?-- but I wonder if this example adds the kind of evidence to further troubleshoot the source(s) of general roster update problems.

column1: [SAK-2030] Dropped student's score still used to calculate Average of Scores Entered
column6:
We had a pilot instructor manually add one of us as a student to his class so we could demo the student side of Gradebook for him. He gave us a grade, saw the student end of Gradebook, and then deleted us from the class. However, the grade he gave us on the assignment, even though we're no longer in the class, is still being averaged in to calculate the "Average for Scores Entered".

I think this is a real scenario at Michigan, since students can add or drop a course until about the 3rd week of classes. For example, a student starts a course, bombs the first assignment, then decides to drop the course before the drop/add deadline. They drop off the roster, and should drop off the gradebook, along with that data.
column10: Dropped student's score still used to calculate Average of Scores Entered

column41:
I second the request that dropped students' scores not be counted in the class averages.

I don't think dropped students should be removed from the roster. Having them there is helpful to instructors. I propose that in the gradebook for 2.1, the 'View" dropdown include "Dropped Students" as an option.
column45: For this item, let's focus on fixing the issue dealing with dropped students being counted into the average in Gradebook. The second part, whether or not to remove students from the roster when they drop is a more complicated and separate issue; good reasons for both approaches have been brought up elsewhere.

We now filter out grades for dropped students before calculating statistics.

column1: [SAK-2033] Tool Configuration final parameters
column6:
Some tool configuration parameters that are in the tool.xml files are meant to be changed with each placement, others are not. In the past, we would have put these ones that are not supposed to change in the web.xml in the servlet declaration. Now we can put all the tool's configuration parameters in the tool.xml file, and mark those that we don't want to let the users configure as "final".

An example of a mutable configuration, one that can be changed in each placement:

<configuration name="height" value="600px" />

An example of a final configuration, one that should not be changed in each placement:

<configuration name="reset.button" value="false" type="final" />

The Tool object is extended to include, along with getRegisteredConfig, getMutableConfig and getFinalConfig.

The generic options editors (Admin Site Tool) will show only the mutable, not the final.

The web.xml is cleaned up to remove any final configuration, and the tool.xml files enhanced to include them as "final".

column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

7) Return to the total scores page. Yup, now there's two submissions there.

column1: [SAK-2025] Second account using identical e-mail address can block messages
column6:
In sites that use the e-mail archive, if you add an account to the participant list and allow messages to be sent, and another account exists that uses the same e-mail address but is not a participant in the site, messages sent by the owner of the first account may fail. It seems like Sakai checks the address to see if it has permission to send messages through that site, and immediately fails on the first "no" that it finds. It should check the permissions of all accounts that have that e-mail address, if one of them is allowed to send messages then the message should go through. There is no clear indication of why the message bounces (e-mail error says "not permitted" but the archive tool says the address can send messages).

It may seems stupid to have more than one account with the same address, but it's not. We have encouraged faculty to create guest accounts for themselves so they can log into their own course sites with student-level access to check that things look and work correctly. It's very easy and convenient to simply give the same e-mail address for both usernames instead of creating a yahoo or hotmail address, and the system does not prevent it. If this is a "wontfix" issue, then a new bug needs to be opened to prevent the same e-mail address from re-used by more than one account.

Two workarounds - either add all accounts with the same address to the sites, or always use a different e-mail address for multiple accounts.
column10: Second account using identical e-mail address can block messages
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
It looks like there are a couple "bugs" here to choose to fix or re-define as expected behavior. So we need to put some design effort on this before we implement the solution.

One approach is consider allowing the same email address for different accounts to be a bug. Sakai then would then be tasked with validating when an account is created (or when the user changes their email address) that the email address for that account is unique.

A second approach is to have Sakai continue allowing non-unique email addresses for accounts. The bug then becomes how Sakai handles verfying whether an email should be accepted by Email Archive. The current logic doesn't appear to know about multiple accounts with the same email address, so depending on which account it runs across first during its check, it will either accept or reject the email; if accepted, then the user probably isn't even aware of the potential problem here. The question then becomes what logic solves the bug? Is it that as long as one account with the email address is "valid", then the email will be accepted, or is it that as long as one account with the email address is "invalid", then the email will be rejected?

I don't think anyone will ago for the first approach being a real bug, so let's sort of the logic that goes with the second approach.
column45: A third option suggested is to add all accounts with the same email address to the site when you add one. That behavior probably won't map well to user expectations. It maybe that users create multiple accounts just so they can particiapte in some worksites under one "alias", and other worksites under a different "alias".
column49:
As odd as it sounds, this is really significant as a support issue. I had a situation where Borland support added an account for me to their developer network, and ran into endless problems because a different account existed with the same e-mail address.

So this is a real-world problem. Two add my two cents in.
column75:
I think there should be some configurable options here:

1. It should be possible to enable enforcing globally unique email addresses (i.e. a sakai.properties option or something that prevents new accounts from being added with the same email address as an existing account, and prevents an account update from creating a duplicate).

2. It should be possible to enforce unique email addresses within a site, possibly on a per-site basis. Sakai would then prevent a user from joining a site if an existing user in that site had the same email address (and would also have to check account updates to ensure that this didn't create conflicts).

In our situation, we would just enforce #1, but in other cases where it's regarded as desirable to allow different users to have the same address, #2 would work around the problem (at the expense of some implementation complexity).

However, in cases where there is no ambiguity (i.e. no 2 users in the site have the same email), the behaviour as described is definitely a clear bug which doesn't require options #1 or #2 above to resolve. Sakai should be able to correctly apply permissions based on site membership.
column80:
Option #2 above would not address the problem. The most common scenario for its occurrence is precisely when only one of the two existing accounts is participating in a site. Adding the second account to the site is actually the workaround to the problem, so by preventing that on a site-by-site basis you would block the workaround and leave the original problem. Actually I don't see what benefit there would be to preventing a user from joining a site if an existing user had the same e-mail address - at most it would just prevent the receipt of a second copy of the same e-mail message, and you can already change mail notification preferences to deal with that.

My understanding of the logic
Sakai receives message, does a search on the "from" address, checks if that account exists is permitted to send to the "to" address, then either sends or bounces the message. Currently it stops after finding the first account with that address, but should loop for all accounts that have that address.

Or, it should take an entirely different approach, by reversing the query:
Sakai receives a message, does a search on the "to" address (which is the site identifier), checks if the "from" address appears in the site participant list for that site and checks the mail archive permissions, and either sends or bounces the message. This way it would not need to know that more than one account has the same address, since it is giving priority to the site settings rather than the account.
column84:
There's the current problem (identified in the description), which Sakai should be able to deal with correctly, i.e. a resolvable bug.

Then there is a range of possible other problems arising from users with the same email. For example, what if user A and user B do both belong to a site, have the same email address, but only user A has rights to send to the mail archive.

Or in the case of a possible future tool which has bidirectional email gateways for discussion forums, you want to associate a message in Sakai that originated in email with the user who sent it. So it's necessary to convert email address > Sakai userid. It should always be possible to resolve this unambiguously, hence the value of not allowing > 1 user in a site with the same email address.
column88:
Initial solution for 2.1: Property flag to select between enable/disable enforcement of the uniqueness of accounts' email addresses. If being enforced, then each account in Sakai needs to have a unique email address; if not, then multiple Sakai accounts can use the same email address.

When operating in the mode that allows multiple accounts to have the same email address, then each account should be treated as a separate "individual". For instance, one common use-case is an instructor using two accounts in a site to see it from both the instructor and student point-of-view; each account should be handled independently. In the particular case of the Email Archive – the focus of this issue – this means inbound email will be accepted from an address as along as one account with that address has the correct permissions for the site. A fix is needed, therefore, in how Sakai is checking permissions; the check should not stop after the first occurrence of an email address, unless that account has permission and the email is accepted.
column92:
I think the initial solution is to prevent a new account from using an email address that already is used since when that happens email to the site can be rejected when coming from a valid account. Or as suggested change the incoming email verification checking routine to find all accounts with the email and check each account rather than quitting after the first one.

Then the feature requests are the optional flags. We should create new jiras for each of those requests. There is also a feature request from before Jira (I'll put it in Jira now) to provide for an account having multiple email address associated with the account, so that a user can send email to the site from any one of several email accounts they may have.
column96: John, we should not implement your "initial solution" as it would break the system from the prespective of users who are already using multiple accounts with the same email address. These users are the ones who are encountering the issue reported. We would also have the problem of how to deal with accounts that have been already created that share email addresses; in fact, if it is configurable, and it is changed from allow to disallow non-unique email addresses, then the system is going to need to do some checking on existing accounts and let the admin know if it can/cannot be swtiched without issue.
column100:
This is causing a problem for us in 2.0.x, so Ive done potential fix against 2.1 head tonight. I will attach a diff. It may not be the correct fix, but its one solution.

Is makes the aassumption that for SakaiMailet, the query on email returns a list of users, all of which are tested against the email archive channel. The first accepted user results in the email being accepted.

Drawbacks.
UserDirectroyProviders need 1 new method.
UserDirectoryProviders need to depend on sakai-legacy-component so they can create BaseUserEdit objects.

Also, I HAVE NOT TESTED THIS CODE YET, but will do so on Monday when I can connect up to our LDAP instances.
It does build.

column124: Glenn, could you please comment here regarding what rules were checked into the code to address this issue? Thanks.
column128:
I think the original reported problem is fixed. I tested on sakai-stable oracle version (only one where email is hooked up).
I created a site, added a user. Send email to the site and the user received the email.
I added several other accounts to Sakai that had the same email address as the original user.
Sent another email to the site, and the user received the email.

What used to happen is that the email would get bounced if there were more than one account with the same email address as the incoming email to the site.
column132:
This was fixed, as John describes - we check for all the users who have the given email address, and if any of them are allowed to add the message, the message is added.

If there is some other error here, please open a new jira.

column1: [SAK-2024] Problem with attachments on items imported to a new site
column6:
On a migrated site, when assignments with attachments are brought over (or when imported from a previous site into a new one), the attachments retain their original id. If the attachment came from the user's local system, then it gets shoved in the special attachments folder. Things in there are 'public' in a sense - anyone can see them. So those attachments are viewable by students.

If the attachment came from the Resources (in the original site), the Assignment in the new site has attachments that ponit to a file in Resources from the original site. The instructor can see those since they are a member of both sites. Students can't see them since they aren't a member of the previous term site and so don't have permissions to view Resources there.

We could change the id of attachments that go to resources to make the id go to a resource in the new site.
column10: Problem with attachments on items imported to a new site

Then created a new site (jlclass), imported assignments and resources from the SMPL site. The assignment in the jlclass site had attachments that were to the resources in the simpl site.

column1: [SAK-2023] UI: AM/PM Indicator
column6:
Users often miss the AM/PM designation when creating or editing schedule events. Since the default view is business hours only, the user panics when he doesn't see the event appear on the schedule after creating it. Or, he can find it in the monthly view but then it seems to disappear in the weekly view.

A little sun/moon icon next to the date/time could be a useful visual clue. This could also work in Assignments, I suppose.

column1: [SAK-2022] error handling when volume fills up
column6:
Sakai currently does not inform the user when file uploads fail due to lack of space. This has been fixed for Resources (SAK-2353), but is still an issue with other tools.

The original report against resources indicates:

If you upload a file to Resources and the destination space is full, you'll still see the file listed in Resources as though the transfer succeeded. When you try to access the file, however, it'll turn out to be 0 bytes in size.

catalina.out says:

WARN org.sakaiproject.component.legacy.content.DbContentService$DbStorage@1f0c45f failed to write resource /user/marith/Weasel/Another 800kb doc.rtf java.io.FileNotFoundException /afs/ir/class/saki/content1/2005/236/19/d8a323a3-066c-478a-80f5-33aa73b4c659 (No space left on device) (2005-08-24 122829,356 TP-Processor3_org.sakaiproject.component.framework.log.CommonsLogger)
Aug 24, 2005 122840 PM org.apache.catalina.startup.HostConfig checkResources
column10: error handling when volume fills up
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: See the original issue that was cloned, SAK-2013 Closed , for more background on this issue.
column45: Other tools besides Resources, will also be susceptible to this problem if they use attachments, which are stored in the file-system as well.
column49: Sakai needs to properly catch the "full" error and let the user know that their action did not succeed.
column75:
Comment by casey dunn [12-Sep-2005 18:30] from SAK-2013:

1) merely reporting an exception when it fails to write to a full disk area. This would be the org.sakaiproject.component.legacy.content.DbContentService exception above.

2) failing to report to the user that the upload failed

3) recording in the database that the upload was successful

4) displaying to the user that the file was successfully uploaded

My definition of swallowing is not as air-tight as "failing to log it" - my definition is more along the line of "failing to respond to an error condition." beyond that lying to the user is worse.
column80: Is there a way to test for this? We have dealt with a number of possible errors writing to the file system and writing to the database. This may have been handled.
column84:
This has been dealt with in Resources. I would close it and ask that QA checks whether it has been handled effectively, but the initial report indicated that it is a global problem that affects other tools and services besides Resources.

In Resources, we show error messages if an attempt to read from or write to the file system or database causes an error. But this must be done carefully in every tool context where reading/writing occurs. That's probably true in other tools as well.
column88: This has been resolved for Resources. It is unclear if it still might presenta problem in other tools, as this fix should cover them in most cases.
column92:
Additional notes from Jim:

I worked on ContentHosting, ResourcesAction, the AccessServlet and
DavServlet. ContentHosting methods that access the filesystem will
throw an exception if
attempts to access the filesystem fail. If any other tools are careless about
the way in which they catch exceptions, it is possible that a failure of this
sort will be ignored by some other tools.

ASIDE: Chuck, John Ellis and I talked a lot about this in the past few
days. John believes very strongly that this kind of exception should be
handled at
the highest level possible, probably in the request dispatcher rather than in
the tool. He says the request should get redirected to a page reporting a
general failure that the user cannot correct. The more we talked about it, the
more I like John's suggestion. Now is not the right time to do this, but I
would suggest that after the 2.1 release we back out most of my changes so an
error writing to the filesystem is again an unchecked exception. Then we
should catch java.lang.RuntimeException, java.lang.Error or
java.lang.Throwable
in one of the dispatcher classes (VPPA or above) and redirect from
there for any
kind of catastrophic failure like this.
column96: Due to insufficiant QA resources, this issue was not verified via the formal QA process but is included (ie fixed) in a production version of Sakai (2.1). If you find this report is still a problem, please re-open the ticket.

column1: [SAK-2019] Container login may show blank page
column6:
User probable gets a blank page after loging in CAS.
This problem was always caused in my enviroment.

Container login sends redirect to browser without checking URL redirect to.
Therefore, when url is null, browser gets "302 Found" response without
Location: header. Then, This cause showing blank page.

I don't yet understand it is proper workflow or not.
But, attached patch attached avoid showing blank page.

column1: [SAK-2016] Copy question exception
column6:
verified on all 3 nightly qa instances (post 2.0.1)

If you copy a question from one question pool to another, and the same question already exists in the destination pool, Samigo throws an exception (see attached):

WARN: SQL Error: 1062, SQLState: 23000 (2005-09-12 15:55:16,186 http-29080-Processor23_net.sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter)
ERROR: null, message from server: "Duplicate entry '1-313' for key 1" (2005-09-12 15:55:16,186 http-29080-Processor23_net.sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter)

It's easy to do this by accident, since the list of available pools to copy a question to always includes its own pool.

Suggested fix: Put in an error message? "This question is already in one or more of the specified pools."

column1: [SAK-2015] Foreign Character Encoding Issue
column6:
Hello,

Below are our notes on research an ongoing Unicode issue.

Discovered in Assignments and Resources
Manifestation - Assignments:

  • If a user creates an assignment with a Unicode character in the Title field, the assignment does not show up in the list of assignments
  • The catalina.out log reveals a XML parsing error.
  • The MySQL database field contains an incomplete XML file that ends at the point where the Unicode character was found.

Manifestation - Resources:

  • If a file upload contains a foreign character in the file name, the Resources tool may become unstable throughout the system and be unavailable to all sites.

Comments

  • When the form used by the "New Assignment" page is processed, it generates an entire XML file and stores it in the database.
  • Examples are from the from assignment_content table. Other tables tables may be affected as well.
  • Example good record:
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
    <content allowattach="true"
    context="b32cfe66-9ecc-4cba-0043-1e0df90222c1"
    datecreated="20050826171605824" groupproject="true" honorpledge="1"
    id="54293ba9-f85d-4d17-80ca-bbdd837754aa" indivgraded="false"
    instructions="SMOpcsOpIGlzIGEgbsOpdyBzdHJpbmcu "
    instructions-html="SMOpcsOpIGlzIGEgbsOpdyBzdHJpbmcu "
    lastmod="20050826171605824" numberofattachments="0"
    numberofauthors="0" releasegrades="false" scaled_maxgradepoint="0"
    submissiontype="3" title="Foreign Title" typeofgrade="1">
    <properties>
    <property enc="BASE64" name="CHEF:creator" value="YWRtaW4= "/>
    <property enc="BASE64" name="CHEF:modifiedby" value="YWRtaW4= "/>
    <property enc="BASE64" name="DAV:getlastmodified" value="MjAwNTA4MjYxNzE2MDgxMzU= "/>
    <property enc="BASE64" name="DAV:creationdate" value="MjAwNTA4MjYxNzE2MDU4MjQ= "/>
    </properties>
    </content>

Example bad record:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<content allowattach="true"
context="b32cfe66-9ecc-4cba-0043-1e0df90222c1"
datecreated="20050826171447016" groupproject="true" honorpledge="1"
id="ac84f7f7-e5a2-47aa-0090-eb72fe7b073b" indivgraded="false"
instructions="VGhpcyBpcyBhIGZvcmVpZ24tbMO4w7hraW5nIHDDqmPDvGNlIG9mIHTDqXh0Lg== "
instructions-html="VGhpcyBpcyBhIGZvcmVpZ24tbMO4w7hraW5nIHDDqmPDvGNlIG9mIHTDqXh0Lg== "
lastmod="20050826171447016" numberofattachments="0"
numberofauthors="0" releasegrades="false" scaled_maxgradepoint="0"
submissiontype="3" title="Foreign Titl

  • Note that in the "bad record" that the data is truncated at the point where the original field data was "Foreign Titlé"
  • The "instructions" and "instructions-html" data values are being BASE64 encoded and thus are not vulnerable to this error.
  • The "title" data is stored as-entered by the user.
  • The data from the entire "New Assignment" form is being serialized into XML string and then stored in the database.
  • Upon retrieval of the data for display (as when refreshing the screen immediately after submission), the catalina.out log file shows the error and the new Assignment does not display in the list of Assignments. There is no warning to the user.
  • The error is: "WARN: readDocumentFromString: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: XML document structures must start and end within the same entity." and "[Fatal Error] :8:67: XML document structures must start and end within the same entity."
  • The character set for the MySQL table is UTF-8

column92:
We've had some unfortunate experiences with the Resource part of the problem. Particularly:

"the Resources tool may become unstable throughout the system and be unavailable to all sites."

This to us seems the most severe aspect of this bug. Once the errors are kicked off, they loop around indefinitely until Tomcat is restarted, and with each loop they write another bad row to the CONTENT_RESOURCE table. Over the course of a weekend this once filled an entire tablespace, and effectively crashed the system. The only symptom the user sees is that the Resources tool hangs, but underneath the hood Sakai is spinning in circles until someone forcibly stops it.

Our emergency response as soon as we see this beginning is to kill the process trying to do inserts into the table, and then truncate the table to remove all the bad rows. Finally, we need to restart Tomcat. Only then is the Resources tool usable again in that site.
column96:
Hi,

I just checked version 2.1.0_005 and this issue is better, but still not completely fixed; at least it did not take down Sakai. As the attached screen image will show, the Title of an assignment is mangled; for comparison, the title should be the same as is shown in the assignment body.

A separate, but related additional note: in another test, I have foreign characters in the title of a MS Word document I uploaded as an assignment attachment. When the title was stored in the database, the foreign characters were replaced by regular characters. That is, "Fore[accent grave]ign Do[accent acute]cument.doc" is in the database as "Foregin Document.doc."

Hope this is clear and makes sense.

Jim
column100:
John,

The graphic posted today by James Williamson relates to the character encoding of the title of an assignment. I'm not sure whether that was the original issue in this ticket, but at this point it seems like either there should be a new ticket for that issue or this ticket should be revised to cover it. I think the part of this ticket related to resources has been resolved. As James notes, characters in the name of an uploaded file that are invalid in a resource id are escaped in the resource id so, for example, "Fore[accent grave]ign Do[accent acute]cument.doc" becomes "Foreign Document.doc" in the resource id, but I think you'll find that the original is preserved as the title in resources. Maybe the same approach could be used in assignments? Or maybe that's just a matter of making sure that UTF-8 is used in every step of the processing of the title?

Could you assign this ticket to someone who can fix this in assignments?

Thanks.

Jim

column1: [SAK-2013] Sakai not distributing files randomly as expected
column6:
Sakai currently does not inform the user when file uploads fail due to lack of space. If you upload a file to Resources and the destination space is full, you'll still see the file listed in Resources as though the transfer succeeded. When you try to access the file, however, it'll turn out to be 0 bytes in size.

catalina.out says:

WARN org.sakaiproject.component.legacy.content.DbContentService$DbStorage@1f0c45f failed to write resource /user/marith/Weasel/Another 800kb doc.rtf java.io.FileNotFoundException /afs/ir/class/saki/content1/2005/236/19/d8a323a3-066c-478a-80f5-33aa73b4c659 (No space left on device) (2005-08-24 122829,356 TP-Processor3_org.sakaiproject.component.framework.log.CommonsLogger)
Aug 24, 2005 122840 PM org.apache.catalina.startup.HostConfig checkResources
column10: Sakai not distributing files randomly as expected
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
If this is happening, it could be that you don't really have your AFS feature working. Sakai knows nothing about the file system except that it's supposed to write there. AFS is nothing special to Sakai. If your AFS was making these two volumes appear as one successfully, we would expect any application, including Java, including Sakai, to work.

What is you sakai.properties configuration for the body path and volumes for this?

  • Glenn
column45: Margaret, you aren't really reporting a specific bug here with Sakai, so I'd suggest posting this query to sakai-dev or sakai-user. You'll reach a much larger audience there, and hopefully find someone with some AFS skills. And, when you do get answer, please take a moment to include it with this issue for future reference. Thanks.
column49:
Here's our sakai.properties on this box:

  1. AFS access
    bodyPath@org.sakaiproject.service.legacy.content.ContentHostingService=/afs/ir/class/sakai
    bodyVolumes@org.sakaiproject.service.legacy.content.ContentHostingService=content1,content2

Content1 had 100MB of quota, Content2 had 500MB.

Sakai wrote to these volumes just find under most circumstances. Our test plan was to find boundary conditions. Like 'what if Content1 filled up'.

It seems to me that AFS is configured correctly for Sakai, and the failure lies in Sakai not correctly failing over to an alternate volume when a file system is full.

I'd hazard a guess that this failure mode would only be noticeable on asymetric volumes. If you procured all your volumes at initial install, all the same size, it's unlikely you'd encounter this scenario.

Although this also raises the question of how can one add file system storage after initial configuration?
column75:
Peter, this is an issue w/Sakai volumn management for the content hosting service. I would like to know how you came to your conclusion.

AFS, as Glen commented is beside the point.

"joined volumes" is not a term of AFS art, it's an attempt to describe the use of multiple volumes used by a Sakai deployment.

This would happen in any managed space.
column80: Casey, I queuried the folks to whom this would've been assigned to as a bug to work on, such as Glenn. None of them knew what to do it with it, so rather than having the issue sit here with no one able to look at, I suggest broadcasting this query to the email lists. They have a much wider distribution and hopefully someone can help pin-point the bug here, so that it can be worked on. Thanks.
column84:
As an overview, in this case Sakai is:

1) merely reporting an exception when it fails to write to a full disk area. This would be the org.sakaiproject.component.legacy.content.DbContentService exception above.

2) failing to report to the user that the upload failed

3) recording in the database that the upload was successful

4) displaying to the user that the file was successfully uploaded

My definition of swallowing is not as air-tight as "failing to log it" - my definition is more along the line of "failing to respond to an error condition."

beyond that lying to the user is worse.
column88:
Ok, if you are not talking about some special AFS issue, and looking at the comments (which for some reason I didn't get by email...) I see that's probably the case...

This is NOT how Sakai's volume management works. It does not "roll over" from one to the other. Instead, if randomly assigns new files to one of the set of volumes (I'd have to look up what "random" means here). If a volume is full, it's full, and you have a problem.

Look to see if the distribution of files over these 2 volumes is a) occurring (you should see an even mix of resources with these two in their file_path fields in content_resource) and b) even. Let me know what you see.

We've run this with 99 volumes, which is a much larger number than 2. Perhaps the "random" distribution is not working with 2 all that well. Our 100 are really mapped to just one or two afs volumes. The idea is that if things start to fill up, we would get a new AFS volume, move some files around (their paths would not change, just how the 99 volumes are mapped to the real disks), and therefore have more room.

  • Glenn
column92:
Yes, we had got that bit about how it is supposed to work, thanks Glenn. it's a modulo dealy down in the volume mgt code when you go looking.

What we were investigating here is a "lopsided" upload pattern blowing one of the volumes out of quota, and Sakai's response. One giant Movie project, say...

The response is pretty bad - as you say "If a volume is full, it's full, and you have a problem." What is happening is described above, and is the core issue of this Jira issue.

(Margaret is going to change the title to focus on the error handling and not the storage media.)

Your anticipated operational response is to stuff more space in under the mount points? Otherwise you will have to update the path info. OK.
column96: One possible solution here then, might be a simple check to see if Sakai can read back the first few bytes of a file that it writes to the file system. I can deal with the rnd() file sprayer and other funkiness, but I'm pretty upset at anything that claims a write was successful (and writes headers to the database) when it was not.
column100: (Focus of bug changed to error handling, rather than space allocation.)
column104: I think we can split this into two issues now: (1) not handling "full" correctly, and (2) potentially something wrong with the random distribution algorithm.
column108: See SAK-2022 Closed for not handling the "full" error correctly.

column1: [SAK-2008] Performance: support multiple user lookup from user directory provider
column6:
In the cases where we need a list of users, and we need to get this list of users from or partially from the user directory provider, support a way to get them in a single call, to take advantage of any efficiencies that we can program into the user directory provider when talking to the external system.

The Dropbox tool is one place where we get a list of users that would benefit from this.
column10: Performance: support multiple user lookup from user directory provider
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
When patching this into a pre-2.1 version of Sakai, start with the r1634 changes. The r1635 changes bring the various providers up to the new API, but you may not need these if you are not using them.

Then make sure to update your custom UserDirectoryProvider to add the new method.

The new API is:

/**

  • Access a collection of UserEdit objects; if the user is found, update the information, otherwise remove the UserEdit object from the collection.
  • @param users The UserEdit objects (with id set) to fill in or remove.
    */
    void getUsers(Collection users);

Following the pattern of the UserDirectoryProvider's getUser(UserEdit) method, a Collection of UserEdit objects is passed in, with only the id fields filled in. The provider must either fill in the rest of the information, just like for getUser(), or remove it from the collection. Only found users with information filled in should be returned. If none of the users are found, return an empty collection..

If your implementation supports some efficient way to check and get the info of many users at once, then implement this method to take advantage of this.

If not, simply do something like this:

/**

  • Access a collection of UserEdit objects; if the user is found, update the information, otherwise remove the UserEdit object from the collection.
  • @param users The UserEdit objects (with id set) to fill in or remove.
    */
    public void getUsers(Collection users)
    {
    for (Iterator i = users.iterator(); i.hasNext()
    Unknown macro: { UserEdit user = (UserEdit) i.next(); if (!getUser(user)) { i.remove(); } }

    }

column1: [SAK-34648] sam 517 is not a non-issue: import/export of random draw from pool
column6:
517 was answered as a non-issue. It's not. I have a faculty member who has 29 sections of a 1000 person course. He has prepared a test in a test area using a bunch of random draw from pool. He now needs to put the assessment into the 29 sections. He was expecting to export it and import it into the 29 sections. He's about the get a very nasty surprise.

Furthermore, what happens when we need to move an assessment from one course to another? EVERY object in the system has to be exportable and moveable.

1) The pools themselves need to be exportable and importable, so we can pass responsbility to another faculty member, among other things.

2) The questions using the pools need to be.

The original 517 answer said basically that it was a hard problem. I'm willing to accept a subset. I'd be happy if we could export an assessment that pointed to a pool, and have it import only if the same pools already exist. I.e. what would export and import would be just the pointers to the pools.

Of course that presupposes that export and import of pools will work, but I believe that's under way, right?
column7: Issue exists for all environments through current as of Sept. 29, 2006
column10: sam 517 is not a non-issue: import/export of random draw from pool
column19: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
column41: Samigo Team, this sounds more like a feature request than a non-issue, since there is a use-case that is looking to be addressed.
column45:
Rather than export/import, the intended way to support this use case is to expand the ownership of items within the CMS beyond the 'creator'. Until Sakai has robust groups support, we can't add this functionality.

This is not to say that we don't want export/import for QPs, but the solution above is priority for us. We would welcome a proposal from a SEPP member to contribute code for export/import for QPs.
column49:
I understand the issue that you're stating and agree that it must be addressed in some manner to allow successful assessment sharing among sections.

Some good news is that I have versions of 'Import Question Pool' working for locally for me in both Sakai v2.1 and 2.2.x. Both code sets are pending review and QA before they can be moved to trunk or maintenance, however. I cannot give you a release estimate yet.

This new feature will not resolve your original problem because as you've stated, exporting an assessment with any question pool random draw results in the entire pool of questions being exported within the assessment. This will also be an issue for site archival from one quarter/semester to another. The solution might require a new item/question type in the qti code that specifies the random draw and pool information. I'll include this concept in my QTI studies to see if there is an existing model in the documentation.

One advantage of the current design is that I have been able to export an assessment with random draw from one user's pool and import that xml file as a question pool for another user. So question pool sharing will be available between user's with this technique when the import code is released.

The export question pool issue is bigger because of the possibility of multiple levels of subpools. We need to determine the best model for handling this issue prior to coding. I will also bring this up during our migration talks at WG-Migration.
column75:
Currenlty functionality where an export of an assessment with a pool draw question generates the entire pool in the export is connected to import issues.

As a benefit, by exporting an entire pool from a single draw question, the generated XML may be handed off to another faculty member as a solution to 'sharing'.
If or when this function is changed, we need to ensure that another model for exporting question pools or sharing pools is in place.

column1: [SAK-2004] obscure coding in samigo
column6: Samigo uses the same jsp's in various contexts. E.g. the same code will present a question for the faculty, the student taking the test, and the student looking at feedback after grading. The contexts are defined by various boolean flags. I find the combinations obscure. This has to be error-prone. You might be better off with a single enumerated type for the state, with states like TAKING_TEST, FEEDBACK_DURING_TEST, FEEDBACK_AFTER_GRADING. Possibly even a bit mask, to simplify making something available in several states.
column10: obscure coding in samigo
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: Charles, I'm having a hard time finding an issue in this report. It sounds more like a topic for general discussion on the sakai-dev list?
column45:
I think this bug is pretty obscure.

Also it is standard procedure to approach coding practice and refactoring that does not expose a user-facing defect as a task rather than a bug.

Here are some of the possible candidate interpretations:

1. Java ServerFaces rendered attributes are using more complex EL logical expressions, and that calculated boolean backing bean properties might make more readable code.

2. Java ServerFaces urls are independent of the actual page being displayed. Although there some approaches to coding around it, generally speaking JSF is a post-centric UI framework, and hides the underlying code that apage represents.

3. The Java code needs to use enumerated types or bitmasks. I completely understand the comment, but have no idea what this means in practical terms.

I can find cases for all three interpretations.

We really appreciate feedback, but entering bugs that are this obscure is not really productive.

Remember, anything entered as a bug has to be tested by QA, assigned to an engineer, the engineer must do a fix, the fix must be confirmed, so if something is not and actual or potential user-facing defect, it will not fit in well with that workflow.
column49: Charles, I'm going to close this issue out as we haven't heard back from you. Please feel free to re-open it, if you wish to persue it. Thanks.

column1: [SAK-2003] scores being shown at the wrong time
column6:
While taking a test, scores are shown if "show scores" is on. That will let them go back and fix their answer, unless going back is disabled. I could see this as an optional feature, but there's only one "show scores" which also controls whether students can see scores after their test is submitted and graded. I believe most faculty will expect "show scores" to let students see their score after grading, not while taking the test.

diff tableOfContents.jsp.hold tableOfContents.jsp
152c152

{part.questions-part.unansweredQuestions}/#{part.questions} #{msg.ans_q}, #{part.pointsDisplayString}#{part.maxPoints} #{msg.pt}" >
—

, #

{msg.pt}" >

) " escape="false" />
—
> <h:outputText value="#

{question.sequence}. #{question.strippedText} (#{question.maxPoints} #{msg.pt}) " escape="false" />

On the other hand, scores for individual questions do not show after grading when a student goes back to look at their test. One could argue for separate settings for total score and scores of individual items (or perhaps showing individual item scores only if question-level feedback is turned on), but we think faculty are most likely to want this to show. After all, most faculty turn back paper tests, and students expect to see what they did on each question. One could turn on showing correct answer, but that doesn't deal with knowing how much partial credit you got on each question.

column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I think it's probably unexpected to show the correct answer while taking the test. This can be disabled by disabling feedback during the test (which you can do by using a date before today rather than immediate feedback). However faculty may want to use item level feedback to give hints for during the test when students give wrong answers. I'd be willing to accept two different properties for showing the correct answer, one during the test and when after grading. But given that there's only one, I strongly suggest disabling the correct answer from feedback during the test.

To do that, add a test for delivery.previewMode eq 'true' to all tests for delivery.feedbackComponent.showCorrectResponse, in samigo/jsf/delivery/item/*
column45:

column1: [SAK-2000] Ability to show feedback upon submission
column6:
We have a faculty member who wants to use a quiz to help students review. He wants to give them up to 3 tries. For each try he wants them to submit the quiz for grading, and then show them which questions they got right, but not what the answer is.

He's running into all kinds of problems.

2. Feedback is pretty much binary. If you set immediate feedback, they can get feedback while taking the test. We all find this very odd. We'd expect to see feedback only after they submit it for grading, at least as an option. I'd be willing to argue that this is a bug. Someone might want the current behavior, but I think it would be unusual.

At any rate, we need to split "immediate feedback" into "feedback while taking test" and "feedback after test is graded."
column10: Ability to show feedback upon submission
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41:
I see this as three separate use cases and hence 3 types of feedback from which to select:

1) For "Immediate Feedback" during a test you only want feedback displayed after a student's results are submitted or she will be able to glean the answers from the feedback. ("Show Feedback" should not be displayed in this case before submission for grading). The feedback shown to the user should only include that associated with the selections made. This should be true for both MC/Single Correct Answer and MC/Multiple Correct Answer

2) For dated Feedback for a test it should work as it does now. No students can see how they did until the feedback date arrives.

3) For self-study/Immediate Feedback: it may be helpful for a student to work on a single question until they get a correct answer but this will essentially invalidate any saved score since they can iterate on selection/Show Feedback until they find the right one. I guess the score can simply show the instructor if they spent enough time on it to get to the right answer.
column45: just linking these for future tracking
column49: All linked Jiras references ability to display feedback to students immediately after assessment is submitted.
column75: This feature is implemented in 2.5 . See SAK-10523 Closed
column80: Closing since it's a duplicate.

column1: [SAK-1999] show correct response combines things that should be separate
column6:
We have a faculty member who wants to use a quiz to help students review. He wants to give them up to 3 tries. For each try he wants them to submit the quiz for grading, and then show them which questions they got right, but not what the answer is.

He's running into all kinds of problems.

1. There's no way to show whether a student got a question right without also showing the answer. "Correct response" combines "you got it right" with listing the actual correct answer when they got it wrong. We believe there should be two separate items: show whether response is correct, and show correct answer.

column1: [SAK-1998] multiple submission assessments not grading correctly (cumulative score)
column6:
Assessments that have multiple submissions do not have a correct master grade. Each individual assessment appears to be grading fine, but there seems to be a problem when there are multiple submissions.

Note: The GB is the only place that the avg would appear as there is no interface for it in the Test & Quizzes tool. For highest scores being recorded, the GB is also the place to g for master score, although you can see which one is the highest by viewing all submissions for a user.

-->To replicate with assessment using avg score calcuation
1) Create assessment that has multiple submissions and grading set to use avg score
2) take assessment, get all questions right. Check score in GB at this point:
Avg Score assessments: It's correct at this point (30 pts).
3) take assessment again, get all questions wrong. Check the score in GB, the user now has a 0 points in the GB
4) Take the assessment a third time; getting all questions right. Check the score in GB. The users now has all points (30) for the test. (30+0+30)/3 should equal an avg of 20 pts

-->To replicate with assessment using high score calcuation
1) Create assessment that has multiple submissions and grading set to use high score
2) take assessment, get 1 out of 3 questions right (10 out of 30 points). Check score in GB at this point: It's correct at this point - 10 points
3) take assessment again, get all questions wrong. Check the score in GB, the user now has a 0 points in the GB, even though the highest score thus far is 10pts
column10: multiple submission assessments not grading correctly (cumulative score)

Hi Lydia,

I checked that there is setting for highest / average score in assessment setting but I don't think it has been implemented at all.

1. in select assessment page, u have a list of submitted assessment, the score recorded what you have last submitted but not any highest nor average.

2. In the grading page, the grade again can show the last assessment score that you have submitted or all that you have submitted but there is no place for highest or average score.

3. GB basically provides a view to the last assessment that you have submitted like 1 & 2.

I am not sure that we have a page to provide such view. Can you check with QingRu & Charles to find out if they are aware of it. I could be wrong, otherwise, we need to mark this as an unimplemented feature. Either hide the setting or implement it. Let me know. Thanks.

Daisy

Also, it will need to be very clear to the user that when an assessment is submitted multiple times, it will be the last submission that is pulled into the GB (and if they wish to adjust the score, that they will need to use that submission to do so.
column88: Any thoughts on this ?
column92:
The only thing that should have been added to the grading mock-ups (last version: grading.050426.pdf) is a post-it pointing to the Total column on pages 4 and 5 saying "Display either highest or average score of submitted assessments based on assessment settings."

Given our current project limbo, I vote we fix this bug rather than hiding the setting.

It looks like this is a case where division of labor broke down (settings vs. grading pages). Also, I think there was confusion in that highest and average were never to be separate data displays from what the mockups show, it was always what would be calculated for the Total.
column96: Marc, saw your email...waiting for your mockup.

As the requirement for average or highest score for multiple submissions was originally from IU, I asked them whether that was still vital at got this response:

IU does not need to have this feature. I think there are enough problems with the feature at this point that our constituents would prefer it just to work and forego the average score option. No bold promises or expectations on this specific feature have been made. Thanks.
Rob Lowden

Given the conflict of the averages or highest score feature with showing all or last submission, we are going to remove it.

column1: [SAK-1995] question scores/stats mixups
column6:
http://coursework-s1.stanford.edu:29080
built from SAKAI TRUNK - Sakai 2.1.0 in progress
(verified in mysql)

Found by Lydia. The Question Scores and Statistics screens in grading sometimes refer to the wrong assessment.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Make sure you have at least one published assessment with real submissions (at least one person took the assessment, answered at least some of the questions, and submitted for grading.)

2) Publish a new assessment to anonymous users.

3) Take the assessment via the published url but do NOT answer any questions. Submit the empty assessment for grading.

5) Go back to the main authoring page. Click on the "Scores" link for the new anonymous assessment (the one created in step 2.)

6) You'll see the total score page for that assessment. There should be no links to question scores or statistics on this screen, because no questions were answered and there's no data to display.

7) Go back to the main authoring page and this time click on the "Scores" link for the first assessment (mentioned in step 1). Look at the total scores, the question scores and the statistics screens.

8) Go back to the main authoring page and click the "Scores" link for the anonymous assessment again (the one created in step 2). Now it has a question scores link and a statistics link!

9) When you click on these links, either Sakai throws an "unable to call QuestionScores" exception, or it displays the question scores page for the first assessment (the one from step 1). You can see the wrong name at the top of the page.

catalina.out log entries are attached. (but not the exception - I can try and reproduce that again if you need it.)

Lydia - I think the creator as owner thing had more to do with question pools than editing existing assessments. However, we probably never made it explicit that anyone with maintain should be able to edit questions either.

If we did let any maintain edit items, would that be a mismatch with how QP ownership works?
column80: Question pools are scoped by person, so userA will not see pools created by userB. However, as far as being able to modify an item, if userA can't see userB's pool, he/she won't be able to modify/delete items in poolB.

column1: [SAK-1990] Import/export:  qtype prepended to text in delivery
column6:
When I export an assessment and then import it (to any instance) and then take it as a student, the question type for each question is stuck in there before the text. The assessment is still takeable (yay!) but it doesn't look very good and is confusing. See the screenshot for an example.

column10: Import/export:  qtype prepended to text in delivery
column19: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
column41: I can repro in preview. This makes it a little easier to test as I can stay logged in as admin.
column45:
This was one of those cases where you could rightly say where was the bug located? OK right, blame poor old import.

Turns out there is an item description field. This is displayed in the delivery UI. Trouble is, it was never set in authoring, but it was in import.

So
a. the UI should have had whitespace if we used this field.
b. import and authoring should treat this consistently

Now, there is a purpose in setting the imported question title string as a question description, because not all other QTI applications set the title to the item type, so this data would be displayed.

This is a nitpicky detail we can work out later. For now, I have commented out the field.

Fix details:
I suppressed an unneeded field that gets set in import but never in authoring. Fix revision 1628.

column1: [SAK-1970] <sakaix:inputDate> tag label text is inaccurate

the <sakaix:inputDate> generates the following html:
mm/dd/yy <input> <javscript date picker>

the label text says that the year should be in the format yy, but actually it needs to be in yyyy.
the date picker puts in a date with the correct yyyy format.
you can enter a date manually in the input box as well with yyyy.

so, just the label text needs to be changed.

column1: [SAK-1968] Default title should be file name not file path & name
column6:
In Resources, when I upload a document prior to entering a title, the title is automatically entered for me as the path & file

(eg, C:\Documents and Settings\Kim\My Documents\My Pictures\London\Riverdance.jpg )

I like how the title is automatically filled in, that is a convenience. However, I think it would make more sense to have the default title just be the file name:

(eg, Riverdance.jpg )

-Kim
column10: Default title should be file name not file path & name

column1: [SAK-1967] SAMigo does not compile; missing xalan.jar dependency
column6:
C:\java\projects\legacy\tools\src\java\org\sakaiproject\tool\content\ResourcesAction.java:2752: cannot find symbol

For some odd reason the code does not compile on Windows but does on UNIX? Anyway, by adding a dependency on xalan.jar in project.xml it clears the problem up. I don't think this will hurt anything so I am going to commit it.

column1: [SAK-1966] Resources tool for admin fails / Reference getRealms() fail for bad references
column6:
Partially introduced by the fix to SAK-1860 Closed (r1509), and partly there all along, if the Reference.java is given a bad reference, and then asked for the realms, it throws NPE.

This now causes the resources tool to fail when working witih the admin's resource setup (homed at the root of content hosting) when it needs to ask the pubview questions.

column1: [SAK-1965] Restore cut/paste functionality to Resources tool
column6:
The current Resources tool no longer has the cut/paste functionality that was in the pre-2.0 version. This is a critical feature (particularly during the early weeks of the semester, for course sites).

Currently, there is Duplicate and Copy actions for each resource. At UM, we replaced Copy with Cut. It performs the same way as the Copy feature, with two changes: The destination resource has the original label instead of "Copy of X" and it deletes the original resource. If users still want to copy a resource, they can first duplicate it, and cut/paste the duplicate.

This would also be a good feature to be able to do in bulk, along with delete ( SAK-1254 Closed )
column10: Restore cut/paste functionality to Resources tool

column1: [SAK-1963] Not checking for obsolete assignment data in getPointsEarnedSortedGradeRecords
column6: GradeManagerHibernateImpl getPointsEarnedSortedGradeRecords(gradableObject) checks the "isRemoved" property of the input object, and takes its word on whether the assignment is deleted or not. It should instead rely on the database to decide that.

column1: [SAK-1962] Sort users in bulk move operations
column6: In bulk-user-move operations such as assigning students and TAs to a section, the add and remove buttons should keep the users sorted in some way (TBD). This will be either new additions on top in alpha order (everyone else alpha sorting), new additions on top in last-in-first-out (everyone else alpha sorting), or some other scheme.
